Although tolerable when room temperature, chilled Vita Coco Coconut Water with Pineapple with a sprig of mint is so much tastier and refreshing. Yum!
reviews.review_header: Packs a tasty and healthy punch

reviews.review_text: This stuff is sugary sweet garbage! It's sweetened but you would never know from their boxes or advertising They are deceptive and dishonest!!

Don't be fooled. This is not pure coconut water like the label says it is. The ingredients are: Coconut water, less than 1% natural fruit sugar and vitamin C. And it tastes bad! I bought this for the price and thought it was as labeled: pure coconut water. I'll be paying more and going back to Nirvana.
reviews.review_header: This is not pure coconut water like the label says it is

reviews.review_text: I know some people say coconut water is over hyped, but I like it. I like the taste and find it refreshing. If I drink a container of this before a workout, I do feel that my endurance is a little better. Is it real or placebo? Dunno. But either way, I get a better workout. The only drawback to this stuff is that it's expensive. Way more than Powerade or Gatorade. But I suppose the fact that it's mainly natural is worth a little more. I've tried all the flavors and keep coming back to the plain coconut. The flavors are a nice variety but I think they make it too sweet and the flavors tend to mask the coconut taste.
reviews.review_header: Good stuff, my go-to for coconut water.

reviews.review_text: This is a good price compared to several types of coconut water that I have looked at including this same brand at other stores. It tastes really good and the containers are durable and recyclable. I have been drinking these before soccer games and it really helps keep you hydrated much better than gatorade! The high potassium (620mg) and low calories (60 per bottle) are a nice combination. It also has 100% of your daily vitamin C.

I'm not really sure what this is supposed to taste like but I've had coconut water from REAL coconuts and I didn't think it tasted bad. This stuff is gross and almost impossible to stomach it. The taste very bad in my opinion. I could only get it down by adding some sweetener to it. I'd avoid this product. Absolutely not worth it and as others mentioned here, returning it probably cost more than the product is worth. Bottom line: I'd avoid this. ALSO - It says 100% Pure Coconut Water yet the ingredients show additions such as vitamin C and sweetener (1%) - 99% pure isn't 100% Pure - clearly mislabeled and misrepresentative of what the actual product is.

I ordered this coconut water for my 5 month old Goddaughter. She sucks it up so much i had to get it on subscribe and save. We use it for her in place of juice. its a much healthier replacement. Her parents have stopped buying pedialyte as this is a more natural alternative. I can see a difference in her since she has started the vitacoco. She no longer suffers the horibble gas that kept her up all night and has stopped craving so much milk. I will always have this on sibscribe and save. love it so much i just started a second subscribe and save for my house.

Like the taste more than Zico(which is a bit nuttier). Very refreshing and I find it helps prevent cramping both before and after long runs due to better electrolyte content. Outperforms my Gatorade Propel water though I still enjoy that on bike rides - coconut water tastes better very cold and the propel is more tolerable when it warms with ice.

I love coconut water, but it is stil pricy to get in bj without coupon. I got this one Less than $11, which is a good deal for me. Now I m almost done with the water. Waiting for the next deal to come so I can order more
reviews.review_header: Yummy , great when you r thirsty

reviews.review_text: It's been 1 month I bought this product.This is the best coconut water in the market. Lots of people only look for sugar but they forget about sodium. This one has very less sodium and lots of potassium. I generally drink 1/2 a bottle a day. Just 25% of the bottle after my workout because it rehydrates my body. I am buying it again.

I'm so glad I stumbled on this coconut water! I ride my bike in the Florida heat frequently and this has led to some serious dehydration. I do drink water (but can't drink too much since I don't want to have to worry about the bathroom when I'm in the middle of nowhere!) and I'm not into sugary junky Gatorade style drinks. I purchased a case from Amazon and signed up for the subscription, which brings the price way down compared to purchasing at my local health food store. I now drink one before I leave on any type of excursion in the sun like biking, kayaking, etc. and so far it seems to have helped. I also happen to love the taste, I find it really light and refreshing but I will caution you to try it before ordering a case of it. I've had many friends taste it and they did not see how I could even drink it! So, it's all a matter of preference... Even my 12yr old son swipes these from me, but keep in mind that we're not accustomed to sweet drinks and usually drink unsweetened iced teas or water. If you're used to sodas and sugary sports drinks, you might not like this since it has a unique and very mild taste. Personally I'm hooked on these, I think they're so refreshing and delish!

Not sure about the sugar...? It is the highest in sugar among everything I eat, so this scares me. *Really upset about these. I have 3 cases and I feel like an idiot for buying them. This product contains added sugar... I would have loved if you guys could have just kept it PURE coconut water... :( not cool.

If you go to the grocery store and look at these on the shelf you'll notice they come from different countries. My mom is from the Philippines, and the ones that are bottled there (I've managed to buy some, same brand), do taste just like fresh coconut water that's just been harvested from the tree. We were there last summer visiting family. I love this stuff because it reminds me of my grandparents farm. Bottles will vary in flavor, like buying oranges from the store, some a naturally sweeter than others. I use the amazon subscribe and save feature and have these shipped to me monthly. This is one of the few healthy things that my husband will drink, otherwise its sweet tea or Dr. Pepper (we're from Texas). If I'm lucky the pack lasts a week. I've been receiving these for a few months, and have had no issues with stale/rotten shipments. I would really like if they offered the slightly larger 16.9oz bottles in 12 packs for subscribe and save. I would swap over to that without any hesitation.
reviews.review_header: Monthly Order, tastes fresh from the farm

reviews.review_text: every bottle tastes different, its so wired, yesterday i tried to drink one but it was bitter, and today it tastes lnot sweet, its a bad feeling. and sometimes when its delivering, the bottles would be broken or damaged, hope they make better bottles to contain those coconut water. tried so many coconut bottle water, this is the best I can find, jesus, great taste, fragile bottle
reviews.review_header: and today it tastes lnot sweet, its a bad

reviews.review_text: When i received this box at my door, i noticed the box looked all beat up. Nope. It was wet. One of the containers had leaked out, causing not only all the other drinks needed to be rinsed off, but my other purchases in the box where wet too. Thankfully it was just some clothes which had been bagged. However, there is no excuse for these containers to have opened. 2 of the 12 cans had the plastic top bent forward, the one that leaked, and one other one that i will have to cut the corner off of. Other than the packaging, nothing was wrong. I see people are complaining about the expiration date, but mine purchased in march 2014, doesnt expire till this july, taste is just like what i buy in the store too. However, i will not be purchasing this item again. I paid for 12, not 11 and a soggy box.

Being in the central US without access to a supply of fresh coconut water, I was very happy to come across VitaCoco. I tried several brands and in the end, I believe it had the better taste of them all. I compared Goya (awful) and Naked brand. Naked was a very close second, but overall, the price and availability of VitaCoco, plus the slightly better taste was a total win. The water taste like a young, fresh coconut on the verge of starting to develop the 'jelly' on the inside. What I would describe as slightly 'green'. Green doesn't mean tasting like an unripe banana, just that it is missing that slightly sweeter hint of a perfect coconut, one that has about 1/8 - 1/4 inch of gelatinous coconut flesh on the inside. Well before the stage of getting that hard, white coconut 'meat'. The flavor is quite consistent across cases. I still rate it 5 stars, even though I wish it had that slightly more perfected flavor of the perfect coconut. Perhaps there are packaging reasons this cannot be achieved. In the meantime, I get to enjoy my island beverage of choice, and even use it as a mixer at times. Lovely.

I have been purchasing Vita Coco at the store for years, but found it to be much cheaper through Amazon. I was cautious due to several bad reviews, so I started by pouring it into a cup each time. The product appeared clear and tastes great. I ordered 40 bottles and have had no issues with the bottles of Vita Coco I purchased through Amazon.

Coconut water took me a while to develop a taste for. At first it just seemed like some butter melted in water, without much that I would call flavor. That being said, once you get used to it it's good, low in calories, and very high in potassium. Some brands are better than others, and this one is one of my favorites. I still suggest serving it chilled, or use it instead of water in smoothies (coconut water and frozen mango make a killer, and super healthy smoothie).

Though I know that Vita Coco is not the most "nutrient rich" coconut water, it still helps me with hydration and I personally can feel the difference. I had a dehydration headache and I kept drinking water, had one of these and the headache was gone in minutes. Really happy with this purchase. Will be buying again. Annnd, this is my next time buying. Ditto. Great product, truly does help me out.

Not as good as some coconut water brands, at least by my opinion (C2O is my favorite). This was on sale recently and I bought 4 cases. Unfortunately the paper tetra paks aren't very sturdy, so combined with the heavy package, I lost about 25% of them due to damage. Perhaps that was why it was on sale?
reviews.review_header: Risk of package damage or shipped damaged goods.

reviews.review_text: I have to admit that I am not too experienced with coconut water, but over the last year I've discovered it on restaurant menus and have picked it up a few times from the store. I have not compared Vita Coco to other brands out there, but I certainly do enjoy Vita Coco. Yesterday I compared the plain Vita Coco to the pineapple flavored Vita Coco and definitely prefer plain. The pineapple flavor made the coconut water taste a little sour, while the plain variety has just the right amount of sweetness mixed in with the taste of electrolytes. My only complaints are with the price and packaging. If you don't catch this on a good sale, it can be a bit pricey. Also, the Tetra Pak bottle makes it almost impossible to get the last teaspoon. I look like an idiot with my head to the sky shaking a Vita Coco attached to my mouth just to get the last few drops. However, if you squeeze and collapse the sides just right it funnels the last bit right to your mouth. I'd definitely recommend Vita Coco. Hope this review was helpful. Enjoy!

I don't know if it's just me, but there seems to be a difference in the taste of Vita Coco Coconut water depending on which country the coconut water was produced in--possibly; some could just be spoiled. The ones from Brazil taste pretty decent. However, I got some from Amazon that's labeled as produced in the Philippines and the coconut water as a slight oniony taste to it. At first first sip it was sort of, "Hmm, what the heck was that? The coconut water doesn't seem brown and spoiled like some Amazon buyers have reported." Then, as I drink more and try to pay more attention to the taste, that's when I can't stop noticing the accompanying taste of onion with each sip. Sniff the water? Yep, slight odor of onion. I still can't decide if that's just how the ones from the Philippines taste and smell due to the coconuts used there or if the ones I got might be slightly spoiled.
reviews.review_header: The ones from Brazil taste pretty decent. However

reviews.review_text: Delivered fine. Same as grocery store sells. Its a small case of 12 small containers, very easy to store, cool, carry and consume. This brand isn't the most flavorful of the many coconut waters I've tried, but I mix in a little bit of mango juice, so it's fine. Low on calories, and sugar, which are important to this buyer. WAY BETTER than orange juice which is acidic and mostly sugar. Good replacement for those looking for a mild beverage to replace other sugary, high caloric drinks.
reviews.review_header: Decent Buy For Low Sugar, Low Calorie, Portable Beverage

reviews.review_text: I wish all products were as straightforward as Vita Coco. From the fun, minimally plastic packaging which makes me feel like less of a monster than I already do (USA), to the consistent refreshing nectar that lies within, I could not be more pleased to have these in my fridge when coming off the gross end of a bender. I do not care for Coconut water/drinks that add sugar and I couldn't be more pleased that the inclusion of this pack on Amazon saves me the shame of going to a 7-11 and paying more for a recovery drink while being judged by the person behind the counter (rightfully so, I might add). So while VC may be enabling my horrible lifestyle choices, I take respite in the moment when I reach in for one of these little bricks of oasis and imagine what life would be like on a tropical island with a Skipper, maybe a couple of millionaires and the rest.

The difficulty in ranking coconut water is: what is it supposed to taste like? I live in Thailand where we cut open and drink fresh coconuts, and those just off the tree taste sweet. When you get one that has been out in the sun longer it tastes less sweet or sometimes even bitter. This taste resembles in between those two to me. If at home I got a coconut that tastes like this from a vendor I'd not go back to that vendor again. In the US it is a bit more difficult though because we're dealing with packaged/bottled coconut water so is never going to taste super fresh. But for many reviewers, maybe this is just what coconut water tastes like to them, hence all the good reviews. To me personally, when visiting the US, a brand I can tolerate is Taste Nirvana Real Coconut Water. It is not perfect but tastes far better than this brand here.
reviews.review_header: Does Not Taste Good or Fresh

reviews.review_text: I love this coconut water. I am currently pregnant and have been drinking a bottle of this a day since the beginnijg of my second trimester. The juice is lightly sweet and may be a bit of an acquired taste. First time I had it I wasn't too fond of the taste because it didn't feel sweet enough. After a couple days I got used to the taste though. Coconut water's suppose to be good for you as well so that's an added bonus. Would definitely recommend Vita Coco.

Great stuff. Used to consume lots of Gatorade during the heat, but this is much much better. Switched to coconut water because I wanted natural electrolytes. This stuff works great and I feel better when I'm not putting chemicals in my body. Got a different brand once last summer and got sick. Checked the ingredient label. Sure enough, it wasn't 100% natural. I think the chemical preservatives made me sick. I'm ok with a natural, plant based, organic preservative like citric acid or something like that, but leave out the chemicals please! Those are not food.... This is a great price right now too! We also use another all natural brand. but since this brand was the best price, and our family consumes a lot, I decided to try it. It tastes just like the other brand, and does just as well.

I had read there was a difference in taste across brands... so when I found this great price for Vita Coco , I tryed it head to head with a bottle of Zico I had from a previous order. Very similar flavor - but definitely prefer the Vita Coco better - has a brighter, crisp, fresh taste - less murky-blandness that I notice in Coconut water. Figured it out i think... it has 100% of your daily vitamin C, while zico has zero. The vitamin C is added, which i think is what gives it a little bit of 'zip' to balance a bit of the buttery smoothness (blandness) of the coco water. So overall a very nice option for natural potassium & electrolyte source at just 60 calories per bottle! I am often low on potassium intake so a little bit here and there is helpful.
reviews.review_header: so when I found this great price for Vita Coco

reviews.review_text: I got hooked on this coconut water quickly. It's the perfect size to take to work, the taste is very good and it's a refreshingly health drink to keep hydrated during the day. I'm on my feet at work for eight hours a day and feel that the electrolytes contained in the drink is helping with my energy level. If you are desiring to hydrate your body with healthy fluids, I would highly recommend this brand of coconut water. Having 18% of potassium is another attraction. Pay attention to what you are consuming...check out the "Nutritional Facts" printed on everything! Also, one container contains only 1% sodium. After trying this drink out, I ordered a case of it for the pantry. If you are looking to get hooked on a healthy drink, this is it!
reviews.review_header: It's the perfect size to take to work

reviews.review_text: I have traveled and or worked in several places that naturally grow coconut trees and find the Vita Coco the closest thing to the actual fresh juice water of the young coconuts. I have been drinking coco water for years without really knowing it was great for you...and I mean really great for you. I just liked the semi sweet refreshing taste and was readily available where I normally was. Recently, as I age and became more interested in healthy foods, I belatedly found out how great these waters were for you. In fact, in World War II, the soldiers sometimes used coco waters for blood plasma transfusions as the minerals in coco were so closely matched to the needs of a human being. Anyways, possibly due to the increasing demand, this brand comes from several countries in my consumption experience - Brazil, Philippines, Indonesia. I find I like the Philippines and Indonesian ones the best tasting but that's just my preference for a sweeter taste. I highly recommend you give this a try.
reviews.review_header: Best packaged coco water that I know.

reviews.review_text: I have been a huge fan of coconut water and Vita Coco is definitely the closest brand I've tasted that feels like it's straight from a fresh coconut. A lot of other brands either from concentrate or taste a bit off. It tastes fine both room temperature and refrigerated. I have only tried the pure coconut water flavor. I purchased the 11.1 Ounce Containers in a pack of 12. They arrived on time and in a cute box with a lid that I used to store them. I have no problem with the container or the plastic drinking attachment. Drinking coconut water has a lot of positive properties. Having drank mostly Vita Coco when seeking these benefits, I can honestly say that I am a huge fan. It works. Whenever I come home from a hot, dry day, a few sips soothe my throat and re-energizes me. During the day, it keeps me more hydrated than an entire bottle of water. The only reason I'm giving this product a review of 4/5 stars is because for a few containers I experienced leakage. This occurred when the product is more than half-way finished and some water would leak out between the box container and the plastic lip. I can only assume that the glue securing the attachment was either not strong enough of the water softens the container enough to loosen its grip. Either way, this shouldn't happen. I have purchased the same exact product from Costco and that never happened once. I'm not exactly sure why this happens, but when it does, I just rip it completely off and drink straight from the box. This isn't a huge problem for me personally, but I hope it doesn't happen again when I buy my next batch.

Great deal. Product works as intended as it is drinkable. Based on reviews of others, some enjoy the taste, others do not. Try one from your local supermarket before buying this large package. If you like it this package is a great deal. It is high in potassium and it actually does hydrate you quickly.
reviews.review_header: Hydrates you quickly and tastes good.

reviews.review_text: I jumped on the coconut water bandwagon a year or so ago after hearing about all the health benefits. I am now a lifelong fan. Coconut water will keep you hydrated better than water, and it doesn't have any extra junk in it like the sports drinks do. I take this stuff with me everywhere - to yoga, the gym, and even put one in my bag for when I go out to the bars (this stuff works wonders for hangovers, too!). My boyfriend suffers from leg cramps, which can be attributed to dehydration. He started drinking this stuff on my recommendation and his legs no longer wake him up in the night. I also buy it for my breast-feeding sister, who has trouble staying hydrated. I tried all different brands and flavors, and this one is by far the best. It's only a tad bit more expensive than other brands, but it's worth every extra penny. It even comes in a handy little screw-top carton which makes for easy transport. It's like a little miracle juice :-)
reviews.review_header: The best coconut water out there!

reviews.review_text: Opened one of the bottles today. Took a sip tasted horrible. Went to pour it out and it was brown and something hard was in it. I don't even want to know what it was. It's past the return window else I would return it. I don't think I will ever buy this again.
reviews.review_header: Was brown and something was in it.

reviews.review_text: This is the worst water I’ve tried. It didn’t have any coconut flavor at all. I read the reviews & some said it was to sweet. It isn’t sweet at all. Taste like nasty water. I am so disappointed. I would have been better off if I have just gotten pedialite for the electrolytes.

When I trained for my last Boston Marathon, I used coconut water on my long training runs. It is natural and replaces electrolyes lost during training. It does this without the added sugars of lots of sport drinks. It is easy on my stomach. If I wanted it sweeter I would put in a little honey. I also use this water as a base for fruit smoothies. I love the single sevring size for that. Just perfect smoothie size. Chris Wodke Author: Running for My Life, Winning for CMT

This stuff makes me smile. Don't go in expecting sweet tooth satisfying treats. It is the real deal here ladies and gentleman: Coconut Water. Slight sweetness, and very quenching and satiating. It took me a few packages to get used to but if you stick it out, this stuff is rewarding. It's an odd taste at first, this is true, and its definitely best if drank cold. It's like a natural Gatorade. I just had to look Gatorade up on th internet, I had forgotten what it was after having been drinking this stuff for so long now. I drink this stuff after a CrossFit workout, a run, and even when I have a hangover, which was every weekend for awhile haha. This is the euphoric elixir, the juice of jumping, the water of wealth, the drink of delight, the liquid of life. Have some and smile. :)

Better than Zico tetrapak but that last sip tastes off (like carton taste almost) every time. At 1st I thought it was just a fluke but 4 cartons later its the same thing every time. With only 11.1 oz in these, I don't like that the last sip either needs to be left behind or endure the 'off' taste. I won't be buying this again.
reviews.review_header: Beware of 'tetrapak' taste leeching in! Tastes decent enough but not worth the smaller 11.1oz cost.

reviews.review_text: One of my favorite all-time hot drinks is half coco water, half boiling water, with Better than Bouillion chicken flavor and lemon juice to taste. This combination cuts what I experience as a cloying quality of undiluted coco water yet makes the broth infinitely more tasty and healthful…
reviews.review_header: I use coco water with broth concentrate, hot water and lemon juice for insanely good broth

reviews.review_text: I have been drinking 100% coconut water for years, well before it became the fashion. decided to give this "fancy" one a try, and it just tastes sour. Coconut water should not taste like this, I drink plenty of brands mostly picked up in a couple stores near me that import Asian foods. Also this stuff costs too much. I can buy good quality stuff for a lot less, although I am sure when you are sweating it out at the gym you might not feel as "cool" without branding. anyway, good luck to those who enjoy this one, it tastes wrong to me and i have drank the sugar loaded ones, the mixed ones 100% pure coconut water ones etc. also I notice that it contains added Vitamin C , I guess the process destroys it and it has to be added back, perhaps the source of that V c is causing the taste or maybe it was just a funky nut. either way I have about another 20 of these to get through and they are not so bad that I would not drink them , just there is better tasting out there and cheaper too. update, still not great but drank some the other day and it was better...

Of course nothing is like drinking coconut water straight from the coconut itself, but for the convenience here in these un-recyclable Tetra Paks; it has been rather gratifying. I do want to bring attention that I did have one bad apple. I have purchased three of these sets, one vita coco 12 pack 11.1 fl oz and two vita coco 12 packs 16.9 fl oz. Out of all of them, there was ONE 11.1 fl oz with the marking of Lot: 3013AX Best Before: 12 Jan 14 11:19:15 which gave me a rotting taste. I took a full gulp. questions it. took another sip, I spit it out, shook it up, and tried another sip, same sour taste, threw it out. Otherwise, I've been very satisfied with this product. I would've given it a 5. Thanks, Morris
reviews.review_header: Pretty good, taste is close, but one bad one

reviews.review_text: it tastes pretty good. i tried some once while my wife was out of town in greece when i sent her for vacation from doing nothing at home while i was at work all day working and coming home to clean and do everything she was too busy playing online to do. when my wife came back from vacation and i went to work out on my weekend and came back and started drinking one she flipped out on me for drinking HER vita coco that i bought for her. im sure she would get a lot more benefit from it if she would work out then use it to replenish, but she doesnt. from my limited time spent enjoying it, it was great.
I normally like the taste of this, but over half of the cartons I’ve opened so far have tasted bad (like rotten). I’m going back to Zico brand, which I’ve never had a problem with.

Hello shoppers, I just wanted to stop by and tell you about my experience with Vita Coconut Water. This is by far the best drink I have ever tasted. Between this product and regular drinking water I have always managed to stay hydrated. Water is the number one drink to stay hydrated but with this product, Hydration is just as easy. Give it a try and enjoy.
reviews.review_header: Vita Coconut Water is great for staying hydrated.

reviews.review_text: When I received my order of Vita Coco "100% pure coconut water", I opened one, took a big swig and immediately noticed an odd, slightly sour or tart taste I've never tasted in coconut water before. It was subtle, but noticeable. I looked at the ingredients and saw that the package contains coconut water and vitamin C. I'm not sure how you can claim a product is 100% pure coconut water when you have added something to it. Now, vitamin C isn't harmful of course, but why would they add anything to it in the first place? Other than that, the taste is acceptable. It's not as fresh-tasting as water straight from the coconut, but I suppose it would be unrealistic to expect packaged juice to taste exactly like fresh. I am going to try a different brand and make a comparison.

This brand tastes weird. I started drinking coconut water 8 months ago and it has made a huge difference in my health. I used to get allot of migraine headaches. I think I tend to get dehydrated easy. I didn't realize this. Water doesn't do the trick, perhaps because I don't like water and I have to drink allot. Or maybe because water has no nutrients. Whatever the reason, I drink coconut water everyday now. I also drink a cup or two before bedtime and I have less headaches now. It is my drink of choice during sports as well. I fill my sports bottle either 1/4 or 1/2 way with coconut water and the rest with filtered water. At the gym it gives me more bang for my buck and it seems to SOOTHE MY TUMMY. Water often gives me a tummy ache. I can drink less volume and get more endurance. However, I had been drinking the O.N.E. brand. I just got this brand with Amazon (vito coco) and I am disappointed in the taste. It tastes so bad that I thought I got a bad batch, but in ordering more, I see it is the brand. Where the O.N.E. brand went down easy, this VC brand makes me pucker. I don't know why. You would think coconut water is all the same right? If you are new to coconut water and tried this brand first and don't like it - shop another brand before you give up. It really is a healthy beverage that I think more people should drink, instead of all those sports drinks with chemicals in them.
I've ordered from this seller before, but this batch was defective. It tasted like syrup. I am frustrated by the fact that I can't exchange the pack of 12 for a non-defective pack.
It's an unpleasant taste, flavor and the consistency, well let me just say, we didn't like it at all.

I love coconut water and finally ordered some even though they are expensive as I was buying them in singles at the grocery store which was more expensive anyway. I love this brand and the drink is so refreshing and the size is perfect for packing with lunch.
I love these. Some people hate coconut water, but I've always found the taste so refreshing and they are good food breastfeeding moms to increase their supply as well.
reviews.review_header: I love these. Some people hate coconut water

reviews.review_text: It as close to fresh as I have found. It is a great way to start hydrated and isn't as sweet as some of the other products I have tried!
reviews.review_header: Great natural way to stay hydrated!

reviews.review_text: I drink a box almost everyday it helps me with my fibromyalgia it helps come down my Charlie horses and cramping muscles. If I wake up with major chariehorses my husband gets me a coconut water I drink it down quickly and eat a half of a banana. Coconut water helps me make it through my days and nights with less leg, arms, hands, upper and lower back, shoulder, neck and foot cramps. It works for me thank goodness.

I was very happy with the taste and freshness of this coconut water.I prefer the raw coconut water , but due to my working and living situation it is very inconvenient to obtain. Thru amazon I can order this delightful drink and have it conveniently delivered to my door. I plan on continually ordering this brand as it is convenient and cheaper than buying bottles individually at the convenience store near my job.

I love this coconut water. I just started actually liking it and brand does matter. I tried fresh coconut water and liked it so I decided since Wawa was giving them away for free, I'd give it a try. I really enjoyed the regular and the kind with pineapple mixed in it. I the. Tried the Costco brand kind since it was on sale and I didn't like it nearly as much. Even my 3 year old could tell a difference. I'll stick with this brand.

Great taste! I started buying coconut water because I wanted to increase my potassium intake. This coconut water has plenty of potassium in one bottle to kick off my mornings. It doesn't have that weird after taste of lower quality coconut waters.

Great tasting, one of the highest sources of potassium, electrolytes and did I mention it tastes great? The packaging is very "green" and easy to chill, light to carry and dispose of. Seriously, I drink this CoConut water to revitalize me. Now maybe it's a "placebo" effect, but I know from spending some time in India, along the rural roads going from city to city, people will stop off the side of the road and purchase fresh coconuts that the vendor has chopped the top off of and refresh their bodies by sticking a straw in the opening and consuming the liquid. My friend who lived their (he just moved to Saudi Arabia) told me that coconut water helps the body fight off the effects of the heat and refreshes the individual when they spend a day in the sun and heat. Well millions of people from India can't be wrong! I find that it helps me as a sport drink and I don't have to worry about the salt. Like I said, I may just be psyching myself into believing it or it really is benefitting me. All I know is I definitely feel better, refreshed and when in the heat, much more able to stave off the solar effects. You know, even if their was no health benefit, I would be drawn to drink it because I am a sucker for what tastes good. The bodily benefits are a real pleasant "plus" which does not always happen when consuming something that we think tastes good enough to be a "guilty pleasure". I've also heard that this brand does not take the water from several different cocnuts from different locations and "mix" them together to try to make it taste good. What you get is the real thing, not a concentrate that is rehydrated. Oh well, treat yourself and do your own experiments and see if you feel better having this drink in your daily diet. Medically speaking, some people have the notion that because coconut "meat" (the white stuff in the coconut) is high in fat and cholesterol that this product might have those negative effects. In reality, when drinking coconut WATER, (not COCONUT MILK -that's for cooking, primarily), as I was saying before interrupting myself, COCONUT WATER actually LOWERS bad cholesterol. Pretty cool! Have fun with your own exploration. PS: One of my friends thinks a carton of the drink would taste great as a mixer with a shot of rum in it. (or a little less than shot.) That will have to wait till I get back from Jamaica with another bottle of that fine drink - yum!!
reviews.review_header: coo coo for CoCo Nut Water

reviews.review_text: I love Vita Coco, and I love this company even more now that I know they are on the "good list" as far as being ethical. Vita Coco gets their coconuts from the Philippines, where they do not use monkeys to retrieve their coconuts. In Thailand monkeys are used and abused in their practices, you can find out more online. Any coconut related product where they get their coconuts from Thailand is unethical. Please do not support them. That being said, stock up on your Vita-Coco!

Great price for quantity of product. I use this in making my own coconut creamer as well as drinking when I am feeling dehydrated and water is just not enough. Has a great taste and I like that the packaging can be recycled. I had recently purchased one of the flavored types at a local store and it had tasted "off", so when I contacted the company, they were quite concerned and remedied the issue and provided coupons for a replacement product. This purchase was made after using the coupons at the local store.
reviews.review_header: Excellent taste and quantity for price

reviews.review_text: 06/04/2019 - Vita Coco Organic is probably the best quality coconut water for the price. The box I just received, however has an expiration date of 07Aug2019. That's basically two months. It's a expiration window that one would expect from Harmless Harvest which is a product that must remain refrigerated - a perishable item. For comparison, the previous order of Vita Coco received 02Sep2018 had an expiration date of 03Jun2019. Two months vs nine months. So, the question becomes, what condition was it warehoused in for over half a year?

I'm really disappointed. I should have read the questions and answers before buying this but I went buy the pictures of the ingredients and nutritional information instead. I opened my first one today and glanced at the nutritional information and realized it has 15g of sugar! This is not what I thought I was getting. I thought I was getting 5g. So sad that the whole case will go to waste and I wasted my money.
reviews.review_header: I'm really disappointed. I should have read the questions and answers ...

reviews.review_text: I lived very close to a coconut palm tree plantation, had hundreds of coconuts opened with a machete after taking them out from a bucket filled with ice blocks, the water of this product is the same I used to drink. The water inside the fruit is the best water on earth, refreshing with a lite taste of coconut. This product provides that.
reviews.review_header: Flavor, is great, and natural, lite and refreshing. You can’t have on regular plain bottle water.

reviews.review_text: I bought a 12 pk. The lids/caps are breaking off the boxes with the lightest touch. I bought these for drinks for seminars and I can't use them because caps broken off. The box is still sealed but trying to open/drink without the proper opening is a mess.

Great value, very mild tasting. Does a very nice job in green smoothies to add a little extra electrolytes and cuts down on the need for so much orange juice. I really like the size too. When I used to lift weights and hit the gym hardcore I drank this product with some chocolate protein powder as a post workout drink. When I was getting muscle cramps coconut water really helped get me some extra potassium.
reviews.review_header: Very mild tasting, great value and nice size

reviews.review_text: This coconut water brand tastes the best, and is the only coconut water I actually enjoy drinking more than water/other drinks. I crave this after every workout session, and this is because coconut water replenishes electrolytes... It's the best thirst-quencher I know. Tastes best after chilling in the fridge. These also come in the perfect size to carry around the house/outside.
reviews.review_header: This coconut water brand tastes the best, and is the only coconut water I actually ...

reviews.review_text: Vita Coco Organic Coconut water is my favorite. Ive tasted almost all the brands and this is the winner. I love the taste and its such a healthy drink. I have at least one a day.
reviews.review_header: Besides being good quality, the taste in coconut water is important to me.

reviews.review_text: Coconut water was like bit brown color and different taste too, I didn't pay much attention. Thought it's normal, when I bought it from Walmart very recently then understood product was not fresh and may be spoiled.
It does not taste like the one (same brand) in stores. I hate the taste of this one. I think it is a different product entirely
reviews.review_header: I think this is a fake

reviews.review_text: Love the product but the shipping was terrible this time, not typical. They weren’t leaking but definitely would have if they had been made cheaply, crushed all of them partially.

The only thing better than this is if you cut the coconut off the tree and drink its juice right after that. This is as close as you can get to fresh coconut water. Whole frozen coconut from some oriental restaurant or groceries don't even come lose to Vita Coco coconut water. THere are negative reviews, and I don't understand why. I guess you have to come from the tropical part of the world to appreciate this. I gave it 4 stars because it is a little bit expensive. It is almost 2 bucks per drink, if you pay the regular Amazon price. Out in the store probably even more expensive. I got it from Amazon to try out on Gold box deal and it already cost $15 for a case of 12. Well, you got to pay for a good thing I guess. But it is definitely good tasting and I will buy it again.

I drink at least 1 11.2 oz Vita CoCo every day in order to keep myself hydrated, it also keeps me from cramping during exercise Its much better than the poisons of gatorade or powerade or any other artificial sports drink for that matter. It has the simplicity of one ingredient; that is actually much better at accomplishing hydration than the big money (pepsico's gatorade and coca cola's powerade )sports drinks provide. If you doubt this just read the ingredients in the leading sports drinks and you'll probably need a scientist to truly understand what you're putting into your body. Of all the various coconut waters I find Vita Coco the most delicious with the best consistency compared to the other brands. I also experienced a poor aftertaste when I tried the Zico Brand that does not occur when I sip on the bounty from nature that is Vita Coco.
reviews.review_header: delicious and nutritious - natural not lab food

reviews.review_text: VITA-COCO doesn't come chilled, so when I first tasted it, it wasn't pleasing to my palate. Tasted like cardboard, to be honest. But once chilled properly, VITA-COCO has a taste all its own, and it IS pleasing. I would heartily recommend VITA-COCO to anyone seeking an alternative to sports drinks.

We are regularly getting nasty boxes of coconut water. . Boxes that are very bad .. undrinkable .. examples include yellowed water, broken boxes, heavily worn boxes, signs of mold and one package was so brown and gross we took photos ... we no longer drink directly from the box .. we now pour every box into a glass. . I just poured out 3 boxes of yellow fluid and threw the boxes away .. we are considering it is too too dangerous to continue this ... just tossed out 2 more .. here is a photo. . No this in not ginger ale ..this is creepy
reviews.review_header: ... are regularly getting nixes of coconut water that are bad.. examples include yellowed water

reviews.review_text: I recently purchased 2x 12 packs of the 11oz Vita Coconut Water (original) and I regret it. The 11oz packages are made on an entirely different continent than the 16oz & 1L ones. These are made in Brazil, while the bigger ones are made in Malaysia (where the best young coconuts in the world are harvested). The 11oz ones taste disgusting and have a yellowish tint to them, while the larger ones are crystal-clear (literally like water) and have a much, much, much sweeter and more pleasant taste (with the same sugar content). I guess what I'm saying is: stay away from the 11oz packages at all costs. They are cheaper for a reason.
reviews.review_header: 11oz packages are made in Brazil (not Malaysia like the others) and taste/look disgusting

reviews.review_text: We got the brown stuff. Yuck!
reviews.review_header: We got the brown stuff. Yuck!

reviews.review_text: Bought 2 cases in 2 different occasions. I thought they were ok but not great until a friend came to my house, drank it, and told me it tasted funny. I didn't take it to heart until he bought a case for me from Costo a few weeks later. The same exact product but the ones he got me from costo taste very different. The ones from Costco have a refreshing sweet taste. Now I understand what he meant by the ones from Amazon taste funny -- simpley like cooked sugarcane juice - a little stale but cooked sugarcane juice is not too bad if you don't know how good coconut juice supposed to taste like, right? Anyone of you bought this from Amazon should try to find a bottom from the grocery store or Costco for comparison. If you never had a good one, you won't know what is bad. I was happy with it before I get to tried ones from Costco and that's why I even bought a second case. Now, I have reason to suspect the 2 cases I bought, a month apart between the 2 cases, were both expired or maybe bootlegged. Since we already finished (yuck, how we do it?) from Amazon and threw away the containers, I have no way of know if they were expired or bootlegged (or perhaps not stored properly). I do remember the color of the ones from Amazon being darker than those from Costco although the box and packaging are identical. I don't remember if it's as dark as the picture shown by another reviewer "Tron" but it's definitely darker compare to Costco. I regret not taking his review serviously.
reviews.review_header: Do yourself a favor, get 1 from the grocery store and compare the taste, you'll probably be surprised.

reviews.review_text: These are sour, have a very artificial nutty flavor and generally taste like coconut powder in water. I highly recommend you don't buy this. I swear by Harmless Coconut Water and I thought I'd take a chance again at VitaCoco because of the cheap price on Amazon. I drank one and I can't stand to open another one. Now I know why they were so cheap at almost 1$ per pack. Spend some more money and enjoy actual coconut water.

Vita Coco Coconut Water is fantastic, not just as a beverage for refreshment. It was recommended by our nurse practitioner when I got weak from exercise in warm weather some time ago. The benefits were instant and amazing. Now, we use it any time of year. My job is physically demanding, and work both outside and indoors. When I begin to feel worn out and achy due to multiple physical conditions, I find that a portion of this coconut water can really revive me. If you've ever had a headache from dehydration, you know how uncomfortable your entire body can feel. We consider coconut water virtually a magic potion, and I'm happy to recommend it to anyone!
reviews.review_header: Try it, and you will not be disappointed!

reviews.review_text: This thing taste horrible. I have tried this few times over the year due to the positive reviews and trying to believe that I am getting a bad batch. Growing up in tropical place, I do have access to fresh coconut from the backyard. I knew exactly how coconut water should taste like (Young or old, some slightly naturally carbonated and even roasted). This this doesn't even taste a bit like coconut :(
reviews.review_header: This thing taste horrible. I have tried this few times over the ...

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love that this is exactly like when I was in Aruba and they would pick the coconuts, slice them in front of you and give you a straw. Some may prefer it chilled. I like it either way, since I was introduced to it in it's pure form and natures tradewinds as it's only coolant. Wonderful, can't wait to order more. Wish they were larger, going to see if they have that. If you are a "coconut nut" like me, you'll LOVE this!

I remember the fresh coconut water in India and this brand doesn't even come close to tasting like it. Maybe the coconut water in other tropical countries tastes like this, which is not bad. The trouble is that coconut water starts fermenting as soon as the coconut is sliced open. This paper package is better than plastic for preserving the flavor (go figure!). I use the 11oz over a day or two and the 16oz over 2-3 days. After that it begins to ferment at an accelerated pace and tastes like toddy, which is naturally fermented palm or coconut sap water drip. The other brand that comes in a plastic container begins to ferment after 24 hours, which is counter-intuitive. I try not to drink too much of it because my Costa Rican maid tells me that if you overdo it, it reduces blood pressure, perhaps because of the high potassium.
reviews.review_header: Not the real thing but a close second. This brand resists fermenting more so than other brands.

reviews.review_text: I really liked the product. The delivery was HORRIBLE. They block the door and run. I am elderly (at 82 I still hate to admit it) they block my front door with the product which forces me to use very dangerous steps to retrieve it. This happens constantly with all of Amazons delivery but mostly with AMAZL. All they have to do is move packages 24 inches to the right of the door. I have even put a sheltered bench within 3 feet of the door and they ignore it. I use Amazon because going shopping is difficult for me but if I fall and hurt myself getting my purchases into the house it's not helping me!

It's the time of year for warm comfort food, and that includes chili. Jalapeños, onions, fire roasted tomatoes, chili pepper...all followed with a nice cab. All this is a perfect recipe for autumn induced acid reflux. Perhaps a bit indelicate here, but I ran out of Rolaids and soy milk didn't help. Grasping at straws, I downed a couple of boxes. Problem resolved. The chili was too good the next day, but drank a box before indulging. No reflux. So not exactly a scientific experiment, but the food, person, diet and time of day were constant. Maybe it will help, certainly can't hurt

I usually avoid fad drinks and diet stuff, but I tried this while on a photo shoot out on a hot, sweltery day and actually like it a lot. I actually started ordering this by the 12 pack, something I've never done before, and I'm not disappointed. I like to have one after a long day working on the yard or playing outside. I wish I could tell you that it perfectly replaced my lost electrolytes and minerals, but I really don't know. I do know that it was cool and refreshing. The taste may take a bit of getting used to for some people, but I'm fond of coconut, so it wasn't a stretch for me.
reviews.review_header: Tasty, healthy and won't kill you. (As long as you don't have allergies to coconut.) ;)

reviews.review_text: Initially i tried this coconut water for a local Store it was good and then i have order this from amazon for the 12 pack. This is how it tasted. Really yuckky for the first couple of packets and we just have to throw the remaining packets.Thinking that this was an issue with only my packets I tried this from wegmans and there too it tasted yuckky...i tried one and returned the another one back to wegmans. I tried to see what the difference was in between all the three packets. the first packet was manufactured and processed from brazil. the second was from srilanka and i dont recollect where the third packet was from but it was from a different country. To list the pros and cons: pros : if you are lucky you can get one good packet with really good tasting coconut water.(i was lucky only once and unlucky thrice) cons : 1) majority of the packets manufactured does not taste good. 2) three different countries being used for manufacturing the same water so we are assured that the taste is not consistent. 3) No quality control. 4) fooling the customers that its pure coconut water. ps : i am from coastal region in india and i know how good and fresh coconut water tastes.
reviews.review_header: yuckky. Very bad tasting coconut water. Not worth to buy it. Fooling customers.

reviews.review_text: Not good stock. Please see the photo attached. I saw that all the bottles are sticky to touch, may b one of the bottle could be leaking.
reviews.review_header: Not good stock. Please see the photo attached

reviews.review_text: I've tried three brands of coconut water in the past few days. Of the ones I've tried lately, this is the best tasting, and a good value at its current price. WHAT I LIKE ABOUT IT: * It tastes good. * It's affordable. The price for a twelve pack is very reasonable, especially if you have Amazon prime and don't pay extra for shipping. WHAT I DISLIKE: * It's a little too sweet for me. While I like the taste, I don't need the extra fructose. (Like many people, I'm trying to avoid fructose, so would not want to drink too much of this.) * The label says it's "pure coconut water" but the small print says it has "less than 1 percent added fruit sugars." I don't know the ins and outs of the labeling laws, but how can something be "pure coconut water," then have added sugar? I would give it five stars if they would take out the added fructose. WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? * Yes, but with a caveat. If you're trying to watch your carbs, be aware that one carton of this provides 15 grams of carbs. So you might need to split it in half and drink half each day, if you're following a paleo diet and trying to limit yourself to 20 grams of carbs a day.
reviews.review_header: Tastes good, but it's a little too sweet for me. Contains added fructose.

reviews.review_text: I have health problems that cause me to struggle with dehydration and this stuff has saved my tuckus so many times! It keeps nausea and dizziness at bay because when you are struggling with immense pain and dehydration, drinking just water can be vomit triggering and just doesn’t help as much. This brand is the best tasting, best quality, and isn’t overloaded with sugar. Super healthy and super tasty! I just feel so much better since it has entered my life.

my husband suffers badly from muscle cramps after he has sweated a lot, which he does very easily. Our daughters-in-law who are runners told him that this was probably from a potassium deficit. He now drinks the copiously (even keeps it at his bedside), the cramps can ease in just minutes after he has taken a swig. When we are somewhere where he can drink fresh coconut water from a just picked coconut he is even happier as he is not crazy about the taste of the bottled product. We never let ourselves run out of this during warm weather

Whoa there! 15 grams of sugar ! This is for people who like to drink their candy. Last time I ordered it, there was 11 grams of sugar on the label and it was what I considered a reasonably healthy drink with over 600 grams of potassium I put it on subscription basis. THIS HAS GOT TO END! I am sorry but you changed not me. This is not the product I intended to order... this Junk food now.
reviews.review_header: 15 grams of sugar! so now you can drink your candy and pretend it's healthy

reviews.review_text: Will not ever ever ever buy again. This coconut water is pasteurized and has an additive that is not stated on the box for prolonged shelf life.
reviews.review_header: Will not ever ever ever buy again. This coconut ...

reviews.review_text: I have always had a taste for coconut water, thus the current fad for coconut water made me very happy given all of the new choices that keep popping up. Unfortunately most of them have been disappointing to say the least. Ranging from bland to tasting like suntan lotion. While not the only good option out there, Vita Coco is the best tasting in my opinion compared to all of the many other I have tasted. Nice that its among the lower priced options as well. Closest think to cutting open a green coconut & having a taste from my experience & more convenient than Robinson Crusoe ever had.
reviews.review_header: thus the current fad for coconut water made me very happy given all of the new choices that keep popping ...

reviews.review_text: Bought 2 cases in 2 different occasions. I thought they were ok but not great until a friend came to my house, drank it, and told me it tasted funny. I didn't take it to heart until he bought a case for me from Costo a few weeks later. The same exact product but the ones he got me from costo taste very different. The ones from Costco have a refreshing sweet taste. Now I understand what he meant by the ones from Amazon taste funny -- simpley like cooked sugarcane juice - a little stale but cooked sugarcane juice is not too bad if you don't know how good coconut juice supposed to taste like, right? Anyone of you bought this from Amazon should try to find a bottom from the grocery store or Costco for comparison. If you never had a good one, you won't know what is bad. I was happy with it before I get to tried ones from Costco and that's why I even bought a second case. Now, I have reason to suspect the 2 cases I bought, a month apart between the 2 cases, were both expired or maybe bootlegged. Since we already finished (yuck, how we do it?) from Amazon and threw away the containers, I have no way of know if they were expired or bootlegged (or perhaps not stored properly). I do remember the color of the ones from Amazon being darker than those from Costco although the box and packaging are identical.
reviews.review_header: get 1 from the grocery store and compare the taste, you'll probably be surprised

reviews.review_text: I have had mixed results when ordering 12-packs of Vita Coco from Amazon. My first order was great -- arrived on time and quality was as expected. The second order a week later was awful. Did not taste like coconut water at all. I would describe it as tap water with a funky aftertaste. I saw some other reviews noting poor quality when the product originated in Thailand rather than Brazil. So I checked the labels on the two packages and, sure enough, my first shipment was produced in Brazil and the second (awful) shipment was produced in Thailand. Based on my experience I can't recommend rolling the dice and buying these on Amazon. For this brand, you should physically check the label to see where the coconuts are sourced from before purchasing.

Much to my surprise, this coconut water really does taste like sipping the real thing from a straw, as the package says. It's light but has good body and a natural, clean taste, with no aftertaste like some of these artificial drinks, I'll be using this a lot for an alternative to other hydrating liquids, and the price was excellent so I hope it wasn't just the promo price, and will stay the same so I can buy some more when this runs out. I'm so glad I found this, since I won't be traveling to the tropics any time soon. I may not be able to evaluate its actual health effects, but if I notice any startling improvements I'll definitely update this review.

Do not buy this! EVERY container leaked and all of them had to be thrown out. Thankfully I got a refund, but this is a warning...these cartons are defective. When I first opened the box containing the 12 cartons of the coconut water, one was swollen and stunk to high heavens! The one next to it was leaking but had not yet spoiled. I found the "collar" part (the half-moon shaped plastic that connects to the carton) had separated from the carton on every carton so they were not even sealed. What a waste of otherwise good coconut water. Furthermore, these cartons can't be recycled so that's another waste.
reviews.review_header: EVERY carton was defective and product was spoiled!

reviews.review_text: As many others have pointed out, quality is hit or miss. In my case (of 12), a palpable miss. The expiry date was 6 months in the future, but the beverage was yellow, smelt stale and had an off taste. I don't usually return perishables on Amazon, but this was a matter of principle - if it says "coconut water" on the box but it looks like pee and smells like an old wet washing machine, then it *must* be returned. Clearly this is a common problem with this product. I've learned my lesson and so should you: the moral of this review is that if you want to buy Vita Coco, you are probably better getting it from a local grocery store than from Amazon. Or better still, avoid this product. Of course, if urine luck you may get the good stuff, but why play roulette with your beverage order? To paraphrase Lloyd Bentsen, "Senator, I have been served coconut water, I know coconut water, coconut water was a friend of mine. Vita Coco, you are no coconut water."
reviews.review_header: Should have listened to the reviews...

reviews.review_text: I've always loved coconut water. I use it as a replacement for sports drinks, and as a quick pick me up and hydration source in the morning. I get horrible headaches when I start getting dehydrated and I find coconut water alleviates the symptoms of dehydration and my headache much faster than water and without the risk of low electrolytes. I see some people have some expericnes with some bad boxes, I have experienced that with many brands of coconut water (maybe the Tetra packs?) It should be clear with perhaps a cloudy appearance (a little like squeesed lemonade). I've been able to identify a bad box by smell so I really don't worry about it just give it a sniff first.

taste horrible. Smells like rotten. I a vietnamese and I normally buy the coconut from the supermarket in westmisnter, Ca. However, I thought I would supprise my mom and buy these drinks for her since she and I both like coco water. The sad part is the taste of these coco water. If you expect fresh coco water taste look elsewhere. These are poor quality coco water. Either bad coconut or the storage is bad. I bought 3 cases at 13.97 each total 40 something dollar for free shipping. I noticed the price went up after i purchased it. Maybe they had some old inventory and had to get rid of the stocks and I am the guinea pig? maybe it's not a product, maybe its just amazon. Anyways, would never buy again.
reviews.review_header: Horrible old, expire taste. All 3 case were like that.

reviews.review_text: I have been drinking Naked Natural Coconut Water for some time until Amazon ran into some sort of trouble with their inventory of the product and stop selling it. I waited and waited but the problem persisted unresolved for weeks. Then I tried to buy it from a supermarket or grocery store and it is very hard to find, only a few places carry Naked where I live/work. So I decided to stop waiting and give a try to the competition and that's it, I'm not buying Naked anymore and staying with Vita Coco. I agree with some of the comments saying Vita doesn't taste as close to Coconut water as it should, and I agree with them: This is an improvement over real coconut water, it taste better; if you read my review of Naked, you will understand. I'm not a Coconut Water Tasting Expert if such thing exists, but I grew up drinking coconut water straight from the coconut, and the only thing I didn't like was that bitter/salty after taste, which Vita removed almost completely. This makes it a bit sweeter and in my opinion it is a good thing Vita's packaging is also easier to drink from, the plastic neck really help to drink it right from the container if you want, no need for straws or having to pour it into a glass. It also carries a better price, they are more honest about what at the end is just coconut water, something readily available in nature, just nicely packaged and more convenient
reviews.review_header: A Bit Too Sweet When Compared to the Real Deal, But That's the Best Part!

reviews.review_text: Love this coconut water! When I buy it in the store the expiration date has been running around December 2018 but amazon shipped me a case with a expiration date of August 15, 2018. I’ll probably finish mine before then but what’s up with that?
reviews.review_header: Best tasting coconut water on the market. Look at your expiration date.

reviews.review_text: I don't drink coconut water "straight", so taste isn't a major factor in my buying decision. Instead, I use coconut water as one of the ingredients in my breakfast smoothie. (The other liquid ingredients are orange juice and soy milk.) The amount of coconut water per smoothie is 1/2 cup. I've used Vita Coco for over a year, and the quality has been consistent. On one occasion, I received a damaged box and one of the bottles inside had a broken seal. But I've never gotten sealed product that turned out to be spoiled. Vita Coco doesn't have a "use within x days of opening" advisory on its label. This might be because the manufacturer adds citric acid. (Listed as "Vitamin C" on the ingredient list). In my experience, Vita Coco lasts 4-5 days after opening without any noticeable degradation. Besides citric acid, the manufacturer adds "1% fruit sugar". (There are flavored versions of Vita Coco that contain other ingredients as well.) Different brands and flavors have varying amounts of sugar. Like most other coconut water products, Vita Coco comes in (biodegradable?) cartons with twist-on caps. These box-like cartons topped with small plastic spouts aren't designed for smooth pouring. There's one brand (Zico?) that comes in plastic bottles instead. These make for better pouring. My primary reason for sticking with Vita Coco has been the consistent quality. That makes it a pretty good value for the price. Also, I think it tastes pretty good for a shelf-stable coconut water product. And the flavored versions offer especially broad appeal for kids and coconut water newbies. I give this product 4.5 stars. (But I'll round up to 5, since I'm not expecting it to taste like fresh coconut water.) Hydration alternatives: fresh coconut water, maple water, sports drinks, pediatric electrolyte drink, electrolyte-enhanced water, filtered H2O (Brita).
reviews.review_header: Relatively good value, which makes it a great substitute for water in smoothies.

reviews.review_text: This is the ONLY coconut water I will drink. The others just don't taste like a freshly cracked coconut. And there no sugar added, just clean pure naked coconut water. The BEST cure for a hangover. Better than Gatorade!

So far 9 out of 12 containers were leaking at the edges. They seem to be ok to drink but need a straw unless you want it dripping all over you. I didn't have this problem the last time I bought it but knowing it may be contaminated doesn't make me want to buy it again. That being said the product itself is flavorful and I've been drinking it for a year. Is amazon selling defective containers?
reviews.review_header: So far 9 out of 12 containers were leaking at ...

reviews.review_text: I was born in a country where I had fresh coconut. I am a big fan of coconut water. After coming to this country, I have tried many many drinks but this one is the best! It tastes very close to actual water. No bad smell! I have been repeatedly ordering this. And no disappointments. Price is great. I only tried the original though because I don’t like flavors.

This is the 3rd brand of coconut water I've ordered, and this one is the real deal ! The other 2 went back. Vita Coco is yummy, not sugary and not bitter as the last brand was. I know it's good for my body and here's why. I went out with friends last night and had 2 rum & cokes which doesn't usually end well since I am sensitive to caffeine. Four hours later, I felt bad... jittery, rapid heartbeat, etc. I assumed it was the acidity and/or the caffeine, so I drank water with acv to lower my acidity. Didn't help. Then I drank a magnesium rich drink and that didn't help. Then I remembered the coconut water sitting in the fridge. I drank one container and an hour later, my body felt back to normal again. I'm not suggesting buying Vita Coco as a cure for the occasional evening out :-). I am suggesting that it is so nutrient-rich that it nourishes the body quickly and in a very noticeable way.

I am a big fan of coconut water. We often buy young coconuts from our local grocery store to enjoy it. Late last year, I was introduced to this product by a friend. I loved the taste. I immediately ordered a 12 pack from Amazon and thoroughly enjoyed every last one of them. In my excitement I signed up for "Subscribe & Save" program and got a really good deal. I received two shipments and both were great! However the next shipment had a very bad taste! I am not sure how to describe it. I immediately got in touch with Amazon's Customer service and they sent me a replacement. (Amazon is the best!!!). The replacement had the same bad taste. I ended up throwing all of them in the trash (recycled all the containers). Product showed promise - Unfortunately they did not have good quality control measures in place! I guess its back to the local grocery store for me.
It still taste good, but its taste based on the produce location. If it is made in Philip, it will taste more sweeter. But if it is made in Brazil, it tastes aliilte sour. But still recommend it!!

I'm use to the taste of 365 brand. Decided to give this one a try but didn't like it at all! The taste is way different and to be honest way far to be pleasent... Nor my hubby, neither my daughter want to drink it. Tried to add it to our favorite coconut carribien shake-Noop, didn't work either...
reviews.review_header: I wish I could like it:(

reviews.review_text: I love this stuff! Not sure if this smaller container is the most cost effective option but it's nice to grab and go. I like coconut water just as an occasional drink but at any sign of tummy upset or dehydration I'll down one of these and it straightens me right out. I'm a huge fan of bottled water but when I want flavor or feel the need to electrolytes this is my go to beverage.

There is absolutely nothing wrong with this product, and the product tastes great!, BUT there is added sugar. And if you are looking for coconut water that has no added sugar, this is not the one. So I am switching, as I don't need any extra sugar.
Love coconut water, it is so healthy for you, I don't like gatorade, its also good to use if you having a protein shake instead of water or milk

I really like Vita Coco. The product is remarkably good. One of my favorite things with eating or drinking natural foods is when I read the ingredients there is only one. Coconut water is an excellent source of Potassium and if you've ever actually read what the recommended daily amount of potassium is you'll see that it is near impossible to reach on a daily basis. Vita Coco helps get there. I have tried a few other coconut water products, but this one has been my go to option. I like the carton better than a plastic bottle- one of the competitors I tried uses a plastic bottle and I feel that the coconut water gets some of that plastic taste. I have not had a similar problem with Vita Coco.

Vita Coco is the best of all coconut waters to me. I have tried others. I prefer the unflavored natural version. A lot of coconut waters are made from extract and water. This brand is all natural, just as it came from the coconuts. Be sure to read the labels! Also, it comes in tetra packs, better than plastic bottles or cans. I lived in Honduras in the 1970's and when we would go to the beach, boys would climb up and cut down the green coconuts, then someone would slice the top off it(with machete). We drank the pure coconut water right out of it. This brand has a really fresh taste. I highly recomment this product over others.

I really liked the taste of this coconut water; good batch of coconuts I would suppose. I've had other coconut waters that were so awful that I couldn't drink them. I was relieved that these tasted good and not too sweet. The size is great for a single serving. I'm not sure if they are from young coconuts though or if they are fresh either. I'm not really sure how to figure that one out! Just because the picture has green ones on the label doesn't mean they used them... and the label says New York.

I grew up drinking coconut water and often with some 'flesh' in it as well. It was usually served frozen as a icy treat or served chilled. Coconut water has taken a buzz in the news in the past few years due to celebrities and health fads and so I was a bit worried to try this. There were many reviews comparing this brand to others in the market as well. I went with the Vita Coco as it was the most affordable and I liked how it was packaged. I am often on-the-go and so I need something that can easily transport. The taste is good and it really has no sugar in it. I had tried some Dole Pineapple juice a few days earlier and it was just too sweet for my taste. It's refreshing & also has a good taste. Highly recommend!

I've been trying to change my bad habits of not drinking enough healthy fluids during the day. When we visited St. Lucia a year ago, we tried fresh young coconut meat and water. It was not only delicious, but we also verified that the water is very healthy. So... when I started drinking more water, I also started including Vita Coco for health and variety. I had to get used to the flavor and its watery consistency. Now, I find it delicious and crave it! It's not as good as the water that came from the fresh cracked coconuts in St. Lucia, but it's a good enough way to get it at home.

Purchased this product before it was good living in the Philippines you can get coconut water fresh every day from the street vendors so guess I may have some bias but it was ok but the last case tasted watered down I know natural products can be different from time to time will give it another try.

This coconut water was awful! I got it as a new nursing mother in order to help keep me hydrated and every bottle tasted bitter and old. Doesn’t even compare to what you could buy in store when it comes to freshness. Very disappointed.
I decided to give this a try...,has no taste. Maybe a bit like spoiled milk.

I thoroughly enjoy the Vita Coco brand of Coconut Water. It's one of the most refreshing and delicious brands i've tried so far. I feel so much healthier drinking this instead of the many other sugary carbonated drinks out there. It's listed at a reasonable price and definitely worth the money in health benefits alone. I would highly recommend this product to a friend or family member. Thank you Vita Coco!
reviews.review_header: Vita Coco - The only brand of Coconut water you need!

reviews.review_text: Love this coconut water. I have autonomic nervous system dysfunction which creates chronic dehydration. This Coconut water taste so good, & I drank all of the case within 3 days. This product is an excellent choice of NATURAL HYDRATION.
The coconut juice tastes great! We use it for lunch box. The container is durable to squeeze with other lunch in a small ice bag. Strongly recommended!
I love coconut water, but the containers were too small and price too large.
reviews.review_header: No artificial sweeteners or added sugars

reviews.review_text: This water its old. DONT BUY IT GO TO THE STORE!

Having grown up in the Caribbean I know that this is not the real deal although it is presented as such. However it is among the best of the imposters. I actually enjoyed it and found it to be a refreshing drink, especially when chilled. Ice tends to dilute it, so I prefer to keep it in the refrigerator until I'm ready to drink. I like the fact that there is no added sugar as in the case of other coconut waters that I have tried. I would buy this again, and until I can get back home to get coconut water directly from the nut, I'm content to drink Vita Coco. It's a good enough substitute.
Subscribe and Save! Love this Coconut water, it tastes great. I've never had an issue with broken lids/seals, or sour tastes.
Nice drink, refreshing even though the coconut water taste is weak. It taste more like water from very, very young coconut.

I have drank vita coco water and like it...BUT the batch I received, 3 cases, has an off taste, perhaps it is TOO OLD, even though it expires this july, when exactly was this drink bottled? Maybe doesn't last as long as one would think.... The first ones I drank had a cap on it much like bottled water, one can close the container, the straw tops like this one can't last as long as the caps brand can.I opened only one case to chill, I will not open the other two....probably cost more to ship it back so in the trash and will purchase no longer from this seller.....Tom

I can't say these taste particularly wonderful, but I do really enjoy that they have a re-sealable top & can be transported easily. I mainly use them as a mix for my protein powder / L-Glutamine as soon as I get to my car after practices. By doing so the coconut water is getting some natural sugars into my system right away as well. All-in-all, I wouldn't drink them if I had access to other drinks (easily on-the-go) I like...but they fit the above-mentioned role in my routine well.
reviews.review_header: They don't taste particularly great, but they may fill a nice role.

reviews.review_text: I love this water. It tastes so good, it hydrated my body after dialysis. Stop hiking the price up or I won’t be able to afford it anymore, I’m on a fixed income.
reviews.review_header: That this water is available to me.

reviews.review_text: This brand coconut water is definitely better than most coconut water currently in the market. The taste is isn’t strong like ripe coconut, but crisp, lightly sweetened, and refreshing. We love it, will buy again!
reviews.review_header: Like sticking a straw into a baby coconut

reviews.review_text: I use Vita Coco during and after workouts for the hydration and the potassium. I really like the 11.1 size package, which is smaller than the bottles available in stores for up to $3.00. I have read that some reviewers don't like that it has added vitamin C - they complained it altered the taste. Although this product for me was an acquired taste, I like it and I appreciate the extra vitamin c in my diet. Honestly, I don't know what it tastes like to drink straight from a coconut, but that doesn't matter to me. I need the benefits from this product. I also appreciate the magnesium from this product for my ailing gall bladder.

It’s a good product. What I don’t understand is why the delivery description states that it was handed directly to someone. It was left by my front door, which is fine. Why misrepresent the method of delivery?
I ordered pineapple and got the regular flavor, I’m very upset about that. I’m not a fan of the regular flavor. I would like a pineapple pack please.
This is a favorite in our home. And we will continue to purchase it. The value and the fact that it shows up on my doorstep cannot be beat!

We love this drink and make it as substitute to soda and boxed fruit juices. My husband and I prefer to have this with our meals but I was just wondering why the price suddenly jumped up? I bought a 12-pk for $13.80 last July (2012), and now when I checked, it's $21.++ per 12-pk?! I was surprised with the sudden price hike and I'm no longer planning to make it as our regular drink. I've also taken it out of my subscribe and save items. I like the taste and quality of this product but I don't think it's worth the price. I know they sell it at $20.++ at Walmart and Costco but since I got it for much cheaper price before, I'm not really willing to pay higher now.
reviews.review_header: Will do but Philippine coconuts taste way, way better! And why did the price suddenly jump up?

reviews.review_text: I love coconut water, specially the one that comes with small pieces of coconut, not the case with this one. The taste seemed a little "old" not as fresh as others that I have tried in cans, maybe its the packaging

This coconut water does have a wee bit of added sugar, so if you're looking for coconut water that is without any additives, this would not be the one to buy. That being said, it is very flavorful, and has all the health benefits that one would be looking for in a coconut water.
