The potassium boost in this water is very good for heart health and will assist in controlling mild high blood pressure, so if you're looking to lower your blood pressure through diet and exercise, and don't mind a bit of extra sugar, this product is a very good choice.

I would describe the taste as Yucky. Nothing wrong with the expiration date or freshness. I never tasted coconut water before so maybe all brands taste like this. I would recommend people buy one carton in a store and decide if they like this stuff.

I am a Body Ecology Coach and the 'stars' of the Body Ecology Diet are probiotic rich, cultured foods such as Young Coconut Kefir and Cultured Vegetables. We make the YCK (Young Coconut Kefir) from probiotic starters and the juice - the water from YOUNG coconuts. This is a very important part of the diet as many people find that it helps tremendously to help them with their sugar & carb cravings and helps to restore the gut's inner ecobalance by recolonizing the gut with healthy beneficial probiotics. Sometimes finding fresh young white THAI coconuts is a challenge. If you do find them, like other fresh produce, they can be old and mildewy or they can cost a fortune since there is a wide range price on them (.69 cents to $5.00 EACH). Because the juice content varies between each coconut (think of a juicy apple vs a drier apple), it can take a person 1-3 fresh coconuts to make 1 quart of young coconut kefir. That's where these wonderful pre-packaged containers full of young coconut water come in handy for those of us who love Young Coconut Kefir! Although packaged coconut water does not taste as sweet and fresh as FRESH young coconut water, it still tastes good, is very refreshing, contains MORE electolytes (especially potassium) than any sports drink out there, is all natural and of course, is SO easy to access by pulling the 'sticky tab' back rather than cracking a hard fresh coconut by hand! Not to mention they keep longer than fresh coconuts. Young Coconut water is a GREAT and much HEALTHIER alternative to any sports drink, juice drink full of unhealthy syrups such as high fructose corn syrup and especially sodas. They taste much better cold and is even more refreshing with some freshly squeezed lime juice in them.
reviews.review_header: Great alternative to fresh young coconuts or sports electryolyte drink

reviews.review_text: Bye-bye dehydration. After seeing many reviews and much hype about the Vita Coco coconut water, I decided to try these once and for all. I had high expectations for this product, but did not expect it to be anywhere near as delicious as it was when I sipped it for the very first time. The taste is unlike anything I've ever tried before and it goes well with all types of foods. It hydrates you with 100% natural coconut water, leaving you refreshed and delighted at the same time. The tetra packs are great on the go (perfect for taking to the gym, to work, on a run, on a walk, etc) and contain an adequate amount of coconut water. I'd highly recommend Vita Coco to anyone who is hesitant about trying coconut water for the first time. I have since replaced all of my sports drinks (which contain citric acid, leading to cavities) with Vita Coco and I won't look back. I absolutely love this product and am sure anyone out there will too.
reviews.review_header: Unexpectedly delicious - I can't live without it now!

reviews.review_text: My girlfriend and I have recently gotten into drinking Coconut Water, and this is our favorite brand. My girlfriend is picky, and she strongly prefers Vita Coco over all of the others. To me, they all taste about the same, but I do very much enjoy this stuff---very refreshing. Recently, they start selling the 12-packs with the twist-off caps instead of the pull-back tabs, and that makes it easy to save and store the rest if you don't want to commit to an entire carton. 5 Stars!
Love its natural coconut water taste, very refreshing, help dehydration, also detox for me. Only coconut water brand we drink at home in the last two years
reviews.review_header: This is the only choice coconut water we drink at home at the regular base

reviews.review_text: This is a great deal. I've compared it to many different stores and the per ounce price is the best, plus I can have it delivered to my door every month! I drink this mainly for hydration for the purposes of breastfeeding. It's great for me and quenches my thirst better than water does. I love how it's all natural and I know it's natural because it taste just like the young coconuts I used to buy at the supermarket, just without all the hassle of finding a way to break it open to get inside.

I usually only drink water, but use this as a refresher after a good workout or just on a hot day when I don't feel like drinking water. I love that the ingredients list is super short and all normal things I understand!
We have been using these back-to-back and works best with Subscribe and Save. The flavor is a little close to Indian coconuts but certainly different. My kids love it too.
reviews.review_header: Flavor a bit close Indian coconuts

reviews.review_text: In the past 2 weeks I have ordered 3-4 cases of these. All have arrived quickly and taste just like the ones in the stores. The only difference is the price. These are cheaper than the ones at Sam's club and military commissary. Great deal and will be ordering more :)
reviews.review_header: Taste great and cheaper than anywhere else !!

reviews.review_text: Vita Coco is one of my favorite drinks. I've noticed that many people us it in mixing other drinks and smoothies, but give it to me straight up and chilled, and I'm satisfied. Being familiar with the tropics, I know what the real thing tastes like, and Vita Coco is very close to the real thing. I believe because it is the real thing. As it says on the box, don't tell the monkeys.
reviews.review_header: This is the real thing. Very satisfying!

reviews.review_text: Naked was the first brand of coconut water that I tried and the smell and taste was absolutely terrible, but I wanted to try a few others after reading some reviews on Amazon. I haven't tried Zico as I have heard it is from concentrate, but I tried One and Vita Coco and much preferred the Vita Coco. It has a very mild flavor and doesn't give me the gag reflex that other brands have. The pineapple and peach mango flavored ones are my favorite but I decided to grab some of the original when it went on sale here.
reviews.review_header: Best taste of 3 brands that I've tried

reviews.review_text: I purchased my two 12 packs on an Amazon deal and suspect they were on sale because they were damaged in some way. One of the individual drinks had been punctured and spilled onto the rest. And one case must have been spoiled in some way. Each day I had one (6 total before I tossed them), intestinal issues immediately followed. The second case did not have this problem. Generally I love VitaCoco coconut water, but this was a bad deal.
reviews.review_header: Like it, but got a bad batch

reviews.review_text: My husband loves these coconut waters! This is his favorite brand. The ZICO brand is a little dryer and I find usually more expensive. This one we get on Subscribe and Save and sometimes is cheaper at a local bulk purchase warehouse, but it's worth it to keep it in stock at our house on Amazon's subscription service.

This is the very first coconut water I have every had. At first I wasn't to sure about the taste. Not ever having coconut water before I wasn't sure if it had a good taste or not but, the more I drink it the more I got used to the taste. I did feel much better after drinking. I would have ranked it higher but not really knowing if the taste was really good or not, it is hard to rank higher. I will try other brands and compare their taste and then I will be able to judge better.
reviews.review_header: Not ever having coconut water before I wasn't sure if it had a good taste or not but

reviews.review_text: Tastes good but too many carbs for me. I use a low carb diet plan. Won't be buying again for that reason, but still a very good product if you don't mind the carbs

I was very disappointed in this coconut water. Not that it didn't taste good, it does. BUT THAT IS BECAUSE IT IS FULL OF ADDED SUGAR! As much as soda. What is the point of getting "pure" coconut water, when they dump a bunch of sugar in it before it even ships! For the cost, this is not for me. I won't pay this much for sugar water.

My main issue isn't necessarily with this product, but with Amazon. I signed up for auto-delivery once a month and it was only $12 and change the first 2 months, but last month I noticed my credit card was charged over $16 for the exact same product. I was not notified of the change in cost and was not given the opportunity to stop the delivery and cancel my order. ** UPDATE ** I just went to check the current cost after I wrote this. It's now $19+ for the same product. What a scam! Sign-up for a grocery delivery via Amazon and get (THIS) great rate, but in 2-3 months we'll start charging you ((THIS)) rate and in 3-4 months we'll charge you (((THIS)))! I just cancelled my subscription, since it's now officially cheaper for me to buy my coconut water at the grocery store or even my local health food place.

Most coconut water containers either taste like nothing or makes you throw up. Vita coco is the only brand that I've seen that consistently taste good. These are not as sweet as the coconuts from Southern India but have a mild enjoyable taste. The package always arrives in good shape and the price on Amazon is great. We have a rule in the house. You don't get to go to the fridge and just grab one. You earn it only after a good work out. That makes it taste even better :)
I don't like coconut water, it's just odd. Everyone says you should drink it after a work out. This one isn't as bad.
reviews.review_header: Not a fan but was good.

reviews.review_text: Tasted very strongly of banana, possibly peach and mango. Vitacoco sells different flavours but I ordered the original natural flavour. There was a mistake with the batch that I received yet I was not notified of any recall, when I believe there should have been a recall. There are people with all sorts of severe food allergies and this could have been a potentially life threatening issue. I hope Vitacoco has taken care of this mistake and hopefully it does not happen again.
reviews.review_header: Box was labeled Natural Flavor with only Cocunut water but was flavored with Tropical Fruits

reviews.review_text: Personally I did not enjoy the taste. It was quite sour almost rancid tasting. I would not recommend this for drinking. Will use in cooking rather than waste it.

I will tell you a secret. I have to travel to conferences where we are in the middle of the $5 bottles of water vendors and have no cars. A taxi ride would be expensive to get "supplies" for the week. This coconut water is essential to hydration and quick recovery of all that social time every evening when the drinks are flowing. Amazon Prime is great, because I can ship this to arrive on a specific date to my hotel room so I am set for the week.
Love to drink coconut water in between drinking regular water. It has a great taste and it is good for you.
Maybe I don’t what coconut water is supposed to taste like but these are awful. couldn't even finish one of them

I literally used to LOVE Vita Coco and would have it daily. Then on I my latest purchase of several cases the taste was not pleasant anymore. Something changed dramatically. Now Coco Vita is on my DO NOT BUY list. The product used to be 100% GREAT tasting truly PURE coconut water from Brazil WITHOUT additives or preservatives. In my opinion the current newly formulated product is a very low quality, awful tasting, possibly "coconut water?" from Sri Lanka with additives. Even though the label still reads PURE coconut water, the new ingredient list states that SUGAR and Vitamin C have been added. I don't get it. Why would they ruin greatness? Why? For a quick buck? Well they lost my buck. I guess I'll have to venture and try other allegedly "Natural" or "Pure" Coconut Water Brands or just go back to not drinking coconut water at all. I am definitively never paying premium prices for what in my opinion tastes like sweetened sewer water.
reviews.review_header: Used to be great brazilian coconut water.

reviews.review_text: Perfect thirst quencher - Perfect taste - Perfect rehydrater - Perfect packaging (maintains freshness and compact for on the go) - Perfect refreshment - Perfect product!
Pretty good coconut water . Pricey and definitely not as good as out of the coconut but it’s great for a hot day when you’re feeling dehydrated
I wish they came in larger quantity; these are only 11 ounces. That however does not alter the taste. This is a delicious drink and healthy to have handy in the frig.

LOVE THIS STUFF. The best coconut water on the market-and when I got a bad case (nearly fermented) Amazon replaced it. Use it all the time to keep potassium and magnesium levels good. UPDATE: 6-6-16. Have bought the 12 pack for years, NOW I HAVE TO JOIN PRIME???? No way Amazon. You have just LOST a very good customer. This manipulation of your buyers is unacceptable. While the product is good, your business model stinks.
reviews.review_header: clear, clean taste without too much sweetness. TERRIBLE AMAZON POLICY!

reviews.review_text: I got this on discount. You can get cheaper water at Costco (the Kirkland brand) if it's not on discount. The coconut water is slightly sweet, but not too sweet to taste like some artificial product. The only downside is that it is a bit pricy.

Coconut water is IMO much better than sports drinks and as equally refreshing. It can be consumed any time without feeling guilty. Vita Coco is good, I just don't understand why it comes from the Phillipines but Born in Brazil? I know when I was in Brazil you could get cocunut water dirt cheap right out of the nut. The fruit grows everywhere, but it's not cheap like a banana. My recommendation would be to sell this by the gallon instead of small containers. I would be more inclined to purchase if the price was better. The quality still seems good, though. After all, it's all natural?
reviews.review_header: Luxury in US, cheap in South America

reviews.review_text: They arrived very carefully packaged and in a timely fashion. The size were very small and though they are for a single serving, I still think they're too small for me, I'm greedy and I LOVE Coconut Water. I'd rather pay a little more for a bigger sized bottle with better quality Coconut Water and that's why I chose to cancel my order and ordered from another better quality Coconut Water Seller. Thank You So Very Much!!!
reviews.review_header: These tasted good, but not great, I've had better.

reviews.review_text: This may not be completely organic coconut water, but out of all the other packaged coconut water that i have tasted, this item is much better.
reviews.review_header: Good one out of all packaged coconut water.

reviews.review_text: I drink this coconut water every day, this is my third order. I’m very satisfied. it’s clear, delicious and wonderful 🌸 I highly recommend this brand.

I've ordered these numerous times. This time they came in soured tasting. Threw them all away. They tasted spoiled like spoiled milk. Disappointed , I've used this brand a lot before normally a good product!!!
reviews.review_header: Water was spoiled not like normally tastes

reviews.review_text: I like this brand, or used to until I recently found out that it isn't quite as a healthy as it leads you to believe. The price was competitive, packaging an shipping were good. I'm a bit frustrated that I have to continue to do my research to find truly organic and safe products for myself and my family. One has to dig deep and read past the posted marketing ploys to find products that are organic and natural these days, not to mention spend twice what the product is worth.

Vita Coco used to be 100% pure coconut water. Now, however, it contains "less than 1% natural fruit sugar, vitamin C". I am not sure why the ingredients were changed but it has changed the taste of the coconut water and not in a good way. I am going to have to find a different brand.

call it what you want, but "cane juice" is sugar. it used to be that Vita Coco wouldn't add anything to the natural coconut water. Now they add sugar to it and say it's because of taste consistency. I know what coconut water should taste like and I know that it's going to be inconsistent. I switched to Taste Nirvana Real Coconut. nothing added, better deal AND you can get it with coconut chunks if you like (i do).
reviews.review_header: was better before they started adding sugar

reviews.review_text: I love having this drink after a heavier meal because it's so light and refreshing, it makes you feel clean and renewed. It's also a decent size for the price; it's not a cheap drink but you get a lot. It's light but it's not water, so you can only drink so much in one sitting. I usually split one container into two portions. Highly potable...but my pack did not come with drinking straws! I'm not sure if the rest of the world happens to have straws at home, but I certainly don't. It was obnoxious that there was a place to punch a straw through, but no straw to do it with. I ended up just opening them from the side (like a milk container) and pouring it out into a cup.
reviews.review_header: Cleanses the palate, large size. No straws!

reviews.review_text: This is the forth time I am attempting to review this product. Amazon now decides if your view is worthy of posting!!! None of my reviews had profanity, they simply stated what Amazon refused to let me post Do not buy this product! Over priced and foul smelling.

I really bought into this whole coconut water bandwagon but after reading how much added sugar is in Vita Coco, I've canceled my monthly subscribe and save. Each one of these things has the equivalent of almost 4 TEASPOONS OF ADDED SUGAR. This is NOT natural sugar from the coconut. I refuse to put this much sugar into my body and think that I'm doing something good for myself by drinking coconut water.

My family drinks a ton of Coconut water and have tried all brands. This is by far the second best coconut tasting water of all times. (Naked brand tastes better but allot more $$) We have tried Kirkland, zico and a few other and nothing comes close!
reviews.review_header: This is by far the second best coconut tasting water of all times

reviews.review_text: As a kid in P.R., we drank green coconut water from time to time as well as coconut milk. The Vita Coco tastes like the real deal. I like the 100% pure over some of the others because of the authentic taste and the benefits, lots of vitamin C and minimal processing. I like that a machete isn't required to open the containers of Vita Coco, but that is the only part missing from the experience of this product. Some may expect more of a coconut flavor. Green coconuts just don't have that. The flavor is more, well, green and only very lightly sweet. I like this at room temp or cold, but if you haven't had this before or are used to cold beverages, you might want to keep it in the fridge. My kids aren't crazy about it, but I find that I like it after being the in sun or at the pool. I like the way it hydrates my body and makes me feel.

It's not the same as drinking off a fresh coconut from the streets of Vijayawada or Hyderabad, but for the poor souls in North Carolina that miss (me included) the manna from heaven that is coconut water, this is the third best. First being the actual coconut. And the second, well, there isn't any. So, of course, the taste is not exactly like the coconut water that you drink out of a freshly hacked green coconut. But it get's quite close to it. Great after a morning's run. I tried many other brands over the years. Vita Coco is one of the best. The canned ones are absolute no nos.
reviews.review_header: Just like the real one? No. But close.

reviews.review_text: Real coconut water, I lived on this growing up so I know what it taste like. Ive tried other brands of coconut water but they do not taste as good and pure. Bought 2 cases of 12 using PRIME. $13.98 per case 266.4 Oz for $27.96 0.10 per oz
I like the light taste and I feel healthier when I drink Coconut Water! Plus it has more potassium than a banana. Love that too!

We are faithful Vita Coco drinkers. We absolutely love the convenient size, packaging and flavor. My reasoning for giving this product from Amazon two stars is because its not the same as what I'm used to. I normally purchase this product in retail stores or from a big box warehouse. When I found out it was available through subscribe and save, I subscribed to the product thinking I was going to get the same quality as I normally do plus saving time and money. We've gone through 2 boxes from Amazon and there is a noticeable difference in quality. I have read some reviews that mentioned there was a quality issue but decided to try it anyway. This may or may not be Amazon's fault. Quality really has a lot to do with the country it is being produced in. I check the bottle every single time I drink them now, I have seen Mexico, Brazil, Sri Lanka, and Philippines. So far, Brazil is by far the best tasting. These two boxes that came from Amazon were both produced in Sri Lanka. The juice was not as clear and had more of a yellow tinge. It also had more of a syrupy consistency. It wasn't completely bad or spoiled, but just not as fresh as I expected. I would stay away from subscribing to this product from Amazon.
reviews.review_header: We absolutely love the convenient size

reviews.review_text: This is our favorite brand of coconut water and we have tried plenty!! We take these skiing and camping in the high altitude for the electrolytes. I love that they do not need to be refrigerated until opened.
reviews.review_header: Convenient and so yummy! Mother of twins approves

reviews.review_text: After drinking coconut water directly from a coconut a couple of weeks ago, I was dying to have it on a regular basis w/o the hassle of opening real coconuts. So when I saw this, I had to have it. Before my Amazon delivery came, I purchased some from my Whole Foods market in the neighborhood. The one I bought from Whole Foods was so delicious - just like the water straight from a fresh coconut. However, when I received my Amazon order of the Vita Coco - it was sour and not very tasty. I won't return it as it will cost too much to ship back, but definitely buy this from a market, not online. The difference is night and day. Vita Coco makes a great product, but only when it's fresh.

I have tried different coconut water and this one is the best. 2 star rating is due to quality control issue this time. They are on sale right now $9.99 on amazon and I have bought 5 boxes, opened two boxes, tried 4 packs and all of them have weird and strange taste. They are expiring this year but not expired yet, I don't know their packing date. I guess they are on sale because they are expiring this year and their taste is not fresh like before. Update:- March 11th 2017 - All of the five boxes I had ordered were spoiled or close to spoil. I ordered one more later on and it is back to its original taste. It seems like I got some from their bad batch, Vita should look into it. If anybody else has experienced same like me, they should share thwt in their review
reviews.review_header: Tried different coconut water and this one is the best. 2 star rating is due to quality control issue

reviews.review_text: I have been drinking Vita Coco for about a year now. I love the mild taste, the consistency (as thin as water) that quenches thirst and how refreshing it is when it is chilled. It also tastes great frozen. Unfortunately, the most recent box of 12 I received was actually 11 bottles. One of the flaps of the box was open and a bottle is missing. I left a comment on the packaging 2 days ago, but haven't heard anything from anyone. Quite disappointment with the lack of feedback. I will be returning it.
reviews.review_header: Great taste, but box arrived open with a missing bottle.

reviews.review_text: Vita Coco tends to taste a little different than other coconut waters. It's hard to describe, but I feel like it tastes a little "thicker". It's personally my favorite type of coconut water. Coconut water is a favorite amongst runners and other athletes for its electrolytes and even popular amongst they non-athletes like myself. If you are wanting to try different coconut waters, I would recommend getting this one and another one to compare. The others tend to be more watery and have a stronger coconut flavor, whereas Vita Coco has a thicker, milkier like texture with a taste that's unique and hard to describe. I've noted that a few reviewers said they have received a bad patch of product. I've ordered 3-4 cases off of amazon and have not had any trouble with quality or consistency between batches. So I'm honestly not sure if they are just unlucky out of the thousands or if there is a particular seller that's holding onto bad stock. While the individual containers aren't huge, they aren't meant to be guzzled like a gatorade bottle. It's more of a "sipping" drink, or a way to quickly hydrate and get your electrolytes quickly.

Honestly LOVE this stuff! Just as it says, it is coconut water. This is a smaller size than what you would buy (as a single box) at a convenience store (11.1 oz for these). However, I think it is a perfect serving. I have priced it out and this is the same price as Costco, so with the free shipping it is totally worth it and a good deal.
reviews.review_header: The right price, the right size, a great product

reviews.review_text: Is there added sugar in this coco water?? Package say less than 1% fruit sugar and 15g sugars. This coco water is too sweet for me. Zico and some other coco waters, fresh and packaged, not as sweet. I prefer less sweet, so I will not be buying a whole box of this water again. Updated: It is a sweeter, but it is still good when refrigerated. Still nothing beats the real coconut water street vendors sell for $2 now.
reviews.review_header: A tad too sweet. Added natural sugar in this coco water??

reviews.review_text: We consume a few boxes of it in our house. Great taste, healthy. My son drinks only this, he doesn't like soda, so I'm feeding him with coconut water, the amount of sugar is very low compared to 'zero' sodas, no salt.
Was out of date and not as good as the original
This coconut water is delicious, refreshing and conveniently packaged. It is also organic. Coconut water is a satisfying slightly sweet beverage. It is a treat and so much healthier soda.

WHEN DRINKS ARE COLD: I prefer these over ZICO and ONE mainly because it has a stronger coconut flavor than the others at cold temps. And after taste for this is very minimal, at cold temps. However, WHEN DRINKS ARE ROOM TEMP: I would prefer ZICO more because there's no strong after taste at room temp (mainly because ZICO has little coconut flavor). However, the after taste is tolerable for VITACOCO as opposed to ONE. I can't stand ONE's after taste. Side note: the taste of each brand do vary a bit with each batch. One time I got a really good batch of ONE but that was it. Always remember that these can never compare to fresh young coconut juice which is wayyyyy superior. But chopping those coconuts is a pain in the bootie
reviews.review_header: Stronger flavor than the rest but is that a good thing?

reviews.review_text: Love love love coconut water. Grew up drinking it straight from the tree, and I've found this product to taste the closest to the natural coconut!!!
reviews.review_header: Vita coco tastes almost like the natural coconut!!

reviews.review_text: I love this brand of coconut water. I keep this in my home all the time. I drink Vita Cocoa and also uses it to make smoothies! It will hydrate your body quickly and stop you from getting leg cramps at night!!! 👍🏽❤️
reviews.review_header: Vita Coco Organic water will stop leg cramps I quickly!

reviews.review_text: This started out as reasonably priced but now has DOUBLED! Really absurd that people will buy into any price charged. It is refreshing but far from tasting anything like fresh coconut water. What's next a vitacoco IPO?
reviews.review_header: Not like fresh coconut water at all!!

reviews.review_text: Tasted like rotten eggs.. May be it was kept out in sun during delivery. When I received this item, container box was really warm and so does the coconut water, couldn't able to another sip after one. Tried 4 tetra packs after refrigeration but no help. I don't know whether it was bad from manufacturing unit or turned while in transit. Went to Costco and bought it from there , tastes really good but nothing wrong with the product
reviews.review_header: Buy from local store, delivery in hot states like AZ may turn it like rotten eggs

reviews.review_text: I love that this water is a healthy alternative to soda/pop and that it is GLUTEN FREE, as something like this should be anyway. The flavor is subtle enough and though it doesn't leave you with a WOW impression, it is so much better than most artificially flavored drinks. It is the perfect serving size. I also like that the packaging is light weight so you can travel with it. I order it through 'Subscribe and Save' program and I am able to save 15% off my order with 5 or more items ordered together.
reviews.review_header: A healthy alternative to soda/pop and that it is GLUTEN FREE

reviews.review_text: I really like this coconut water. It is a lot cheaper buying from Amazon than paying about $3 each elsewhere. I love the pineapple flavor better but this has less sugar. It tastes better cold but can also be drank room temperature. It has 15 grams of sugars, 60 calories and 0 fat.
Refreshing and light. When I’m REALLY thirsty, this is what I chose. Not too sweet and very satisfying. One to enjoy any time
This is great coconut water, but very expensive. I’ll only buy when in sale.

I normally drink another brand but the cost had gone up quite a bit, so I thought I'd give Vita Coco a try. It's okay, but not as good as I was expecting. It's a little too sweet and has a bit of an aftertaste. I bought two cases and I'll keep them to avoid the return hassle, but I won't buy it again.
I had a HORRIBLE experience today with this product! Do not buy this brand!
Cause my friend told me that coconut water is better for lose weight, so I buy it. Now I really like drink it for my break fast! tase fresh and good!
reviews.review_header: Cause my friend told me that coconut water is better for lose weight

reviews.review_text: Very poor packaging and the connection between head and body of several bottles were broken when trying to open the cap and liquid inside looks more brown than those unbroken bottles. I throw away those broken bottles. So far I opened 9 of 12 bottles and three of them were broken.

I was hugely skeptical about this product when I saw it first at my Bikram yoga studio, I assumed it was a fad and ignored it but now I feel silly for doing so! I tried it once when I was feeling especially tired and a little nauseous before a Bikram class thinking it couldn't hurt and was amazed to have one of my best ever classes. Now it is part of my routine and definitely helps me avoid feeling dizzy or overwhelmed by the heat, I think it is just way more effective than water at making sure you are properly hydrated when you need to be before exercise. Excellent product, I'm a fan now!

I love this coconut water. It reminds me of when I was a child, and Mom used to let me drink the juice right out of the coconut. It tastes good, and it is good for me. Coconut water is great for hydrating, especially when you have been physically active. The flavor is just right, and I never have to feel guilty about drinking it. Who needs sugary juices or soda pop, when you can have delicious coconut water?
Great brand of coconut water, the package makes it less expensive during off seasons for the stores
reviews.review_header: Great quality, good for quick grab and go source of K

reviews.review_text: Currently my favorite brand of coconut water. It seems to have a more consistent taste than the other brands. I have a subscride and save on 2 cases a month. With 4 active people in the house that is about the right amount for us and I don't even have to think about it. Great for winter time hydration and also for summertime cocktails!
reviews.review_header: very tasty brand of coconut water

reviews.review_text: Ok this is only a mouthful and for the price it's not what you want.
Low in calories compared to others. Fresh taste. More watery less milky than other brands. Awesome for a summer afternoon.
I love coconut juice, but this vita coco taste really bad. It tastes like the coconut got left in water in days and got bad then they extract the juice out of it. Awful taste. Not for me.

I've tried quite a few coconut waters and Vita Coco is one of my favorites! It is so delicious and doesn't have any weird aftertaste like so many others that I've tried. I like the smaller size as it is a perfect serving size to quench my thirst, although I have to admit that sometimes I drink 2 at a time when really thirsty.
Excellent rehydration and fresh coconut flavor. Easy open, top.

... this is the best I've had. If I compare with a real coconut, I'd give it 3 stars. But that would not be fair. I give 4 even though it is the best I've tasted, because I think some 'packaging/processing' tastes creep in. I've tasted at least 5 brands and this is the best. I grew up in a sub-tropical country, with coconut trees in my back yard. Nothing in a package can satisfy my discerning taste for coconut water. But I enjoy Vita Coco every day.
I love these better then any other brand I have tried. They are the perfect size to add to a lunch box.

For those of you interestd in the health benefits of this product, Vita Coco is a good resource and serves that need. It is unfortunately so good that you will consume it a faster rate than expected. It is a bit steep on price. We are all spoiled by the availability of sugared, high fructose corn syrup laden soda products and Vita Coco with its higher price is a pricey switch. Like all good for you products though this one's cost is worth it. The emerging country of Brazil has a good product and I can see it increasing in price not going down. Would love to see larger containers available so that I can pop one in the fridge and pour a glass over a few days.... Good product meeting your dietary and health needs, you will pay for it....
reviews.review_header: Good product, a bit steep on price

reviews.review_text: This brand of Coconut Water has the highest potassium that I can find so far. I am after the nutrients because I use it as my hydration drink every time I go to the gym and do some workout (especially long runs, sprintings, etc...) because it is very rich in Potassium (good for the muscles) I have it under Subscribe & Save to save up to 15%. But when I went to Costco, they have it cheaper. Amazon has the next best price for it if Costco runs out of stock.

Notice first of all, most of these reviews are pretty old. I had used this product 2 years back and I really, really liked it. I bought a twelve pack in the last year or so. I'm like "gross! what happened?" They have added vitamin C to this product as the label states. That gives it a funny aftertaste, kind of tangy. It doesn't state in what form the vitamin C is in, or what type of product the vitamin C is from (citric acid? natural fruit source?). It could be some other reason...maybe they changed their coconut supplier, or have an additive that is not on the label. Keep in mind not all additives have to be on the label. It is definitely no longer the same product as in 2009. Did they actually think no one would notice? To fix this problem, I just went to using fresh young coconuts from Costco (the white ones). They come in box of 9 for about $16. You can easily open them with a chefs knife in about 40 seconds, and dump out the water into a bowel. There is an instruction video on the internet for your viewing pleasure. Keep as much plastic on as you can though, they dip the coconuts in a preservative before shipping. You get about 13.5 oz per coconut, so that would be $1.77. This item is about $1.71 per 11.1 oz. So the cost is very comparable, especially because you can use the pulp if you want. I have also seen them at Uwajimaya for $2.50 a piece. I don't find the pulp as useful as the brown dried coconuts however. Fresh pulp is more like a gel. So I say, why not just use fresh?
reviews.review_header: Not what it used to be...

reviews.review_text: I use it as a replacement for sports drinks, and as a quick pick me up and hydration source in the morning. I get headaches when I start getting dehydrated and I find coconut water alleviates the symptoms of dehydration and my headache much faster than water and without the risk of low electrolytes.

I had my doubts after reading all of the reviews. I had never tasted coconut water before, only coconut milk. There is a huge difference. Coconut water is very light, crispy, and refreshing. It has a very mild taste that is good alone or could easily be mixed into a smoothie or with alcohol (rum, vodka, etc). It hydrates the body better than water or sports drinks. I used it when I was sick. It helped me feel better a lot faster. I will be buying this again. The buy one case, get one case deal free is a great bargain!
This arrived as a replacement to a damaged one. These are consistent in flavor but the pink refrigerated coconut water from Costco is amazing.

The only coconut water we love in my house. I love it so much that it almost replaced my water consumption, which is not healthy and very expensive. Lately I mix filtered water with a little bit of this coconut water and drink that throughout the day. Recommend.
reviews.review_header: The only coconut water we love in my house

reviews.review_text: This has a very flat taste. I won't be buying this again.
reviews.review_header: I didn't like this; flat taste

reviews.review_text: Great, natural flavor. I love coconut everything. It also helps with my stomach issues and indigestion so double bonus

Coming from a company that has already lost one lawsuit over false advertising claims you'd think they would be a little more careful about what they put on their packaging. "PURE coconut water" "like sticking a straw in a coconut" Except if you read the ingredient label and then check their website you'll see where they admit to adding sugar to the product. If you're adding sugar to it then it's no longer 100% pure coconut water. Those of us who choose a natural product understand that the taste and consistency of products will vary, as is noted on the label: "taste and color may vary". They've also added vitamin C, which doesn't bother me as much, but once again it's that issue of I'm buying a 100% coconut water product and I don't want you messing with it. Take ZICO for example. Their product contains less sugar and no vitamin C based on their label. The ingredient list is 100% natural coconut water. I can accept pasteurizing a product, but don't add stuff to it and then call it 100% pure coconut water. Even if it's a tiny amount added to help with product consistency it's still no longer a pure product. However, they know that if they were honest and the front of the container said "coconut water with added sugar" they would lose a portion of their consumer base. Why is honesty so hard to get these days from companies that sell products in this niche market?
Tasty coconut water. Have to hide it to make sure I have some for myself.

I love this drink, I buy them as much as I can. They're always fresh and great for a drink at my work to rehydrate, I love that it's not concentrate and I love all of the flavor options there are. A++++
I have tried some pretty terrible coconut water. This one is top shelf. Taste wonderful. All natural right from the coconut. What more can you ask for if you don't have a coconut tree.

To be honest, when I first opened one of these up and took a big sip, I just about lost my lunch. What best described it when I first tired was that I thought I could have been drinking someone's spit. Not the taste I was expecting, that's for sure. So I thought well now what I am supposed to do with all this since I bought a huge case from amazon. I had been doing a lot of Bikram Yoga and read that coconut water was the best thing to hydrate with, so I said well I will just drink all of these until I run out, and just deal with the taste of it by drinking as fast as possible. Needless to say the first few packages were hard to swallow, literally, but after I had drank them for about a week I started to like the more and more, to the point where I could enjoy the drink. Now I order them on a regular basis, I don't know if it just takes a while to get used to them or not, but I would highly recommend this item. I have been feeling better since starting this drink and they are worth the money!
Tastes metallic, I had confused this for my normal brand as the package is similar. I enjoy other brands but I would strongly recommend against this one
Nice source of potassium a bit pricey

I bought some other brands before but too much artificial flavors made them taste better but fake. I also like the size very much (11.1 once). Good quality and tastes good, but price is usually kinda expensive (unless when it's on sale!) .. please be advised Coconut Water naturally is not sugar free ... Coconut Water is a great source of potassium.

I live in the Caribbean and I am accustomed to drinking it straight out of the nut, I use this whenever I am in the US and it really is as close to the real thing that you can get in a pack. Recommendation if I may, Coconut water (in general, and this one if you can't get it direct from the nut) makes a fantastic chaser, especially with Scotch, Rum and even Vodka. tastes horrible

My go-to for coconut water. I've tried some of the other mainstream options but they have too much fake coconut flavor and one tastes like I was downwind of a large man in a speedo wearing banana boat sunscreen. Great post-run/workout drink

Having recently purchase a way too expensive blender to assist in the making of smoothies for increased vegetable consumption, I needed a liquid that would impart benefit and not an overpowering flavor. Hence my purchase of this product. The small size is perfect for my needs and I highly recommend the product if you have similar need

I ordered Vita Coco because I read how healthy it was, and I thought it would be an excellent alternative to soda. Plus I grew up in South Florida where coconut ice cream and cake were daily specialties. But I rarely drink one of these a week because I haven't seemed to acquire a taste for it. It's very sweet, which normally suits me, but I don't find it compelling enough to want to drink more. I suggest that potential buyers try it and determine how much you like it before making a purchase.

I just love Vita Coco coconut water and have been buying it locally for several years---I like the mild flavour and love drinking it after a workout. I recently moved to a more rural area and found that the price on Amazon was much better than what I could get at my nearby grocery store. I normally purchase the 11.1 oz boxes but decided that the best price was to be had on the Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 17-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) . Unfortunately, my first case arrived a week or so ago and I was absolutely appalled! The coco water was virtually undrinkable. It was very sour, slightly discolored, and nothing like the drink to which I'd become accustomed. I immediately contacted Amazon, and they agreed to ship me another box at no charge. The second case was similarly poor in quality. I told Amazon that I'd like a refund so that I could order a different size. The case of Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.1-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) just arrived, and it has been only marginally better in taste, if at all. I don't know if Amazon is storing the coconut water improperly, if Vita Coco has produced a bad batch (they all have exp dates in October of 2012), or if they've somehow altered their source or coco water/Vit C mixture (all boxes say they are produced in the Philippines). I plan to contact Vita Coco directly to find out the problem, and will also be requesting a third refund from Amazon. These boxes taste so bad that I plan to pour them all down the sink in order to recycle the tetrapaks. Very disappointed.

I love this brand of coconut water and do not remember the first time to buy. I wanted to give five stars, but due to that seems it tasted slightly different than before, I will leave four stars for now.

I work a 12 hr. shift & in a place where temps can get up to 90 degrees. I sometimes get over heated. Glad I keep the coconut water around. I get the plain & add 4 or 5 drops of lemon juice to it & the taste is good. I don't know any place that has it where I live. The nearest grocery store is over 60 miles. So I but it here and will hit reorder anytime I need more.
Good product & would recommend
reviews.review_header: Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pure - review

reviews.review_text: My first coconut water I was drinking straight from the coconut in the Philippines, which is very aromatic and obviously - you can in no way beat that flavour and the healthy properties of "living", unpasteurized coconut water straight from the coconut. Absolutely no processed coconut water can ever beat this. The problem is access to fresh coconuts. In the Philippines, which even has a ministry for coconuts, they are availabe on every market and street corner, totally fresh. This is different in the US, were most coconuts are imported and therefore most are old. I tried some and did not like half of them. If no fresh coconuts are available, this pasteurized tetrapacked drink is pretty nice. The heat of pasteurization seems to destroy the rich flavour of fresh juice straight form the coconut, but that is the price for convenience.
reviews.review_header: The next best after the real coconut

reviews.review_text: I've tried all the available coconut water out there (yes, I am a coco NUT; great for rehydrating if you do hard workouts), and Vita is the best and best value. I could say bad things about others (like tasting like their plastic containers) but I won't mention names. Simply put, Vita tastes fresh and clean all the time.

I purchased a case of three different brands of coconut water from Amazon to compare; UFC, C2O and Vita Coco. While at Whole Foods I talked to the man who stocked the coconut water section and I learned two things. First, he told me when I asked which coconut water tasted best that it depended on the lot. He explained that since coconuts were plants, each harvest was different and that the SAME brand varied in taste depending on the lot. I guess it is kind of like wine. Second, he said that differnt coconut waters contain different levels of sugar and that I should note the sugar content on the package. With that additional information in mind, I considered that various lots may be different in taste but the sugar content on the label should remain fairly consistent. Among the three coconut waters C2O tasted the sweetest but I liked the flavor of UFC best. That's purely a personal opinion. My guess is that most would like C2O best due to it's sweeter taste. C2O was sweetest, UFC next and Vita Coco least sweet. I then compared the amount of sugar listed on the label. Although there should be no added sugar, coconut water contains natural sugar. I am listing the sugar per ounce since the sugar is listed on the label as per serving but serving size varies from 8 ounces to 11.1 ounces therefore a grams per ounce measurement gives you an apples to apples comparison. C2O 1.5g/oz, VitaCoco 1.35g/oz and UFC 1g/oz. UFC actually tastes sweeter to me than VitaCoco (or rather more flavorful) but has nearly a third less sugar and much less sugar than C2O. For me the choice is clear, UFC. It has the least amount of sugar and it tastes best since I don't prefer overly sweet drinks but I do like the flavor. I bought the UFC in 1L wax paper containers, C2O in 17.5 oz (530ml) cans and VitaCoco in 11.1 oz. wax paper containers. All of the coconut waters tasted very good and I don't think that you will be disappointed in either of them. UPDATE Oct 2015: C20 has actually reduced the sugar content in the latest 1L carton that I purchased. It is now 7g/serving which is 0.875g/oz. I now buy C2O since it has the least amount of sugar and tastes very good. C2O is also rather widely available in stores.
Just delicious. Far and above other store coconut water health drink brands.
reviews.review_header: Way better than the usual store brands!

reviews.review_text: This taste strange and coco water looks yellow. Same as other people complaining. Possibly not kept in cool storage in Amazon warehouses.
reviews.review_header: Possibly not kept in cool storage in Amazon warehouses

reviews.review_text: A bit sweeter than expected, but this coconut water helped me increase my supply while breastfeeding! It was strange I had more supply with this coconut water than the natural ones or the actual water from a young coconut.

If you are thirsty, this would me my last choice after a sports activity, etc. Has a somewhat thicker consistency compared to gatorade or other sports drinks. Flavor is bland. It may be good for you, but I wouldn't consider it to be a pleasantly flavorful or thirst quenching drink.
My kids love these! Great way to hydrate while playing hard at the park or on a picnic.
Great product, good packaging, good expiration dates. Great price made even better when using Amazon's Subscribe & Save program! It would be wonderful if you mark my review as helpful--thanks! :-)

reviews.review_text: After shipping, you may be able to save money getting it at a big box store like Costco who seems to carry it pretty regularly now, based on your location. The product itself is great. A HUGE dose of Potassium in a small container, great for thirst, under the weather moments and athletes. If you need to absorb shipping, it's worth it...if not, then get it at the store. Good idea for a discount is the subscriber plan.

I drink this product all the time but when this arrived at the house we had just eaten and I drank one straight down, it tasted funny but I thought it just did not go well with what we ate. I drank another later and it was sour and tasted as though it went bad. I looked at the packaging and nothing indicated it should be bad. My 22 year old daughter took one sip of one and said "don't drink these, they are spoiled" ... She works out a lot and drinks coconut water because it is higher in potassium than Gatorade etc. Will not order this product again.

reviews.review_text: This product was very well packaged and arrived in excellent condition. And it is what it is, coconut water. I use it in so very many different ways. And it is perfect for those uses. I recommend this product for anyone and everyone.

Tasty coconut water. Small portions (about 2/3 of a can of soda). These are sweet and contain 15g of sugar per 11.1 oz package. Some coconut waters taste "soapy" to me like they are past their prime but the Vita Coco coconut water tastes sweet without the "soapy" taste. One of the most refreshing way to hydrate

In little green letters on each juice box it claims that this drink is "like sticking a straw in a coconut." Well, it certainly seems that way. VitaCoco uses 100% pure coconut water and it is not from concentrate. I purchased a box of this due to health related purposes. Coconut water, for those who do not know, is very close to human blood. In the past, they actually used to use coconut water as an IV! That's how close coconut water is in terms of blood-like properties. This of course is a good thing. Also, coconut oil (as opposed to coconut water) is very good for your since it does not turn toxic when you cook it like other oils. In addition to these things, coconut has antibiotic and antimicrobial properties, and is very good for the skin. With this drink, I can one day have the skin necessary to ask Jessica Alba on a date. Coconut water is one of the best things for moisturizing your body from the inside out. Here is a summary of this product: PROS: -One of the best internal moisturizers for your body -Is not diluted; it is not from concentrate -Good antimicrobial properties -Has blood-like properties CONS: -Initial taste may not suit you (it may take time to adjust) -Amazon does not sell it for free
reviews.review_header: Like putting a straw in a coconut

I have this on auto delivery, but I am going to cancel it today. I am sure there are some health benefits to drinking this stuff, but here are my qualms: Taste is not like it came right out of the shell. It has a boxed like taste. Sugar is too high. I can't have that amount of sugar on a regular basis. For hydrating nothing beats water. I workout every day and run as well as chop wood. My diet is varied and provides more than enough of these nutrients. Blood test was excellent. Nutritional content; I am sure it has some of the qualities that it boasts, but I am not willing to make the sugar compromise for the magnesium/potassium benefit. I will just take a supplement. It is cheaper. Plus I eat way to much cocoa and that has the highest amount of magnesium from a natural product. For potassium; plantains are good. They are just like bananas. A diverse diet is best.

The expiration date was ok, so it's not an expired product. Is it just me or a bad batch? Well, I'm not taking my chances with this. Returning and will try another brand.

I love this it’s very much

Disgusting taste. I had to hold my nose shut to drink this, and find something to get rid of the after taste. Didn't finish off four. Got through two. The others are just sitting around. I can't give them away. I hate waste. This was a waste.

as it kind of had a weird taste at first, kind of mild like water although very minimally sweet. reviews.review_text: I'm brand new to coconut water and when I saw it on Amazon's Deal of the Day, I decided to order a pack. I read the reviews and saw that some others have complained about the water being yellow and tasting sour, but I figured I'd give it a shot anyway. This is my favorite drink now. I grew up in the Caribbean, so I love to drink coco water, from the real coconut. But I could only do it when I visit the Caribbean. Now I do have my coconut real water in a container. This taste like you are drinking it directly from the coco. I cannot taste any added sugar or any added flavor, it is pure coco water. I do have problem with sodium intake, the coco water helps me get rid off my sodium problem. I can eat salty food and then drink a coco water and help me flush the sodium. I am not in the medical field, but this is only my testimony. I don't write many reviews, mostly because lack of time or I don't like to write much, but I had to say something about this drink because has helped my health and my mood so much.

reviews.review_text: The Coco Vita coconut juice is 100% natural with no added sugar. It naturally has no fat, because it is from the coconut "milk" inside the nut, while many coconut products contain fat because they are processed from the coconut meat. Coconut fats are generally considered to be unhealthy becuase they are saturated. The product is very tasty and also healthful. I drink it especially for the naturally high potassium content, which is important for maintaining blood chemistry.

Granted, the taste of unflavored coconut water will make some people reach for chaser, but I personally enjoy it. Sometimes it's hard to drink water throughout the day when you're running between office, home and errands. But when you need hydration for that evening workout, it's nice to know this will give me a little edge. For those who are afraid to try it, I recommend trying the pineapple or mango flavor first.
. . . very tasty, very well priced, the perfect portion size. I was surprised by the latter, but I often kept some of my leftover other brand in the fridge after opening it.
reviews.review_header: good price, good size, good taste

reviews.review_text: The vita coco product is good . I have bought it several times from other stores as well, but this one was had gone tangy and sour. It only happens if the product is an old one. Please do not ship products that hav gone bad.

In the grocery store these this brand is hard to find and I compromised and got the coconut water in the cans....That was like drinking a metal laced drink. People seem to run the spectrum on coconut water. Boxes say product of Sri Lanka, in the past it has come from Brazil and the Philippines. Have it on Subscribe and Save via Amazon, which is great. Nice price and one less heavy box I gotta unload.

The price is very reasonable- half the price I used to pay at the local store.

I drink on average two of these a day. The potassium is great and the lack of sugars and sodium doesn't make me feel guilty about drinking it everyday. To be honest, I give the taste a A-, but that's fine with me because it's more natural and not concentrated. VitaCoCo doesn't add flavor or sweetner, it's just in it's natural form and flavor. I ordered it again and the second time was bad. Liquid was a bit yellowish in color and it tasted a bit rancid. Amazon was nice enough to replace it. BUT ... the 3rd batch was worse. It wasn't yellowish, but it was a bit darker in color. And it did not taste like coconut water at all. I was hoping the 3rd batch would be better - as it had a best before date of April 2010. The second batch was January 2010. But I guess that doesn't really make a difference, as you may get unlucky (twice?!) and get a bad batch. I am not contacting Amazon for another replacement. Dissapointing. No more buying coconut water online for me.

Supposedly this is one of the best drinks to replenish electrolytes - a natural Gatorade, as it were - with minimal calories and natural ingredients (just coconut water) - no sugar added or anything else for that matter. In terms of taste, I was less than enthused. Sure, this tastes fine, but the thick texture really got to me. It tasted of coconut for sure, but it was very sweet (although not artificially). It was refreshing, but this variety really wasn't floating my boat so to speak. Due to the excellent nutrition facts, I would definitely try the other flavored varieties, such as Acai & Pom, Pineapple, Peach & Mango, Tangerine and Passion Fruit. Availability - The availability of Vita Coco has really grown over the past couple months. reviews.review_text: I ordered a case each of Vita Coco, Zico, Naked, and ONE. I like my coconut water room temperature, which none of the manufacturers suggest as the optimal way to enjoy their products. Maybe this review will be useful to others that drink thinks at room temperature. I am comparing each of the four against actual fresh coconut water extracted out of a fresh young coconut, which I've been drinking for years. Here are my rankings: 1. Vita Coco has the most natural flavor, with no off tastes, and a slightly sweet, nutty flavor. 2 (tie). Zico tastes slightly citrusuy and slighty "green" (like a green banana). 2 (tie). ONE ends on a slightly bitter note. 4. Naked has an off taste that I do not care for at all. I threw out all of the "Naked" boxes after my taste test. Zico and ONE are drinkable, but both have flavors beyond the pure clean coconutty taste of Vita Coco. I won't through the Zico or ONE out, but I'll drink all the Vita Coco first.

reviews.review_text: I only recently jumped on the coconut water bandwagon, so this is a new convert review. The Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.1-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) is an affordable way to get my coconut water fix, thanks to the additional discount of the Subscribe & Save program. It comes out to about half the price when buying it individually in stores (at least the ones I checked). Taste wise, I don't really have a preference between this and the Zico coconut water. This size is a better for me because once I open a bottle, I usually finish it off. So this size serves as portion control. One tetra pak is 60 calories. But my pet peeve still remains, if it has calories and other ingredients, can we please call it something other than water? While this is coming out of a coconut so it's not as bad, I find it rather annoying that different companies make sugary drinks or drinks with sugar-substitutes and call them water. Okay, rant is over! Overall, I like this. I usually drink it over a few ice cubes. I try to limit it to one per day, since 60 calories are 60 calories. My next experiment is to make ice cubes out of it, but I need a bigger ice cube tray! PS: the 12pk arrives in a sturdy colorful cardboard box that can be reused/repurposed.
Good Product

Disappointed in added sugar and citric acid (vitamin C) as additional ingredients. It's not bad, but it tastes a little sweeter and a little more sour than 100% pure coconut water. I would've rated it 4 stars, as it's decent for what it is, except I feel the claims on the packaging are completely false and intentionally misleading. "Pure coconut water" "hydrate naturally", in large print on the front of the package, are blatant lies, as is "like sticking a straw in a coconut" on the top of the package. Also bear in mind, on a large manufacturing scale, sugar is a bunch cheaper than coconut water so the company is substituting a cheap filler ingredient for 1% of their product. I also can't help but notice vita coco isn't 1% cheaper than the competition.

I've always just bought coconut water in the grocery store, never on amazon.com. I tried vitacoco in the store. I don't know if they've changed their formula, but what I had in the store tasted pretty good, so I ordered a case from amazon. Maybe amazon is carrying a different version, but what I got doesn't taste the same as what I had in the store. There is a weird grape-like taste, like canned grape juice. I'm pretty sure the version I had from the grocery had Vitamin C listed as an ingredient (which I didn't mind). This package lists no ingredients besides coconut water, which I don't think is true advertising. It's not listed as an ingredient, but the package says it contains 230% of the Daily Value of Vitamin C. Coconuts are not a natural source of vitamin C, so I find it suspicious that it has that much and Vitamin C/Ascorbic Acid is not listed as an ingredient. I would not order this again.

Sad to say, I purchased two cases of this product recently when it was featured on deal of the day. I had been hearing a lot about the health benefits of coconut water and this was a good deal and made this expensive "health drink" affordable to me. When I opened the case, I discovered that it contains "less than 1% added fruit sugar". Wasn't sure what that meant, so I looked it up. Turns out, fruit sugar is another name for FRUCTOSE. The total grams of sugar listed is 15 for the 11 oz container. It's not clear how much of this is from the fructose. I went to the Vita Coco website and they say they add the "fruit sugar" to standardize the sweetness. They say it is not from corn, but from fruits. I doubt the body much cares where the fructose comes from. Fructose. like sugar, is not good for your health. Check out "Sugar, the bitter truth" on youtube by Dr Lustig. Note: this is my second attempt at a review. Amazon seems to have censored and not published my first one.

Between cooking, using it for body products and just plain old drinking it, I use a heck of a lot of coconut water. So when I came across Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pure, 11.1 Ounce here on Amazon and it was available to add to my subscriptions I has on it. This is one of my favorite brands of coconut water and I really like that the packaging is recyclable and designed to take up less space (able to crush it) in the bin. The fact that each container is resealable is also a plus just in case I do not use the entire amount in what ever I am doing. I really like the fact that it is available for subscription. So I no longer have to remember when I go to the store and then have to lug it back on a bus! STAR RATINGS: Each product is carefully reviewed in an unbiased manner. Star ratings are earned, never given. 5 Star: I really love this product, it is an exceptional, impressive product. It is very well made (designed, formulated, composed, etc) and lives up to the product details and description. It exceeds normal consumer expectations. 4 Star: I like this product. It meets the product description, details, and normal customer expectations. It does what it is supposed to do. 3 Star: This is not a negative rating. It is a neutral rating. I could take it or leave it. It met the product description and details for the most part but isn't something I am ever likely to order again. 2 Star: I don't like this product. It has mistakes in the product details or description and does not live up to what it advertises or normal customer expectations. 1 Star: I really do not like this product. There may be something wrong in the product details or description, it does not live up to what it is advertised as. I would tell my friends, acquaintances, and strangers that they shouldn't use their hard earned money on this product. Thank you for taking the time to read my review. Please consider following me here on Amazon for other reviews. Thanks and have a blessed day.

I love Coconut Water!! Coconut water is arguably the healthiest beverage on the planet as it is filled with protein, fiber and electrolytes. Considering its amazing ability to hydrate, you can think of it as “Nature’s Gatorade”. I have to say that I have tasted many different brands of Coconut Water and to me Vita Coco is the very best tasting of the bunch! Vita Coco is 100% Coconut Water and doesn't use juice from concentrate. Vita Coco has so many health benefits. It is naturally refreshing; coconut water has a sweet, nutty taste. I recently bought this from Amazon and I am really happy with results. Since I have grown up drinking coconut water fresh out of the shell, I can tell subtle differences in the taste. From the brands I have tried so far, Vita Coco comes closest to the fresh coconut water from the shell. The taste is similar to the water from "raw" coconuts which do not have any tender coconut flesh formed in them. Personally I prefer the water from a little "ripe" coconuts. As the flesh forms in the coconut the quantity of water reduces but it tastes sweeter. I like the fact that there are no added ingredients in this coconut water and unlike "Zico" this is not made from concentrate but 100% real fresh coconut water. BTW, Zico is terrible. Don't bother trying it. See my review of "Zico" for details. I am into outdoor sports and drink coconut water after exhaustive workouts. It provides both hydration and electrolytes. I liked Vita Coco so much that I have subscribed to it from Amazon. I am giving 4 Stars simply because it does not have my "preferred taste", but there is nothing negative about this product. I think they should include a straw. It does not bother me but some people may prefer a straw.

When a user drinks directly from the carton there is a big dribble from the joint area between the blue plastic and the paper of the carton itself. This occurs in about one third of the cartons. It's a big dribble, not just a drop or two, and it can very easily totally mess up the front of the clothing all the way down to the feet. Besides the messed-up clothing there's loss of product. The contents is acceptable: sweet and generally tasty. I failed to read that the coconut water does contain sugar. I won't buy this brand again because of the issue with the carton, and also because I'd rather not drink sugared coconut water.

reviews.review_text: I prefer an Asian coconut water, and as such could hardly stomach the Brazilian product that was going into Vita Coco (and I've noticed is still in the 17 oz and larger tetrapaks). Since they have switched over to using coconuts from the Philippines the flavor is much less tart and acidic, and there are nice nutty nuances and a more flat sweetness. If you haven't tried Vita Coco in the last six months, I encourage you to do so... especially if you are a fan of Amy & Brians or Thai coconut waters/juices.

I was filling an Amazon Pantry box when I saw this with a coupon and figured this was a good time to try. Maybe it is just the brand, or maybe they all taste alike, I wouldn't know to say. All I can say is that I could only manage a few sips of this milky/watery beverage. It was slightly sweet, which I normally like, it did have authentic coconut flavor, but, I don't know, it just didn't taste Good. At least not to me. I was very disappointed. And more so to leave a less than stellar review, as that always makes me feel bad. But I am here to help others as they have helped me, so I have to do what needs to be done. Some of you might love this, I'm not saying we will all have the same experience. But I definitely am not a fan. Sorry : (

Hi all. After many food purchases here on Amazon, this the first time sufficiently compelled to provide feedback. Most products have been just fine, thank you. First order of 11 oz Vita Coco was great. I was shocked. Printed on lower right side of carton "Produced in Brazil" Second order, this order of 2 cases, first taste...horrendous. Almost undrinkable. If it were undrinkable I would have scored just 1 star. In any case, "I" will not be drinking it. This second order, lower right side states "Produced in Philippines" Hmm. Having been to the Philippines, I am not surprised! Conclusion: Look for "Produced in Brazil" on carton. "Born in Brazil" is worthless and meaningless. Ignore. I'll be asking for "Produced in Brazil" coconut water only. May have to settle for local shopping, since there is no way I reckon to confirm source with Amazon orders. On the other hand, may have just been a fluke, but i doubt it. Even freshly cut-and-served coconuts sold on Philippine streets were often so-so tasting. Probably the result of baking in the hot sun, as these fruit carts were not shaded. Poor people just trying to feed their families, can hardly blame 'em. One more example of how competition detracts from quality of life here in this 21st century. I guess I'll be hopping between natural food stores checking labels, attempting to dodge unhealthy poor quality foods, that I thought we were paying the government to protect us from. hmm. T (more on this subject at my 17 oz review, also the mini Zico's)

I love coconut water/juice. Every time I go to any market I look for it and buy it and have a good idea of what's out there. Occasionally I even buy real coconuts. But on to the review. I bought this pack of 12 for a little less than $1.00 a unit. I've tasted it room temperature, chilled, with ice, and even frozen. It's barely sweet, in fact a sour taste stands out more than anything. If one knows what coconut taste like then one can find the coconut flavor some where in this juice, but it doesn't stand out. The juice is pretty clear with a SLIIIIIIGHT yellow color tint so there was no oddities with the coloration. I really did try to like this product, I've only 3 units left and still I'm just not seeing it. Perhaps a bad batch???... a really bad batch??? If this was someone's first experience with coconut juice, they would probably not be a big fan of it. I will refrain from buying this product, and I advise the same to others.

DO NOT BUY. This is a sugar added and sweetened product. It is NOT pure coconut water as stated on the label. Deceptive advertising at best. Vita Coco used to be coconut water but they decided that mother nature/God doesn't know how to formulate coconuts and have corrected the mistake by adding sugar. I email Vita Coco asking about this and got a marketing BS response about how they need to sweeten so it's consistent. I guess if you buy a whole coconut in the store Vita Coco has injected it with sugar to correct nature's mistake. This is a blatant attempt to fool people with a sweeter tasting product instead of offering an unaltered natural product.

reviews.review_text: I just ordered a pack of these and a pack of zico and hands down I can say zico tastes better. It wasn't so much about the initial taste but more about the "after taste." Zico has an after taste that's not very different from the initial taste and is manageable. Vita, however, has a weird acidic-like after taste that I just cant get used to. IT kind of reminds me of vomit tbh. Idk. Maybe I got a bad batch or something. I ordered this on 3-27-2013 and the exp date is july 2013, whereas, zico was ordered on the same day and the exp date is sept 2015. But this probably isn't the reason why vita has that weird after taste. It seems other people have had the same experience as well. Some people actually prefer vita over zico so I think it all just really comes down to the individual. I recommend buying each brand and testing it out for yourselves. There is only so much we can do to describe the taste of a drink in the form of text.

reviews.review_text: I bought two 12 packs of this brand. It tastes ok to me, but I haven't compaired it to the other brands yet. The high amount of vitamin C contained in one serving has me concerned. I found I got a canker sore the next day after drinking my first box. I also wonder how they can call it 100% pure if it has added Vitamin C - which they would have to do in order to get a 230% daily value - that's about 138mg of vita c, and the normal amount (I found while net surfing) is about 5 mg per 8oz serving, which should make this no more than 10 mg of vita c for 11.2 oz. I will use this up(hopefully) with food prep and meals, but it's too much vita c for me to drink a box every day.

reviews.review_text: I was completely head over heels for this brand of coconut water. Some friends who had visited me recently were real coconut water NUTS. They had case upon case of vita coco in their car. They left some with me and I grew to love it. I have always been a fan of coconut anway..even adding the oil to drinks and drinking it dissolved in warm water etc. I believe in the health benefits in moderation. So, I began ordering here monthly and have enjoyed carton after carton until I recently opened my new box and drank a carton. First pouring it into the cup it was urine yellow..not kidding! I guess almost like apple juice. I was really skeeved but decided to drink it...and it was disgusting. Didn't smell very bad, just off, but was nothing like the white cloudy vita coco with a yummy almost milk like taste I have grown accustomed to. I decided to open another the next day and same story..I felt like gagging it was so strong and gross tasting...not even close to the same drink and certainly not refreshing by any stretch of the imagination. I decided to look in the recycling at the old cartons left in there that I had drank previously, and I made the discovery that my old vita coco's were made in Brazil while this new box, all the cartons said product of Mexico...that must be it, maybe?? I called Amazon and let them know and they sent me a replacement box. This new box also had cartons made in Mexico. I refrigerated two to try. The next day I opened one and sure enough..yellow and disgusting. Not as bad as the first box but same taste overall. I will pour them all down the drain. What a complete waste. Needless to say I will not order vita coco ever again unless maybe I had a guarantee the coconuts were from Brazil. I am saddened but now I am trying a new brand, Naked..we'll see! Amazon was great about the whole thing. I hope they can clarify this disparity with vita coco. It's a shame vita coco does not have better quality control. I know their packaging states there is variance between the products but this was not an acceptable variance..this was just plain disgusting and no one in their right mind would drink them!
reviews.review_header: Loved it until I got a case produced in Mexico

My wife has been drinking coconut water since she was little. I have never drank coconut water in my life. I originally picked up some cases of ZICO for my wife a few months ago when Amazon was running a promotion. She liked it and thought it was pretty good. I took one sip and that was all I could stand, and vowed never to try it again! My wife just recently used up all the ZICO so I came to Amazon to buy some more for her. While here, I happened to stumble across the Vita Coco brand and decided to read the customer reviews. I was very happy with what I had read, so I decided to take a chance and purchase a case. It arrived yesterday and after chilling it in the fridge for a while, I gave one to my wife to try. She let out a big MMMMM after the first sip! I was curious, so I deicided to grab my own carton and have a taste. One sip turned into two, and then three, and four, and more! I have to say, Vita Coco is a really great tasting coconut water, and I am now hooked! This may sound silly, but for me the package graphics actually make the beverage more enjoyable! I originally bought this for my wife, but now I'm back here on Amazon and ready to purchase some more before I end up drinking it all myself! Let me just finish by saying that for someone who had never drank coconut water in his life, and could not tolerate a second sip of ZICO, you can believe that Vita Coco is a great tasting, quality brand that I'm sure you will just love! I only wish it was a little cheaper on the wallet, but it's still worth it in my book. Guess that will make me savor it even more, like a fine wine. I just finished one carton about 10 minutes ago, and now after writing this review, I'm ready to grab another one! For the record, my intent is not to bash ZICO at all. My wife still likes the taste of it and would still buy it. You may have tried it and like it as well, and that's good! I'm just giving my opinion as someone who has never drank coconut water at all, and found Vita Coco to be the most enjoyable to me. If you're not sure, then give them both a try and see what you think. But if you are new to coconut water, I think you would enjoy the Vita Coco brand and should probably give that a try first.
