Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pure, 11.1 Ounce (Pack of 12) First off I'll admit that I have never drank from a coconut before. I enjoy coconut flavored foods and drinks but I have never eaten or drank the juice from a real coconut. I opened a carton of this stuff and immediately recoiled in disgust at the mere smell coming from it. Certain that the liquid must have spoiled I checked the expiration date and tried opening a second carton but to the same effect. Deciding that must be how it normally smells I gave it an experimental sip........and immediately gagged. I couldn't even take a full swig much less actually swallow it. What does this tastes like you ask? Hmmm, imagine you get a Sprite with your combo meal at a fast food place, drink half of it, and then leave it in your hot garage for two weeks until fuzzy mold starts growing in it. It would taste a lot like this Vita Coco Coconut Water. This is without a doubt the most awful tasting liquid I have ever come across in my life. It's worse than all the various nasty medicines my mother forced me to take when I was a child. It's worse than the time I accidentally drank from a jug that my dad had put frog legs in. If I were to describe what this stuff is to a child I would call it "fruit urine". The fact that this isn't some crazy snake oil miracle cure but an actual beverage is shocking to me. If you are looking for something to drink try literally ANYTHING besides this stuff.

Warning: These are NOT FROM BRAZIL! The product I received is from Sri Lanka!! -_- Yuck! If you are unaware of the horrific sanitary conditions in Sri Lanka, then do some research before you consume this coconut product (or any other from countries like Vietnam, India, China, Bangladesh, Cambodia, Indonesia, etc)... yeah, "filthy" doesn't even begin to describe how dirty and unsanitary these countries are. People walk barefoot in filthy, feces-covered streets, no one washes their hands, water is dirty and murky from city sources... yuck. I refuse to drink these and risk my personal safety and drink chemicals/dirt/parasites/botulism that may come along with this product. No way I am taking a chance. I am not saying this product is unsafe, but as a consumer I just refuse to even TRY a product produced in an unsanitary/disgusting country, in the case of the batch I received, Sri Lanka. I know what these country's sanitation and safety procedures are and they are filthy. So no, thank you, I will be returning this. They are misleading people by saying the product is from Brazil (a safe, modern, and sanitary country), when it is not. These are coming from Sri Lanka, and I expect other batches to come from India, Indonesia, and etc. Totally not for me. Yuck!
reviews.review_header: Not Brazilian coconut water anymore- now is low qual stuff! WARNING!

Great, tastes good and very refreshing.
a functional alcoholics 3rd best friend
reviews.review_header: "Put some lime in it if between the months of May and August" - The Rob's Almanac

reviews.review_text: Best one yet.

I love a good coconut water and I used to love getting goods deals on it from Amazon. Let me preface by saying I don't know if the problem is caused by the manufacturer or by Amazon's handling of this product. I have been drinking coconut water for years and there is nothing like it for hydration and re-mineralizing in a hurry. Here is the problem, the last (2) cases of VitaCoco that I received from Amazon were VERY off tasting. I don't know how to describe it exactly except to say it was a bit sour and not quite fresh. I could not drink it and I know that it is not supposed to taste like this. If I had to imagine the problem I might guess the product was allowed to experience large scale temperature changes, but who knows? I won't buy this product from Amazon anymore because I don't have time to deal with sending it back and ordering again. I have been Buying Amy&Brians at the Organic Grocery down the street. Buyer beware.
Taste great!
DELICIOUS
Thank good item
Some bottles were leaked at cap. I'm not sure to buy again.

It was supposed to be - Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.1-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) Vita Coco Instead I got a variety pack. Okay this time but need - Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.1-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) Vita Coco
Taste great.
To expensive for the size xoxo
great
Sugar water; not really coconut water
reviews.review_header: Sugar water; not really coconut water

reviews.review_text: I didn't realize that it had added Sugar, wouldn't have purchased if I knew it.
I've been reading all about this product and how great it is so I thought I'd try it. I can't get by the taste, it's just too weird. I definately won't order this again.
Very disappointed. I don't know if I received a bad order, but this stuff is gross. I can't even handle one sip. *barf*
This stuff taste so bad I can't drink it. I love coconut but this doesn't taste like coconut at all. A waste of my money for sure.
Not my cup of tea, but I think it is healthy.
reviews.review_header: OK if you like Coconut Water

reviews.review_text: I payed $100 for two pack of this and another 2 $20 item. it was saying that I bought 5, and when it arrive it only have two pack, and the order list has changed to two also, where did my money or another two pack go?
I never tasted coconut flavor so bad. I spit it out. I don't know if it was bad. All I know is that is tasted terrible.
reviews.review_header: I never tasted coconut flavor so bad. I spit it out

reviews.review_text: The water seemed of very poor taste and I know its not the real product as I consumed Vita Coco before and the taste is nothing like it. I recommend not to buy this
reviews.review_header: I think this is not the real product..its a fake!

reviews.review_text: Most of the coconut water I've tried has a hint of sourness in them. Other than water from a freshly cracked coconut, the only other brand I find better tasting than this is Harmless Harvest, which costs quite a bit more. Though it tastes better when chilled, even at room temperature it tastes pretty good. Instructions say to refrigerate any unused portion and consume within 24 hours. I can't evaluate the claims of benefits, though I would agree it is healthier than the same amount of soda. The plastic bottle makes it convenient to carry around and reseal if you don't finish it all at once. To save a bit of money and cut down on packaging, get the larger 33 oz Tetra Pak and pour it into your own water bottle. As a bonus, if you use an insulated bottle, it will stay cold for much longer. 5 stars for taste. I was going to rate it 4 stars for the packaging not being very environmentally friendly, but figure you should make your own decision regarding that.
reviews.review_header: Great taste in a convenient package

reviews.review_text: This VITA COCO COCONUT WATER tasted fine to me, though I’m totally new to coconut water. My case of 12 large (16.9 oz.) bottles contained clear (faintly yellow-tinged) liquid, and the flavor was neutral and inoffensive. The liquid did NOT taste like coconut at all--my only prior exposure to coconut was the shredded kind used in cakes and macaroons. The nutrition information on the 2-serving bottle says that a serving contains 460mg potassium, 70mg sodium, and 11mg carbohydrates (including 10mg sugars). I guess that consuming the product after a workout is a good way of replacing electrolytes, but a serving also delivers 45 calories. To me, this is just another form of sugary soda (without carbonation), and a product that sounds more healthy than it actually is.
reviews.review_header: Sounds Healthy, Tastes Okay, 90 Calories Per Bottle

reviews.review_text: Amazon sells coconut water now, too?! How excited am I… This is fantastic! I have grown up on coconut water… I am from Hawaii and my dad used to purchase me fresh coconuts pretty much on a weekly basis where we would drink all of the sweet milk out and eat the flesh inside…. I am also part Vietnamese and coconuts are pretty much a staple of our diet. Hawaii has changed a lot and those fresh coconuts are harder to get so I purchase coconut water from the store. When my kids and I am sick, this is a must have. Also, if someone recently had surgery, I make sure we have coconut water in the house. Its the one thing everyone can stomach when you have no desire to eat. This arrived double packaged without any issues and they taste great and arrived fresh.

It's not bad tasting, but if you are like me, you are sick (perhaps also literally) of products that claim to be "natural" and "organic" - essentially trying to convey they are good for you. The product is made from concentrate (which is the first big mistake). Then it is flash pasteurized with heat (which essentially kills the beneficial enzymes and other things that make coconut water healthy). Then the all too familiar "natural flavors" added, which hide myriad of nasty garbage. The companies website will try to sell you the story of why they do this, talking about the weight of coconuts/cost to import, blah blah blah. If you care to know more and actually benefit from your money spent on what you thought was a healthy product, then be a smart consumer and do the research. A great site (which I have zero affiliation with whatsoever, and simply found when doing my own research) can be found by searching on foodbabe and coconut water. The big brands are quite eye opening, but shouldn't be a surprise to you. To your good health and being a more knowledgeable, smart consumer.
reviews.review_header: Be a smart consumer..... Don't be fooled.

reviews.review_text: I don't know if it's just me, but when I drink coconut water, the taste reminds me of the cereal sweetened milk. I'm picky about my coconut water and only drink two brands, one is an expensive brand I can only get at Whole Foods, and it turns pink. The other comes in a box and it's also very costly. I am so happy I had the opportunity to find another brand to love that is reasonably priced. My Vita Coco arrived fast and fresh. I saw some reviewers mention theirs had an off-color, but mine was a white-ish color. It's about the same sweetness level as the other brands I enjoy. It looks right, smells right and tastes great! I checked every bottle. Honestly, I wasn't expecting to like it as much as I do. It's delicious.
reviews.review_header: DELICIOUS! I wasn't expectng to like it as much as I do.

reviews.review_text: I have been buying Vita Coco for YEARS now, and have always been pleased with their product. Until recently. Something has changed, which started around the time they began using their new blue-packaging. The coconut water just tastes off. Like sweet soap was added. It's pretty disappointing, as I've contacted Vita Coco multiple times about this issue and have not received any notable follow-up since my initial call.
reviews.review_header: Isn't what it used to be | Flavor has changed for the worse

reviews.review_text: While I appreciate the plastic bottle (recyclable in my area - instead of the tetra packs that are not). I don't care too much about them adding a little of citric acid or another thing that increases shelf life, but the extra sugar added as well just ruins the flavor for me. It tastes a lot sweeter than natural coconut water. I even added a little bit of extra water to see if I could tone the sugar down, but it still tasted weird. I love Zico tetra packs - nothing but coconut water - but I hate that I cannot recycle those containers. I will keep looking. If you are one of those people that thing coconut water isn't sweet enough, this might be an ok purchase.
reviews.review_header: Extra sugar ruins it for me

reviews.review_text: This batch of bottles have a best-by date of October (about 6 months from receiving); that is not issue for this family as we'd finish this batch in 3-4 weeks. The flavor is good - no pulp, no added sugars or additives, and unlike all other reviews (mostly on tetrapack), we didnt see any evidence of browning , coloration, or odors. The source is Thailand. We are likely to alternate this brand with a warehouse brand depending on what's on sale. Ideally less than a dime/oz is a reasonable price for branded.. One plus of the bottles are that they are more recycle-friendly...
reviews.review_header: good choice for coconut water...sourced from Thai, no-pulp, no added sugars..

reviews.review_text: My husband ad I both tend to get dehydrated and I am tired of the sports drinks which are either full of sugar or have an artificial sweetener. My husband loves these to help him rehydrate. He drinks one everyday. I don't love the flavor because I'm not a coconut fan but my husband does. Regardless, it's better than the others and does a great job. These bottles are a good size, better than the smaller cans of these I've purchased in the past. If you are concerned about staying hydrated, these should be a first choice thirst quencher.
reviews.review_header: Great For Hydration Without Saturating Yourself With Sugar or Artificial Sweeteners

reviews.review_text: The previous reviews here are pretty scary (and valid)-- the Vita Coco in the individual carton servings seems to have serious problems. But I got the plastic bottles, and don't have any problems with them-- the taste is fine and the color is normal. (No mold or brown coloring.) Taste is fine, though I prefer a little sweeter. It says the only ingredients are coconut water, less than 1% sugar and vitamin C. I have bad issues with restless legs syndrome on and off, and potassium helps with that, so I'm interested in this for the potassium content.

This is nice coconut water. It's very refreshing and smooth to drink. I like this both cold from the fridge and room temperature. It's great to throw in a bag as the bottle is sturdy and resealable. I've had just a little bit of trouble twisting open a few of the tops, though. My fingers have seemed to have lost some strength so I struggled a bit but was finally able to open and quench my thirst. This really hits the spot.

You know. I've tried this in many stores places gas stations, Ralph's... this last time was Ralph's. I've had the real natural coconuts (stick to that if you're doing it) and what is this vita coco? Honestly? First I gave it yet again ANOTHER chance. Ralph's I thought wouldn't possibly have the rancid tasting drink I had tried at a few locations. No I did not have that... instead it had milky sour yogurty flavored liquid that taste like it was sitting in an old shoe before being poured into the container. Appetizing right? Thirst quenching huh. I will never ever ever ever by vita coconut again. EVER!!! In store / out of store this product is bio hazard flavor in a paper bag. Enjoy.

So I am not a fan of coconut water but it is supposed to be a natural way to lower blood pressure, its good for you and a healthy drink. Color is good on this water. The taste you have to get used to and again this is my opinion. I think its an acquired taste. The bottles are nice because you can see the color and they are easy to open and close. Definitely drink cold. It is way better cold.

This flash-pasteurized coconut water is a product of Thailand. The coconut water tastes very fresh. I received it in late April 2019 and it has a Best By Date of October 22, 2019. Instructions on the side of the bottle say to drink it within 24 hours of opening the bottle and to keep it refrigerated once opened. There are about 90 calories in this tall, slender 16.9 ounce bottle. It's a good source of potassium.
reviews.review_header: Coconut water + a bit of sugar & vitamin C

reviews.review_text: Once i was introduced to coconut water it changed my life... coconut water and pedialyte are my go to and rehydrate so much better than water or gatorade even! Just go google it.... And its natural. This brand is one of the best IMO.... but i do prefer coconut water with pineapple in it haha. These are the perfect size to go bottles for road trips and hiking. LOVE em.

I know some don't like the taste and for me it's not the best flavor; but when I'm riding hard or working out hard... I really don't care about flavor. It's worth it for me - I've noticed a difference in my performance. I have some friends who drink it after their ride as a recovery drink, but I drink it during my rides. I get nutrients delivered in my body more consistently. What I do is mix about 1/4 regular filtered water in with it. I started adding a bit of water to it just to be sure it would still quench my thirst and dilute the flavor just a bit. When I first did it, it was 50/50, eventually it's where the majority of my water bottle is coconut water. I attach two water bottles on my bike when I ride, so my second bottle is just water only. I have a friend who thinks the taste is awful, but she drinks the chocolate flavor and loves it. So, if it's the taste - then try others, because this stuff is really good for you. It's so much better than those sports drinks like Gatorade; they have so much sugar that it's counterproductive. Due to all the sugar in sports drinks, they really don't quench my thirst anyway. They actually make me more thirsty because it leaves a bad taste in my mouth or makes it feel like my tongue is coated with sugar. I then have to reach for water and wash that taste away. But with coconut water, there is no aftertaste bothering my taste buds. So two awesome things it does for me is that it quenches thirst and helps improve performance.
reviews.review_header: It's very helpful during long hard rides

reviews.review_text: I have been drinking a bottle a day of the mango peach flavor for more than a year. I find it just the right amount of slight sweetness, and it is very refreshing. I have had none of the problems some people report about consistency or whatever. I thought that in addition to being a great hydration drink, maybe I could stop taking Klor-Con, but my physician says I'd have to drink a lot more than one bottle a day, so I just enjoy it. I have tried coconut water from Thailand but coconut water from South America tastes far better to me than that from the Pacific Rim.
reviews.review_header: Tastes great, I drink a bottle a day of the Mango Peach flavor

reviews.review_text: I love coconut water. I generally purchase Zico or one but I thought I'd give Vita coco a try. I drank two cups worth in the evening and I got sick, really sick. The taste wasn't great but it certainly wasn't off by any means. The smell didn't seam off either. Now, I know it's possible that I got sick from food that I ate that day. However, nobody else that ate the same meals I ate, became sick. I try to be conservative on these matters before judging a company, I get it, mistakes can happen. In this case, I felt strongly that this batch of coconut water was the culprit. I reached out to Vita and their response was really disappointing. I honestly wasn't looking for anything from them but the following is the response I got. "xxxx, Thank you for providing the product information; rest assured we will send this directly to quality control to investigate the matter further. I would be happy to send you coupons for your troubles. Please reply with your address, and we'll have some sent to you. Thanks, xxx" Thanks, but no thanks, the emails and coupons seemed disingenuous. Further they kept informing me that their product is ALL natural. Read the ingredients, it's not pure 100% coconut water.

This tastes all right. But for me, it has to be ice cold, but I always like every drink I have to be that way. I like coconut a lot so this was a great choice for me. I wouldn't call it refreshing as much as I would call it a just something to drink once in a while. I wish the salt content was a bit lower. In the end, it's still good and I enjoy it.

When I looked at the prior reviews of this, I saw that they were having problems with the tetrapack Vita Coco, which is annoying because that is my preferred packaging. That said, these bottles are fine, and the coconut water so far is clear, and tastes good. Again, I would prefer to not have plastic bottles, and to have larger containers.
reviews.review_header: Fine coconut water in plastic bottles

reviews.review_text: I usually buy this brand of coconut water because of the size. This morning I I was horrified to find two large pieces of thi gs that look like molded, cared boned in my drink - see my picture attached

This product is okay. I'm not sure scientifically, how well it compares to the real thing. Personally, I notice that I feel better with the real thing. But this doesn't seem bad to me. Coconut spoils in about half a day after cracked, even if jarred, so obviously there is some processing. I think flash pasteurization, which is heating to kill "spoiler organisms". So basically, whatever survives is what you get. It's the best way to do it in my opinion. No additives. That's good. But why not just buy the real thing? Almost every decent sized city in the U.S. has asian and Indian markets who sell coconuts. We had to shop around but found a good place and buy the real thing for $2 ea. They're young and good! You get the meat too!
reviews.review_header: Good for what it is but I prefer the real thing, which is easier to find than one might think..

reviews.review_text: Find out where each product originated: (example: Produced in Brazil, Produced in Philippines, Produced in Indonesia, etc...) I've tried all three versions and each country's "batch" have different flavor and coloration. Indonesia's version is the most yellow in color and though it is the sweetest, it has a certain flavor that isn't in fresh coconut water. Brazil's version has a certain tart in the taste. Philippine's version is the most pleasant for me, it's the one closest to fresh true coconut water taste. Whenever I buy more than 1, I make sure to buy the ones produced in Philippines. Try all 3 versions and make a taste test, you will agree with me. Also, buy your VitaCoco from Walmart or Costco, I found that they have the cheapest price out of like... anywhere. I've replaced soda consumption with VitaCoco, and you will be amazed at how much caloric intake you will cut away.

Buy the original coconut water taste; pineapple was way too overpowering-too much taste of the pineapple and not enough of the coconut flavoring. I suggest to drink it well-chilled, you might think this taste good until you have tried other brands than you will physically be able to taste the difference. It isn't the worst tasting coconut water around but in my opinion it isn't the greatest either; I will continue to buy a can here or there but only if it is on sale as it tends to be a bit pricier than a lot of the other brands out on the market. This coconut is made from the sap of a young coconut therefore, it tends not to taste as sweet; it is ideal though after working out to replenish the body with natural nutrients the body needs. I am 'Awakened1' and I hope this review helped. ** See all my reviews: http://www.amazon.com/gp/cdp/member-reviews/A34AZ5B6CCBLPN/ref=cm_cr_pr_auth_rev?ie=UTF8&sort_by=MostRecentReview

Comparative review of both Vita Coco and Zico I both both of the above from Costco (currently priced lower there), not Amazon. I was surprised to find Vita sweeter than Zico. However, when I poured them both into separate transparent glasses, Zico was more turbid (cloudy); although less sweet, it seemed to have more "substance." The answer to this paradox was supplied by the Vita carton: note in the ingredients section that "less than 1% natural fruit sugar" has been added. In contrast, the Zico ingredients section lists only "pure coconut water." Further evidence that sugar is an additive in Vita comes from the caloric counts--Vita has a higher calorie per ml value. Finally (and perhaps what matter most), Zico just plain tastes better--there is an authentic "flavor" to it. There are no two ways about it. Nevertheless, you can't really go wrong with either choice.

Great product. Refreshing and helping with muscle fatigue and cramping. Two complaints (and the reason I did not give it 5 stars): 1- The new re-sealable cap is often poorly applied to the box. Consequently it leaks around and let me tell you that it is a little embarrassing walking around with a wet shirt in the office. This has happened many times now. I would prefer to have the old "pull out tabs" from before. Furthermore it does not fit in the fridge "can rack" anymore...its actually a pain now. 2- Quit with the added sugar and citric acid. It was great before without it. I'm looking for alternatives now...
reviews.review_header: New spout is a pain and leaks.

reviews.review_text: I grew up in Southeast Asia where there's an abundance of coconuts. There were coconut trees in our backyard and this was always available as a refreshment. When I moved to the US, my company's office manager stocked our fridge with a verity of drinks including VitaCoco. I was so excited because I've not had coconut water in a while, but this thing is DISGUTING! It DOES NOT taste like coconut water at all! It takes like water with sugar and who knows what sort of flavoring they add in it, but it's far from tasting like real coconut water. I bet people are buying this as a healthy drink alternative. It's fascinating what the placebo effect does!
reviews.review_header: NOT REAL coconut water! Please Westerners, don't be fooled

reviews.review_text: This coconut water is delicious and fresh tasting. It has no added sugars or preservatives and it doesn't have that canned food flavor. I have tried countless coconut waters and most of them are crap. I'm Dominican, so I know what real coconut water tastes like, I grew up on it, especially because it is a classic Dominican diuretic that makes you lose water weight very fast, especially before your period. When I moved to the States, coconut water was a distant dream until I found Vita Coco, it tastes fresh, it's nor sugary, and it doesn't makes me bloated like other brands that add coconut PULP JUICE to it, which also adds fat and extra calories. Some brands go as far as to add minced ripe coconut pulp (Goya). I use this water to stay hydrated when I workout and I feel like I can run a few more miles. I love VitaCoco, it gave me back my beloved coconut water, I feel like at home just for a few minutes when I sip this refreshing water.
reviews.review_header: Finally this is REAL coconut water!!!

reviews.review_text: Coconut water is a delicious drink high in potassium, perfect for replenishing your body after a workout. Unlike coconut milk which is very sweet, coconut water is more subtle. However, I do know many people who typically do not like, or are even repulsed by coconut flavors. I would not recommend this product for them. But for the rest of us who enjoy light coconut flavors, Vita Coco is tasty. I've tried different brands of coconut water and I honestly can't tell the difference among then. I usually buy the kind with a cap so I can reseal it for later (other sizes or brands may have an aluminum seal that you break). I only give this drink 4/5 stars because the flavor gets tiring about halfway through the bottle. For me, it starts to taste a little sour or even a tiny bit metallic near the end. I don't know if this is usually true for coconut water, or a defect of the bottle.
reviews.review_header: Replenishing and tasty drink, especially post-workout

reviews.review_text: Its water from cracked green coconuts, low in calories, high in electrolytes and it makes awesome ice cubes for your island drinks. Coconut water is the perfect replacement for high calorie sports drinks, especially for people trying to limit calories or simple carbs. Did I mention it tastes delicious, but you probably wont like it if you don't like coconut? OF the coconut waters, I like vita coco but you'll find a lot of variance for tastes. Some waters are made from concentrate, vita coco is not. Some have more of a fresh coconut taste while others have a cooked or caramel flavor, although I've never found that to be excessive in any water and vita coco is very clean and fresh tasting. Coconut water is the only naturally occurring fluid that can be used (in emergencies) as an intravenous fluid in humans, its that clean and that usable by the body. If you haven't tried it, go get one and then buy it here on amazon where its often half the supermarket price.

When I first drank this coconut water, I wasn't very impressed. Sweet, but not necessarily in a good way. However, I have read drinking coconut water is beneficial to your health. And they did come in a package of 12 and even though I feel I got a good deal on them, I was not willing to let them go to waste. The more I drank, the more accustomed I became to the sweetness and consistency of the drink. Definitely drink them ice cold and preferably while laying by the pool. The packaging makes them very portable and convenient with an easy to open screw off top.

A coconut is a giant nut when you eat so much, you get very fat. Just kidding! :) I just love that Filipino song that I used to sing when I was a kid. Anyhoo, about this coconut water... What can I say? My whole family drinks it like it's our golden daily vitamins. We believe that it cleanses our organs so we drink it often. We are very healthy and fit and we recommend this to everybody who's into fitness. Great replacement for water too. When my cousin was pregnant, she doesn't like water. I know it's weird, so she drinks other stuff like flavored water and this one. She loves Vita coco, I think her baby will love it too when he grows up.

Tastes so bad, they spend so much on advertising to compensate for the taste. I grew up in a place where many coconut farms existed, this is not at all closer to the real deal. Has artificial taste and smell.

I like the ones in the stores better, the shell life for these are not as long probably due to the warehouse stocking. Definitely not 100% pure coconut water but it does hydrate pretty well in the summer.
reviews.review_header: I like the ones in the stores better

reviews.review_text: the ingredients says nothing is added, but it tastes like it's gone bad or they added a preservative, however it's not listed in the ingredients. This is the clear kind, not the yellow liquid from mexico. for the clear one, drink a fifth or 1/4 and refill it with half and half diary. it makes it taste ok without the bad aftertaste. this is definately not as good as white coconut juice, for the price, you might as well buy real white coconut from walmart for $3

This is ok, and the bottles are a good value and convenient for taking to the gym. The flavor is just ok. I have better coconut water (can't remember the name but the one in the glass bottle). This is not a bad flavor and tastes good.
reviews.review_header: Nice pack but not my favorite coconut water

reviews.review_text: I was trying to find a good coconut water and noticed some very suspect review here. There seems to be a lot of schills on this product. Many high ratings by various users. But if you look at all of their reviews they are all on the same day, obvious fabrications. This brings this product into question for sure. Look at the review histories of any of the 4 and 5 star reviews!! Most have several products reviewed, but they are all on one day in most cases and on two separate days in a few cases. BAD REVIEWS ALL! shill 1.an accomplice of a hawker, gambler, or swindler who acts as an enthusiastic customer to entice or encourage others.
reviews.review_header: I was trying to find a good coconut water and noticed some very suspect review here

reviews.review_text: Delicious hydrating coconut water in easy to open plastic bottles - delicious, clean and refreshing taste. - not too salty or sweet - perfectly balanced - convenient size bottles - clear with no residue

It’s nice and light. Great drink in just the right size —11.1 oz. — for anyone, but seniors citizens, like me, find it a delicious, light alternative to coffee and tea. And unlike coffee and tea, Coco Vita doesn’t get you wired or stain your dentures.
reviews.review_header: Great Drink for Seniors on a Hot Day

reviews.review_text: In my opinion this is some of the very best coconut water on the market! It is wonderful and refreshing and taste just like putting a straw in a coconut. My only complained about this particular subscribe & Save item is the size of the boxes. Some may say it is a perfect serving size but to me it just looks like additional landfill waste. this is certainly not the fault of Amazon as I should have paid closer attention to the serving size!
reviews.review_header: just like sticking a straw into a coconut!

reviews.review_text: Why do I give one star? Because the title is misleading--it says "pure" and 100% natural, but what does that mean? These terms are so inflated that they lost their original meaning. In other words, this is NOT pure coconut water, and extra amount of sugar was added into it. It doesn't taste sweet, but it does have a lot of sugar--the amount of sugar per serving is about what a normal human being needs in a single day. If you have extra money or a bit more time (5 more minutes), buy fresh coconut from grocery store, instead of having this coconut water with extra sugar.
reviews.review_header: It doesn't taste sweet, but it does have a lot of sugar--the ...

reviews.review_text: When I was in the Philippines I visited Bataan and Corregidor. These were sites of some of the most intense fighting in the Pacific during WWII. The tour guide's grandmother was an American nurse in the war who had been captured. The tour guide told us captured American soldiers were usually not given medical supplies or food. Often these soldiers became dehydrated in the intense jungle heat. Her grandmother and other nurses turned to coconut water in place of IV fluid. Coconut water and blood have the same five electrolytes. Coconut water helped sustain dehydrated soldiers during their internment, hence "fluid of life." Later on in the tour, the guide cracked open a young coconut. I had the opportunity to drink the coconut water and I really enjoyed it. Coming back to the States I found three brands of coconut water, Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.1-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) , ZICO Pure Premium Coconut Water, Natural, 11.2-Ounce Tetra Paks (Pack of 12) and O.N.E. Coconut Water, 11.2-Ounce Aseptic Containers (Pack of 12) . I purchased all three. I tried O.N.E first, which is the cheapest. It tasted nothing like coconut water I'd had in the Philippines. It tastes too sweet. If you like a sweeter drink you might want to try O.N.E. For an authentic taste, I'd avoid it. I like both Vita Coco and Zico. Their prices fluctuate on Amazon, but are pretty similar. Zico is a little cheaper as of this writing. Zico's flavor is light, probably the lightest of the three, and most similar to water. I think Vita Coco has more complex flavor than Zico, which is why I prefer Vita Coco. Nutritionally they are all very similar. Only substantial difference is Vita Coco has higher levels of manganese. In my opinion Vita Coco is best, followed by Zico and O.N.E. If I were you I'd think about trying a single of Vita Coco and Zico. Whatever your choice, you can't go wrong. Typical sports drinks have lots of calories and only share two of the electrolytes blood has. Coconut water is a 60 calorie drink chock-full of electrolytes. It is the perfect refresher for a workout, lazy afternoon or night out on the town.

Compared to other coconut waters, this one tastes just as fresh and is decently sweet, without being overly salty (I don't like too much flavor of the ocean in my coconut water, which the Whole Foods brand seems to do). 60 calories per 8 oz serving, these end up costing about $1 per 11 oz bottle after coupons and subscribe and save, which is roughly half what I have found at the cheapest big box stores. Quality from shipment to shipment is excellent. I have no complaints about these, and have been most impressed. I usually use these as a mid-workout alternative to Gatorade, as I like the lower sugar, higher potassium, low sodium way these boost my energy with just a bit of sugar and fend off cramps.
reviews.review_header: Great Tasting for a decent value

reviews.review_text: I am a fan of vita coco and I actually have been drinking this product for more than 2 years. I love it and I drink a lot. I have "subscribed" from Amazon and get at least 12 box (12x12 bottles). I love to bring couple of them to the gym and they did hydrate me. Given this fact, how should I write a two star review? Because they change it !! I just got my recent order a week ago and it taste wrong. It's more like a vitamin C water with a coconut flavor. All of my family member feel the difference and we notice that the flavor is nasty because it taste like a sour water now. It's not "fresh". I take a look of the ingredient and I know why. They double (or precisely, 230%) the vitamin C. Vitamin is a type of "preservative" that people add to drink to avoid being rotten quickly. Having too much vitamin C is BAD BAD BAD to your body. I usually had 3-4 bottle and it means that I have 300-400% vitamin C and I think it's okay. But now I would consume about 1000% recommend vitamin C if I drink 4 bottles a day. I will never buy this product again. They did a shady business. Clamming it's pure but keep adding preservative. Yes, I know adding preservative prolong the "sell-before date". From the perspective of business, they can "double" the preservative period, meaning making more money. (don't have to worry keeping lots of items in stock). But the water now taste "nasty" and it's even not close to a "pure" coconut water. I'm very unhappy because the product description contains no ingredient information and they don't even mentioned that they change the ingredient! I had reported this issue to Amazon and they are kindly refund me in full. 5 star to Amazon. Definitely will do business with Amazon again.

These are SO good. And they are pretty good for you. There are 22 grams of sugar (11 per serving) in each bottle, but other than that, there's nothing to dislike (and I like coconut sugar, so there's that, too).

My rating isn't based on how much I like Coconut Water, trust me. I don't like coconut, and the water is no exception. I think it's nasty tasting, but diluting it 50-50 with orange juice makes it palatable. Even adding water to it helps. There were a lot of comments about how sweet it is. Maybe so, but it's less sugar than most fruit juices, so that wasn't a concern. The health benefits, if true, are enough to make up for the nasty taste. I only drink a juice glass each morning. I think the product is probably as good as any, and better than most. The price per ounce is good, and I bought two packs of 12 and saved the horrible shipping. It is HEAVY! If you want the health benefits, this is a good choice.
While not my go to brand of coconut water, Vito Coco taste good especially for usage post workout or snack to provide electrolytes or boost. This was a hit in my house end definitely recommend.

Coconut water is a healthy alternative to sugary drinks. I am opposed to the idea of drinking artificial energy drinks. The composition of coconut water is enough to quench thirst and hydrate the body after a workout or in summer as well. I have tried several brands of coconut water. This brand is closest to the real deal. There are few brands which contain tiny pieces of coconut, I don't like biting on them while drinking. The size of this bottle is right for me. There are different sizes available as well.

I am very disappointed with this purchase. It was on Amazon's Friday sale and the price was very attractive (compared to normal price) so I went for it. I normally purchase Young Thai Coconuts, but breaking them open can be a hassle sometimes, so I bought a case just for the convenience of it. I've tried Zico (back when it was still in Tetra Pak)before and was a fan so I assumed Vitacoco was similar. Boy was I wrong. Vitacoco taste nothing like fresh coconut water. To me, it just taste like sugar water, or non-fresh coconut water that has been left out too long and thus fermented. It was this tart aftertaste with a faint hint of coconut flavor. Does not warrant the price it cost. Lesson Learned: DO not buy in bulk if you have never tried it before.
reviews.review_header: Does not taste like Coconut Water

reviews.review_text: I been drinking Vita Coco for years now including many family members and friends I know. I sometimes have to order two cases because my wifey's lives by it and claims to help her skin naturally. It's not too overly sweet and taste refreshing, probably as close as you can get to fresh coconut water. But I do have one note...I would avoid "some" of the flavored Vita's Coco and others out there, it simply doesn't taste right. I primary drink Vita Coco as a natural quench thirster and it's a GREAT mixer with Vodka! Highly recommended!
reviews.review_header: I'm in LOVE with the Coco!

reviews.review_text: This is not pure coconut water, an outright lie. We dont know how much water they add and how much sweeteners they add. Calling it 100% coconut water is a massive stretch, dont fall for that. If I take one coconut and empty it into a barrrel and fill it up with water and sweeteners, does it still remain to be 100% coconut water? This is an example, not suggesting they are doing it but they are mixing water during pasteurization to compensate for evaporation and more. They need to tell us how many coconuts per 12oz packet and they will never do that. That is a critical measure of quality.
reviews.review_header: calling it 100% coconut water is a lie. They add sweeteners and water, how is it 100% coconut water?

reviews.review_text: Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pure - Gluten Free, Natural Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - 16.9 oz. is delicious. I usually have good luck with Vita Coco Coconut Water and have been drinking it for years. The plastic bottles arrived in perfect condition, which has not always been the case with coconut water in the boxes. I asked my husband what he thought and he said isn't that the brand we aways get? He proclaimed this coconut "water lIght and refreshing". It has a pleasant taste of coconut that is not overpowering. I agree.

I grew up with a dad that loved to eat coconuts and drink coconut water. He served in Hawaii in the Navy and said that it was what he missed most about coming home. I would have thought 'pineapples' or the tropical weather but, heck, if it made him nostalgic for paradise then who was I to disagree? In the 1960's it was hard to find stores that carried them fresh. So he ordered them via the mail. He owned several health food stores so he bought only the best. I hated the stuff as a kid but when I got older my tastes changed and I started to eat the flesh/meat and drink the juice. Over the years I've bought them and allowed them to rot in the back of the fridge when I forgot about them. Waste of money... So, lately I've been buying the pure-pak versions because they last longer and require no special tools or hard work to extract the delicious water. Unless I'm making coconut milk I'll avoid them in the produce section. Sometimes I get bad coconuts and they'll taste like vinegar or be black inside. This happens way too often. Last weekend I bought two to make coconut milk and one of them tasted like vinegar. $2.50 tossed in the garbage. The other one was fine but not as fresh tasting as I'd liked. I use coconut water in my smooties, homemade icecream in my Vitamix blender, in frozen confections, and in a variety of other drinks from coffee, almond milk and chocolate milk. VitaCoco is one of the best tasting 100% pure coconut waters that I've tried over the last few decades. I've bought the water frozen, in cans and in the purepak containers. I also like O.N.E. coconut water but it's a little too expensive and tastes about the same as Vita Coco. The best is frozen but it's expensive and hard to find. Vita Coco is easy to find at Big Lots for about $1.50 for 33 oz. They have a variety of flavors but I prefer the lemonade and plain for my smoothies. Another reviewer didn't like the taste but I think the taste varies from time to time anyway and maybe the reviewer bought it when it was near or past the 'best by' date as I've noticed a difference in taste with I drank one that was past its date. It was still drinkable but not as fresh tasting. I used it in a smoothie and I couldn't tell the difference anyway. I recommend this brand if you can find it at a reasonable price.
reviews.review_header: I like it better than canned

reviews.review_text: Everyone is always saying how good for you coconut water is, so I decided to finally try it for myself. What I learned is that I DO NOT like coconut water. However, that is just me. For anyone that DOES like coconut water, this is a great deal. Filled with electrolytes, it's a great alternative to sports drinks or plain water. This pack of 12 is a very good value and the bottles are a generous 16.9 ounces. So coconut water lovers, go on and enjoy! It really doesn't taste bad, I'm just not a huge fan of coconuts.

I like the size of the new plastic 16.9 oz bottles and the taste is great. I think much better than the smaller tetra cardboard boxes and the plus side is you can see the clear liquid inside unlike the tetra packs. No additives besides some vitamin C and a little fruit sugar. These have about 45 calories per 8 oz so 90 calories for the container so not necessarily low calorie drink but it is natural and tastes great. Only better way to get it is straight from a freshly cracked coconut!
reviews.review_header: Like this new packaging! Tastes great!

reviews.review_text: I really like the taste of this coconut water. Each bottle is only 90 calories, and it has less than 1% sugar. I find that coconut water is great for recovering from a workout, or for dealing with a hangover. The bottle is attractive and slim, and fits fine in a car cup holder. Please note the bottle should be consumed within 24 hours after opening. Also it tastes best cold. One flavor idea is to pour it into a tall glass and infuse it with some fruit, such as watermelon or orange.

I have now tried quite a few varieties of coconut water and you need to keep in mind that a lot of them have changed their taste over the years. Your own palette is the best for you, which means everyone's review is subjective, but hopefully it gives you a good idea. The coconut water is a $1 Billion industry, so all things considered, there is a lot of money and hype here. Now coconut water has different tastes depending on how young or old the coconut is. When very young, it is bitter. When very old (with firm thick flesh inside), it feels like coconut oil is mixed in. When dry, the flesh is what they use to make coconut oil. It is best to see few things when comparing reviews: - Brand name of the product (Vita Coco vs Zico vs ... ) - Origin of the product (Note: Size of the product as well - this one keeps changing based on if it is 1 liter vs 11.1 oz etc) Always make a note of the origin, that way you know what you like. - Packaging of the product (Tetra pak, Can, ...) - 100% natural or with flavors/additives ... This is Nov 2015 and I will write my review based on current taste. I will need to update it when this changes. 1. Vita Coco: The 11.1oz tetra pak is made in Brazil, and this is the one I really love. It tastes close to having coconut water fresh from the coconut. A bit sweeter in taste when compared to the rest, and good original flavor. 4 stars 2. Zico Original Coconut Water: I took the 1 liter packs. They are from Thailand, and I don't particularly like this. Very different from Vita Coco, and I think a lot of young coconuts (not mature) have also been used. I have tried many batches all this year and they all taste about the same. When the coconut is not mature, there is a bitter taste in it (can't quite put in words) - now that is still healthy, but not as good in the mouth! 3 stars. 3. O.N.E. coconut water: It used to taste very good a while back, but currently tastes just about ok, . There is a slight coconut oil taste to this, maybe some coconuts used for the water are probably very matured. Recently, they have also started adding flavor. WHAT?? Yes, you read that right. it is no longer pure coconut water. I don't even know why they want to do that. 2.5 stars 4. Naked coconut water: Country of Origin was Philippines. Very watered down, and doesn't taste like pure coconut water. It has an aftertaste. Something tells me this is not 100 % coconut water, I didn't like this and trashed it before I could check if they have also added flavor to it. 2 stars. So my advice: try 1 of any brand . Note down the country of origin, etc. Unless something else changes with their formula, stick to what you liked and you will be happy. Some batches might have issues, but should hopefully be delightful to drink! P.S.: I still need to taste Nirvana, C2O and Harmless Harvest that a few have noted in the reviews for coconut water.
reviews.review_header: Vita Coco vs. Zico vs. O.N.E. vs Naked

reviews.review_text: I bought this product a month ago and I just bought another one from Kroger yesterday since it was on sale. I love the one I bought from Amazon better because the taste is very similar to the ones that we get fresh from the coconuy tree in the Philippines while the one I bought from Kroger which says product of Brazil was more like sugar water. I want to order more from Amazon but I am scared to get something different than my first order. This coconut water from Amazon was really the best that I have tried so far and would love to get the same thing next time I order.

Ordered this after reading the reviews. I wasn’t disappointed. The price was cheaper then Walmart so I was tempted to buy this. I love coconut water and I have probably tried all the brands in the market. This would certainly be ranked as one of the better coconut waters. The package arrived on time and there was no wear in the package. Tip: you might want to refrigerate the coconut water before drinking it. Otherwise you may experience a hint of sourness. Another tip: try squeezing a slice of lemon and mix it well to make a great coconut water drink.

I used to love this brand of natural 100% coconut water when it first came to the US market and was made produced exclusively in Brazil. An important aspect of made-in-Brazil was two fold- the best taste profile and a consistent taste no matter where you bought the product. That is simply no longer the case on both counts. The coconut water now produced in Malaysia which I seem to get a lot of, taste like soap water and at other times taste watered down. The phrase on the label, "Born in Brazil" means absolutely nothing to me or anyone else for that matter once they taste how this product/brand has diminished substantially in quality. This brand needs to get back to the basics. Consistent taste, pure, unadulterated coconut water from Brazil.
reviews.review_header: I used to love this brand of natural 100% coconut water when it ...

reviews.review_text: No one in our family liked the taste of this. Not sure if it's just gone bad, or if it's supposed to taste this way. But no thank you.

I just had a Vita Coco and I have to say that it was the worst, funkiest-tasting coconut water I have ever had. It had a not even remotely sweet, sour taste. Maybe that is because of the addition of Vitamin C, which the best brands don't add. Frankly, I would like my water to be as close to drinking it straight out of the coconut as possible. Harmless Harvest has THE BEST, freshest tasting coconut water I have ever had, but I can only find it at FreshDirect.com and Whole Foods, and it is expensive and perishable. Close behind that is Taste Nirvana--my go-to choice for shelf stable water. Since Amazon doesn't sell Harmless Harvest, Taste Nirvana is the brand I buy. I don't really like Zico that much, but even it is quantum leaps ahead of Vita Coco.

Has *sugar added* and still can’t manage to taste good. Granted, I buy the very expensive harmless harvest stuff sometimes so am spoiled but also buy boxed coconut water and this among the worst I’ve tried.

I was excited about ordering a case of this for my very sick brother while he was in the hospital to help him get better because of the many healing qualities that coconut holds. He likes coconut and could only get down very limited foods so I thought this would be a good alternative to the coconut oil that I like and which tastes great (Nutiva). He took one sip of this and made a face, then I tried it, it does not taste like the oil at all, it has a weird sour taste. We threw that one away and I tried another, exactly the same. I took them home and am trying to use them myself since there is no way my brother with his limited appetite is able to get down even a sip of this stuff. I really don't get it, it is supposed to be the real thing, why doesn't it taste like real coconut? Is it sitting on a shelf and souring? Are they using older coconuts? I have seen mixed reviews here, with some people liking this stuff. I think that they need to try each batch before packaging it up and selling it for what is not an inexpensive price. I would not order this product again, that is for sure!

I purchased this item from Amazon because my local BJ's stop carrying it. The vita coco water I used to buy from BJ's consisted of 35mg of sodium, 620mg of potassium, 15g of sugar Calcium 4% Magnesium 4% Phosphorus2% Vitamin C 100% The product I received from Amazon has 100mg of sodium way higher than what BJ sold. Less calcium 2%, The magnesium however, is 4% higher than BJ's and the phosphorus is 2% more than BJ's, everything else is the same. I will not buy this product again. I really though I was getting the same item but as it turned out, it is not. The taste is just not the same, not that is was great to begin with but it was the only one that came close to real natural coconut water without anything added to it. Kas
reviews.review_header: Why the need to change the ingredient?

reviews.review_text: I like Vita Coco - yum, but absolutely do not like: 1. This packaging - the water leaks from that blue part on the top when you try to drink it, so I had to turn the package backwards to drink it - a little awkward. 2. The size of the package is small. I know I should have looked, but I didn't. I thought it would be the same size that I purchase in the store, but is smaller. Compare ounces before you purchase. This is expensive per ounce.

This is not at all like sticking a straw into a coconut. It's more like cracking open the coconut, and dumping in 5 packs of sugar. Gross. Labeling is deceptive. It is 100% Coconut, not made from concentrate, however in the fine print for the ingredients, it says less than 1% Fruit sugar and Vitamin C added. When you add that much sugar, it is not at all hydrating naturally, as advertised.
reviews.review_header: This is not at all like sticking a straw into a coconut

reviews.review_text: Love this option! Sent a box of things for my daughter-in-law who was sick with the flu...Most of the items are for her and others are for my son and grandson...Fluids, heat and eat items that are easy to serve when you don't feel well enough to cook from scratch.

I've only tasted O.N.E. and Vita Coco. Taste wise, I suppose they're both okay - it's an interesting (as in quirky...) taste. No bad experience either way. BIG NEGATIVE: Vita ADDS Vitamin C. * Could American companies please stop trying to "improve" perfectly good products? * I have no idea what quality the vitamin C is (...don't want it) * I already take a good quality Vitamin C in supplements I researched and chose for myself (...don't want it!) * For the moment, I'll stick to O.N.E. - you can keep the added vitamin C (...did I mention I don't want it?) Nothing beats Natural - and by 'natural', I mean relatively UNprocessed with ZERO additives!
reviews.review_header: Not my first, nor second choice...

reviews.review_text: I am sure some folks like this product but I did not like the flavor. I bought it because I needed to increase potassium in my diet. Just did not like it enough to repurchase.
reviews.review_header: I am sure some folks like this product but I did not like the flavor

reviews.review_text: The product is fine, but I am totally disappointed with Amazon for gouging customers, especially subscribing customrs, by raising the price by $6 without prior warning. I'm beginning to very strongly dislike Amazon. I'll bet this review never sees the light of day.
The nastiest drink I've ever tasted!

Coconut water is what it is-and it's a taste I do not like. I bought a cs of 12 because I had read how good it was to drink after strenuous exercise. (I run) I take several vitamins and supplements daily and wanted to try coconut water also. I take 2 Tbls organic coconut oil daily and also use it on my face as a moisturizer. I like coconut. Yikes! I wish I had only bought a single bottle before buying a cs. I'm amazed this product has received so many 5 star ratings. I tried giving this case of coconut water to 5 different people at work and I got virtually the same response from them all, which was YUK-I tried it once and that was enough.

I am sick and tired of cancelling this order and no one paying attention. I have cancelled this order again and again and I keep getting it. I have written several letters and no response. I am going to Better Business Bureau to tell them what a lousy company you are. I am sick of getting these packages every month.
reviews.review_header: Can't stop them coming - cancel order but they keep sending

reviews.review_text: Good price and nice quality tingle lotion. Bronzer isn't orangey or streaky! Recommend for sure!

I love fresh coconut water. I grew up from the Philippines where we had an abundance of coconuts. Being in Utah now where there really isn't a direct source of pure fresh coconuts, i am left to try tetrapacks or cans sold in stores. So far i have tried three brands - vita coco (product of Brazil and Philippines), one, and naked (both products of the Philippines). I tried them all at the same time and overall my favorite is vita coco. Its the one with the light smell and taste and actually reminded me of fresh coconut from when i was in the PH. Surprisingly i liked Vita Coco from Brazil best which disappointed me since i thought the ones from the PH would taste best for me. One and Naked have this distinct smell similar to when you open a can of coconut milk. The taste is similar to smell though One is a lot stronger than Naked's. Between One and Naked, i'd prefer Naked but between all three, i'd prefer Vita Coco. The clarity of the three sources are pretty much the same for me and closer to cloudy white as expected. Though i've read some reviews here that the Vita Coco from Mexico is weird tasting and colored yellowish. I prefer buying from the store to make sure i can get the ones from Brazil or Philippines
reviews.review_header: I love the Vita Coco made from Brazil and Philippines

reviews.review_text: I subscripted to this order. The date for a 12-pack expiring in 2/2010. I opened up first packet and it tasted sour, I poured it out and the coconut water was brown. I tried a second packet and it tasted bad, sour and it was also brown. The coconut water I believe it was left too long in the heat. I tried to return the product but Amazon says the "grocery" item is not returnable. Please beaware to receving a bad batch. In this case, I lost money and isn't any help from Amazon.com I gave Amazon.com is 0........ zero star.
reviews.review_header: VitaCoco spoiled and the coconut water was brown

reviews.review_text: Good price you get three separate sets of stickers and each sticker becomes a complete cat that you can frame any light socket. They go really well when charged with light. I like the fact that the design allows for you to put it around any size light socket combo. It's sticks well and it definitely seems to be able to be moved.The closer it is to light the better charges but these ones work well!! It actually would have a variety of applications including windows and vents. I think I'll try these next.

I am reviewing the box of twelve 16.9 oz slim bottles of Vita Coco Coconut Water. These bottles are plastic as opposed to the cartons that I often have seen coconut water in. Mine was sourced in Thailand. The bottles contain only coconut water and less than 1% sugar and Vitamin C. The color is cloudy clear, the way it should be. The taste is mild. It isn't very coconutty tasting but smooth and just slightly sweet. I admit, coconut water is not my favorite drink. I prefer iced tea and other drinks but it can be a refreshing change. There is 13% of the RDA of potassium and 4% of magnesium along with 4% of calcium and 3% of sodium so this drink is pretty good for summer days or after workouts when you sweat and need to replenish some electrolytes. These come naturally from the coconuts and are not added. If you like coconut water, this brand is a good one. I have had it before and the bottles I received taste the same as the ones I bought in the store last summer. I am going with 4 stars. I don't LOVE the taste but it's refreshing and healthy. I also feel that the water is fresh and free from extraneous stuff my body doesn't need. One 16.9 ounce bottle is two servings but I just drank the whole thing. At just 45 calories per serving, I don't feel guilty about that! Next time, I am going to try the pineapple infused coconut water. I think that would add just the right punch of flavor that I feel is missing from plain coconut water.
reviews.review_header: Fresh, additive free coconut water. Very mild taste.

reviews.review_text: This is my second attempt at trying to get into coconut water. As an avid user of sports drinks after a day of yardwork in the hot and ridiculously humid Southern summer, they are borderline necessary. So why not switch to something more natural and healthy than sweetened and colored salt water. Something like coconut water maybe. Well, good intentions are just that intentions. I just don't very much like coconut water, and interestingly neither does anyone else in my house including my wife and kids. The flavor is mildly sweet with a slightly syrupy, slightly "slippery" mouth feel. My wife very much dislikes the mouth feel while I'm just not a fan of the flavor. Anyway, for those that DO like the flavor of coconut water. The color was good, a slightly cloudy light color which apparently represents good quality. Additionally, the box and bottles inside arrived in good condition. So if you're a fan of coconut water, this seems like a good choice. I am not and so I will continue to look for a healthier post-hot summer day beverage.

A friend of mine recently gave me this Vita coco coconut water. It was a small pack and I was a bit skeptical as to how it might taste. I grew up in India and have had the most fresh, sweetest organic coconut water from my grandparents coconut grove. After that, a similar taste from my parents' home. After I came to US I tried a few cans which said coconut water, but it always tasted like sugar water with pieces of coconut in it. The closest one that I could refer as coconut water, from my childhood days, is the organic coconut water you get in whole foods. I was surprised and very happy that Vita coco tastes as good as the one in whole foods.Am glad and thankful that my friend offered me a pack. Now I can drink coconut water at a much lesser price!! and more often!!
reviews.review_header: The closest I could get to fresh coconut water!!

reviews.review_text: Each of these three products has a number of reviews. I don't have much to add to any of the individual reviews. Coconut water is great, if you are in the market for a case of it you already know this. But which of these three is the best? I went around town and found 5 boxes of each of the three brands (15 total) each, with no two boxes of a the same brand coming from the same supplier. The goal was to get a wide range of product batches. This I am happy to report was pointless. All three brands produce an internally consistent product. I then ordered a 12 pack of all three brands from Amazon. The only significant difference in packaging is that O.N.E. glues a little telescoping straw to each individual box, the other two brands do not. If you are a straw person this is a feature if not this is just more trash, you decide. The amount per container varies slightly by brand but given the price fluctuation on Amazon I don't consider the 0.1 Oz differences an important factor. All three are made in Brazil, O.N.E. mentions that it is pasteurized the other two do not (nevertheless, I suspect all three are). On pure taste, at refrigerator temperature, I found Zico to be the best (say 5/5), but only nominally better than O.N.E. (4.5/5), Vita was a distant third (3/5). Both Zico and O.N.E. taste almost exactly like drinking right from a fresh green coconut. Vita, on the other hand, has a grape aftertaste which I did not like. At room temperature the order remained the same; however, the differences in taste became more obvious: Zico (5/5), O.N.E. (4/5), Vita (2/5). Obviously all of this is subjective. I observed the price of three on Amazon over the course of a month. Zico (~$24) was consistently more expensive than the other two (~$18-21) which traded places as the least expensive. Considering the price and quality, O.N.E. is my choice and the brand to which I now subscribe. I consider Zico an excellent, but over priced, product and Vita an inferior product. If, however, I preferred my coconut water at room temperature I would give strong consideration to paying the extra money for Zico. If I used my coconut water as a mixer I would buy which ever one is cheapest at the time. All three products are better than nothing (the previous option) and I am happy to see them on the market.
reviews.review_header: O.N.E vs. Vita vs. Zico coconut water

reviews.review_text: I have been an avid coconut water drinker for the past two years and depending on which is on sale, will buy either Zico, Vita Coco, ONE Coconut brand, or Naked. Assuming you don't get a bad batch, ONE is the sweetest tasting of the three followed by Zico then Vita Coco. Naked has the lightest taste and some like the subtle flavor. Vita Coco adds Vitamin C to preserve the coconut water thus it can taste a bit more tart. If they put too much of it, it tastes kinda sour like this recent batch that I bought from them. Coconut water is great but the biggest issue is quality of the coconut that is harvested at the time. All four can taste bad if you get a bad batch so I wish these manufacturers would do a better job of making them taste similar across different batches. I know this can be difficult but if they do it, this would eliminate a lot of bad reviews due to poor quality control. Even though I got a bad batch, I will still continue to drink coconut water and will use any of these four brands but the quantity will depend on price and what other reviewers here write on the batch they get.
reviews.review_header: I got a bad batch this time, tastes sour

reviews.review_text: I probably should have bought 1 box at a local grocery store & tried it first, before buying a box of dozen. it's not *that* bad, but knowing that there are other brands out there that I like better, and a couple cost less, i probably will not be buying this again. It's definitely NOT "like sticking a straw in a coconut" like they have claimed. I lived in Indonesia for over 10 years and I have stuck a straw in a coconut, and I can tell you it does not taste like this. There's some sort of (funky/sourness) smell to this that hit me right before I start drinking it and that totally ruined it for me. I don't know if that's due to the Vit C that they added, or perhaps the tetra packaging... all I know is It's not one of my favorites.
reviews.review_header: NOT "like sticking a straw in a coconut"

reviews.review_text: The first time I ordered VitaCoco coconut water it tasted great. When Amazon has a sale I stocked up with 5 cases. When I got around to consuming those cases (3 months later) I found them to be spoiled. Brown, musty, horrible tasting water even though they were not to expire for another 7 months. I had to throw all five cases out! :( It had been over 30 days since I ordered the water so they would only give me half my money back. BUYER BEWARE! After reading all the reviews I see there are bad shipments every year for many years in a row. If you have a "Sprouts" grocery store near you try their Coconut H20. That is the best there is!
reviews.review_header: Zero Stars for my last batch.

reviews.review_text: Coconut water has really benefited me in several ways. First it is a great hydrator and a container right after working in the yard really is invigorating. I recently had a bad virus and this was a wonderful soothing benefit for my sore throat. There are other benefits as well. There's a great book available about coconut water well worth buying. Look it up, Amazon probably has it available.. ADDED NOTE: I recently had surgery. As I was coming out of the "happy place" I heard the surgeon yelling for the blood count results. "This guy lost a lot of blood, I think we might need to give him a transfusion". The nurse presented him with my test and he said, "I'll be darned. It's normal. It shouldn't be but it is." The nurse, who is from Hawaii, told the doctor they drink this stuff all the time and it's considered a life source. She told him about the plasma bit. The smartass Urologist just looked at her and said something about stupid superstitious primitive beliefs. She just rolled her eyes and walked away. What else could she do, this guy is THE surgeon and he thinks he knows everything. Jerk thinks if you can't cure it with a knife or expensive pills and countless tests, it can't be any good. If you've done any research on coconut water, you know how close it is to blood plasma and that they used it during WWII when they didn't have real plasma. The fact that I drink this wonderful juice may not be the only reason my blood work was normal, but you'd have trouble convincing me that it wasn't a major contributor to keeping my blood chemistry as good as it was. Only an 11 oz. box a day but I wouldn't be without it. ADDED NOTE They've changed the top since I last ordered and I'd like to thank whom ever made the decision to do so. The screw top is 1000% better than that old silver strip that never came off the same way twice in a row and didn't protect a partially filled box. I hope they will continue to use this screw-top packaging from now on. THANK YOU AGAIN

Not sure whether it was just me or it was the product but I didn't like the taste... Some of the bottles tasted as if they were expired... Or maybe it just tastes like that – I can't tell as it was the first time I bought this brand of coconut water. I did have some coconut water from an actual coconut, and the taste was better (to me). I am not planning on buying it again.
reviews.review_header: ... me or it was the product but I didn't like the taste

reviews.review_text: It tastes nothing like fresh coconut juice. Nor does it taste like the frozen kinds. It is not that good. I bought two cases too. The taste is weird. A bit sour like a preservative or acid was added. Coconut should not be sour. It should have a neutral sweet taste. Maybe it is from canned juice or maybe the taste changes after it is pasteurized. I suggest buying real young coconuts in bulk and crack them yourself. Delicious. These Vita Cocos are a little less than ok. I would not drink this everyday. So the good?: Price is ok Convenient The bad?: Sour Weird taste Loss of nutrients through pasteurization Not good Not much coconut flavor

I have now tried them all: tetra pak coconut water, canned coconut water and bottled coconut water and I have found that for the most part, the tetra pak product is the most authentic purest taste of them all. The canned coconut waters are way to sweet and taste like there is sugar added. Also too much of a nutty taste. The bottled coconut waters are the worst! All are made from concentrate and include natural flavors, which can mean absolutely anything! Finally, of the tetra product, I prefer Vita Coco (pure flavor and pineapple). ANother brand that I found to be so-so is harvest bay. I should note that Ive been an avid coconut water drinker for years and have watched the evolution of packaged coconut water take place in the US and abroad. Im glad to see Americans drinking more of it and less of the sugary artificial stuff. Also, the box I received expires Aug.17 2013

It's funny how coconut water is a love it or hate it kind of thing. I don't see how anyone couldn't love this stuff... it's just so refreshing. The taste is so mild (talking about the plain coconut water variety) that at first you wonder if you're just drinking water, but then comes that slight sweetness that tells you it's from a young coconut. I don't think I buy all the "best hangover cure" stuff, because I can't think of any reason why it should have some sort of magical properties in that regard. My best guess is that drinking one of these things before bed gives you the hydration your body sorely needs after a night of overconsumption. I would think that you'd get the same effect drinking 11.2 ounces of water, juice, or some other non-diuretic beverage, but what do I know? Regardless, these are worth the money because they are delicious, and it's a flavor you just can't get elsewhere. Vita Coco does it right too--no added sugar or nasty chemicals. And this is a great way to get Potassium for those of us who don't like bananas. I've tried all the flavors of this and I do like the ones that are mixed with fruit juice, but I keep coming back to the plain coconut water because in the other flavors the stronger fruit juice overpowers the subtle coconut flavor--and that is the best part in my opinion!

I started drinking coconut water last summer to rehydrate after lots of time outdoors: and I find I love it in the winter too! This brand, in the unflavored version, is great, just perfect. You have to keep your eyes open for the best price, though: today, it's $12.19, yay!! UPDATE: Just got a new shipment, and this one is not so great :( My previous shipments have been product from the Phillipines, and they were fantastic. This one (June 6, 2011) is from Brazil, and has a sort of stale taste, along with an aftertaste that I think is coming from the form of Vitamin C added as a preservative. Don't think it's going to make me ill or anything, but I will be cancelling this subscription, unfortunately :(
Ok. Small bottle. Not worth the 30% increase in a month.
reviews.review_header: Decent coconut water, but don’t buy. Way too expensive

reviews.review_text: Purchased a 12 pack from the local supermarket. I do not like the flavor. It tastes sour and has a cigarette-flavored aftertaste. Somehow tastes burn, not a hint of sweetness at all. I have switched to Foco, in the same Tetra Pak packaging. Taste is a lot better and pleasant compared to Vita Coco. It was a chore to finish the other 12 (I gave Vita Coco another chance, purchased a single carton to single out a bad batch. Same unpleasant flavor). Try a variety before you buy boxes of the stuff!

Well, when I first started buying this, it just said "100% coconut water" on the package. Now it says "Coconut water, Less than 1% natural fruit sugar, vitamin C." Coconut water already has plenty of sugar in it. WHY would they add sugar to it? I'm buying this for health reasons - I am always crazy thirsty no matter how much water I drink, and coconut water helps alleviate that thirst better than anything else. I'm trying to find something natural and healthy, so adding sugar to it makes absolutely no sense to me. I'm certainly not drinking it for the taste. At any rate, buyer beware. It's not actually 100% coconut water anymore. It's 99% coconut water and 1% added fruit sugar. Maybe it always had been and they were forced to change the label, but there's plenty out there that don't have added sugar. 1% may not matter to some, but to others looking for something natural or trying to avoid unnecessary sugars, it might.

formula has changed recently. they are now including fruit sugar in the ingredients. this has now tripled the sugar content from 5 grams (pictured) to 15 grams. not even sure why they did this, as the taste is now too sweet. are they trying to sell coconut juice or water? PS. I have informed Amazon of the incorrect image. they have yet to correct it.
reviews.review_header: formula has changed recently. they are now including fruit sugar in the ingredients. this has now tripled the sugar content fr

reviews.review_text: I am a long-distance runner and do Bikram (Hot) yoga. Both of these activities take a lot out of me, and I used to get painful foot and leg cramps. No more after drinking such high-potassium drinks like this one. I prefer the original flavor over the other flavorings because there's nothing added--just like they drink it straight from the coconut in India, Costa Rica, or Thailand. If you're a fan of sugary drinks or Vitamin-Water, you might not enjoy this because it's a little earthy tasting. But, if you can wean yourself off the flavor of the other "enhanced" waters, this stuff will be so much better for you!
I love Vita Coco's coconut water & found the best price on Amazon with Subscribe & Save. All coconut water is not created equal. Buy this!
reviews.review_header: Love Vita Coco's coconut water! Found the best price on Amazon!

reviews.review_text: i've been ordering vita coco now from amazon for a couple of years and have generally been pretty happy with the product but then a few months ago i noticed that some of the water did not look clear and it also smelled kinda funny. it was only a handful so i just overlooked it and didn't bother to do a google search because it was only a couple. no big deal. well, then i received my next shipment but this time the issue happened a lot more. so much so that i contacted amazon and they took care of my issue and also, out of the 6 boxes i get delivered to my home every month, only one box looked and tasted horribly so again, not THAT big of a deal. that brings us to the present time and again i had 6 boxes delivered to my home and we haven't even gotten through the first box and already over half of them were yellowish muddy water looking and it's starting to get out of hand! so much so that i contacted vita coco via twitter as well as amazon! i'm not one to make a huge deal but this is getting ridiculous. vita coco wrote me back and i sent them the information they requested and i'm hoping their customer service isn't as bad as people say it is. so, let this be fair warning, there is a chance that you may get a batch like this and if you do, contact amazon or vita coco and let them know or just order one box and see how you like it or looks before you get hooked on it and start ordering six boxes a month.
Taste like socks - no matter how chilled.
