I am very disappointed, the product stated 100% pure Coconut water and no sugar added. I cannot have sugar. It has 15g of carbohydrate and 15g of sugar, whoever is selling this product should update the website ad. Money doesn't grow on tree's!

Many of us have heard coconut water's most famous nickname, Nature's Gatorade, i.e., without the added sugar (high fructose corn syrup) or artificial dyes. Coconut water is so much more! I started suffering from postural hypotension (a.k.a. orthostatic hypotension) a few years ago. When I'd get up from a non-standing position, especially one where my head was at or lower than my heart level, I'd see gray spots, all gray, feel a piercing migraine, and/or loose complete control over my equilibrium and balance. That made cleaning and yoga almost perilous activities, as the unsteady, dizzy feeling felt worse than a hangover (I stopped taking yoga altogether, but I can't exactly stop cleaning!). I also would occasionally feel dizzy even if I was standing upright the whole time--with no apparent provocation. The scariest experience was when I was in an exercise class and had been in a crouching position (with a lowered head) for several minutes. When I started to get up too quickly, it literally felt like an outside force was puppeteering my body, pushing down on me, and preventing me from being able to immediately stand up. It felt like momentary possession. I later talked with a doctor about it, who said that when our brains, that three pound, all-important organ, aren't getting enough oxygenated blood, it can feel very strange and the sensation will feel differently to different people. Although the brain only weighs three pounds, it greedily commandeers 25% of the oxygenated blood supply at all times. Even slightly less than the 25% will cause fainting, as that will help the body bypass gravity and blood pressure adjustments and let the blood flow more freely to the brain. When we are in a non-standing position, blood will pool in our legs, and our blood pressure can't always adjust quickly enough to accommodate our rising posture. There is a reason I'm giving a medical back history to this review--bear with me. I thought I'd have to get on some long-term medication to treat my postural hypotension. It turns out that for some reason if I drink coconut water on a regular basis, I get far less dizzy, and the gray spots and other symptoms are far more manageable. I talked with a nurse about it, and she said that the mineral-rich coconut water can actually change the blood's viscosity, which can in turn affect blood pressure and stop the dizzying affects of postural hypotension. I have very low blood pressure (low 100s, 90s, even high 80s) and hypoglycemia, so somehow, this Wonder Drink has helped restore my balance and equilibrium to the point where I don't freak out about passing out if I'm in a non-standing position. I still do see gray spots or get a equilibrium headache at times, but not nearly to the extent that I used to before I regularly consumed coconut water. I stopped drinking the coconut water for awhile to see if the postural hypotension symptoms returned, and sure enough, they did. I hope there will be some studies to see how coconut water fares as an alternative treatment for postural/orthostatic hypotension.
reviews.review_header: Much more than Nature's Gatorade---good treatment for dizziness

reviews.review_text: Mine came looking as it should. It tastes a little different than most coconut waters I've enjoyed. The ingredients are supposedly just coconut water & fruit sugar. However, those two natural ingredients would give me hives. This water gave me hives. Never happens with real, whole foods. Between that & the odd taste, I'm going to have to pass.

While I was strolling the isles of my nearby Costco Warehouse Store I spotted a new item. It was a box of Vita Coco Pure Coconut Water. The box contained a dozen 11.2-ounce containers. Well, I've had coconut water before and this seemed like a good bargain so I bought a box. I like it for the high concentration of potassium and other electrolytes and I learned this little trick when I was a marathon runner.. The taste is good, but it tastes much more like coconut water right out of the shell than most other brands. I suppose that's because it has never gone through the concentrate state and it's totally free of added flavors. It's almost sugar free and, as such, is not sweet as are some coconut drinks. I thought it had an ever-so-slight fermented taste, which was not at all objectionable. It tastes like natural coconut water, and that's what it is. My first drink was when I got home and the water was not chilled. Be sure to chill it as they suggest as it tastes better. Gary Peterson
reviews.review_header: Coconut Water Free Of Added Flavors.

reviews.review_text: Great tasting Coconut Water. This is 12 plastic bottles of coconut water. Each bottle is 16.9 oz. Resealable top. The taste is fresh and clean. Only 3 ingredients: Coconut Water, Less than 1% Sugar and Vitamin C. Product of Thailand. Gluten Free. I really like this coconut water and look forward to drinking this on a regular basis'.
reviews.review_header: Clean Coconut Water in Plastic Bottle

reviews.review_text: This is a wonderful product. Vita Coco tastes delicious. Not overpowering or sweet. It has a perfect, subtle, natural coconut taste. Vita Coco truly does refresh you and re-hydrate you faster than regular water. Faster than Gatorade. You can feel the difference. Especially if you are working hard, working out, or having a hard day out in the heat. Keep it cold and you will really enjoy its taste. Very fresh and smooth. If you are not feeling well, this coconut water is one of the best things for you. Easy on the stomach and easy to keep down. Gives you energy quicker than sipping water or Gatorade. On a more touchy medical note, if you have constipation, this stuff will usually fix that for you naturally and without discomfort. You just have to drink enough. How much? That depends on you personally, but finding out is easy and rewarding. Delicious, useful, refreshing. Can't get better than that. BUY IT.

Several months ago my son who is a doctor told me to start drinking coconut water. Well it tried to find one I could tolerate but literally hated them all. He said I was crazy and just being stuborn. A few weeks ago I was at Costco and they had it Vito Coco out as a tester. For me it was love at first taste and I immediately bought 3 cartons. I love this stuff! I am 76 years young and have been suffering from dehydration because I'm not a water lover my but my last blood test was perfect. I am totally addicted and I encourage everyone to give "Vito" a try. I now have it on auto-ship.

This product also comes in 34-ounce boxes (package of 6) Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 34-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) The single-servings have 11.1 ounces Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.2-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) , while the 34-ounce carton says it has four servings of 8.5 ounces each. This is 100% pure natural coconut water, with no added sugar. Each 11.1-ounce serving has 60 calories, 0 grams of any kind of fat, 40mg sodium, 680mg potassium, 15g total carb (0g fiber, 15g naturally-occurring sugars, none added), and 0 grams protein. Percentages based on a 2000-calorie diet, it has 230% Vitamin C, 5% Calcium, 5% Phosphorous, 10% Magnesium. This means that Vita Coco 100% pure coconut water has more electrolytes, with 15 times more potassium, than leading sports drinks, without the added sugars and/or artificial sweeteners and other added ingredients (dyes, etc.) It gives excellent hydration. My only regret is that I didn't find Vita Coco before I did a 26.2-mile marathon back in 2002. I still take frequent walks, and with Vita Coco, I never cramp. I have noticed that my blood is clotting better/wounds are healing more quickly. I occasionally get small scratches from my cat, and have gotten various scratches from shrubbery encountered on my walks, and recently, a sharp knife got the better of me and I cut my fingertip. It was during these recent instances that I noticed the faster healing time and better blood clotting. I monitor my body's processes closely and can attribute these improvements, at least in large part, to consuming coconut water. Highly recommended! I'm on Amazon's "Subscribe & Save" with this product. I find that my husband and I use more of this in the summer (when we are more active outdoors) than in the winter, and Subscribe & Save allows me to add more or order less on certain shipments.
reviews.review_header: Vita Coco - Electrolyte and potassium rich, no added sugar

reviews.review_text: Vita Coco 100% pure coconut water is a staple in our household. It's so much healthier than sodas or sugary juices. Its only ingredient is coconut water, which is naturally high in potassium, magnesium, calcium, and phosphorous. No artificial preservatives, colors or flavors, and no added sugar. It hydrates better than regular water or sports drinks, too. Each box has 60 calories, 35 mg sodium, 15 gms of carbs, and no fat or cholesterol. I love these 11.1 oz. long-life containers - they don't have to be refrigerated and the easy pull tab on the top makes it easy even for children to open it. It's the perfect size and travels well in a backpack or purse. The flavor of this product is as close to coconut water right out of the shell as you can get. We've drunk cases of it and never had any that had an "off" flavor like one reviewer had. It lasts for months on the pantry shelf, and we make sure we don't run out of it by having it delivered free with Amazon's Subscribe and Save program. I save 15% on the purchase price by subscribing to delivery. Even if you don't want to subscribe (there's no obligation after the first delivery) you can have it shipped free with SuperSaver shipping if your order totals $25 or more. I sound like a commercial as I read back over my review, but I just want potential buyers to know that this is a quality product that our family loves, and one that I feel good about serving to them.
reviews.review_header: Delicious, packed with vitamins and minerals

reviews.review_text: in general, it difficult to rate the supplier when it comes to coconut water unless something went wrong that obviously put the supplier at fault, such as dents and tear on the packaging, late shipment and stuff, since the taste of real coconut water varies depending on the fruit, season, plantation location, packaging process, etc. Bearing that in mind, I have tried this product and the O.N.E brand of coconut water on three times over the past year; bought from different stores and at varying months to try to eliminate any excuses due to variations. my conclusion is that O.N.E tastes the best-- true mild, coconutty flavor with a tinge of sweetness-- a good, honest flavor reminiscent of coconuts from thailand. I have been told, and personally have experienced, that coconuts from various countries taste different. Vietnamese and Cambodian coconuts produce water that is blander, sourish and generally not as pleasant. This product tastes like that, unfortunately. If you're looking for that naturally sweet fresh(er) coconut taste, try O.N.E-- i'd recommend it over this particular brand
reviews.review_header: NOT a review for the supplier but for the product

reviews.review_text: You get what you pay for, and consistency is an issue as far as I've experienced with Vita Coco. When the optimal product is produced (probably 80% of what I've ordered so far)... Crisp, clean, refreshing - no aftertaste or pulpiness. Good source of potassium and electrolytes to revitalize your body. Not from concentrate, which is a much bigger thing than I had expected. I ordered the ZICO Premium Coconut Water, Natural, 14 fl oz (Pack of 12) and was shocked at how awful the concentrate tastes versus this. Zico is a great brand with good consistency when it comes to their NOT from concentrate, but I strongly advise against concentrate.
reviews.review_header: Good source of potassium and electrolytes to revitalize your body

reviews.review_text: My wife and I go to Florida every winter. We have coconut palm trees on the property of our Florida home and starting every February the coconuts are cut down and each day we open one for the coconut water. It is the best. However we are Canadian and on returning to Canada this spring we tried a number of brands of coconut water to match the taste and Only Vita tastes exactly like the coconut water from our own coconuts. Excellent. The other brands do not and we have tried them all.
reviews.review_header: Just like from my own Tree

reviews.review_text: Tastes like real coconut water, but it has sugars in it. So not my favorite one.

This is the best coconut water I have ever tasted. I have been drinking this for many years now and have tried numerous other brands. They do not compare to the refreshing taste I get with every bottle of Vita Coco Pure. Some of the other brands were a mystery: they would taste just OK sometimes. Vita CoCo Pure has never disappointed me.
reviews.review_header: You Can't Go Wrong With Vita CoCo Pure

reviews.review_text: I was quite disappointed with the very first sip because there was no comparison with the fresh coconut water I got from a fresh young coconut, perhaps my expectation of this product was too high. The off taste may be due to the extra ingredients added, I wish someone could just retain the most original taste of a coconut water without adding anything else and to make the drink a true pure coconut water drink. However, after two drinks, I did get used it. Overall it is a good drink.

The Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.1-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) taste OK, sweeter than ONE for those with a sweet tooth (I haven't tried Zico, so I can't compare the two), perhaps too sweet for those seeking more of a "fresh water" taste. There is a hint of sulfur (stronger at room temperature), presumably used as a preservative. There's mention of pulp in the drink, which I'm not fond of. I have not spotted any, but then again, the diameter of the straw I use is so small, any pulp, if present wouldn't be able to pass through. I had to use straws removed from old Capri Sun packages because, unlike competitors, the containers had no straws attached, which removes about half the convenience of the packaging. The company also listed no nutritional value information or an ingredients list under their product description (all that's listed are the "benefits"). The price is comparable to other brands (it becomes a great price when amazon offers a promotion). For potential buyers: Beware of planted reviews for some of the Vita Coco products, aimed at boosting the star rating. Tsk tsk. If the product is good, it will sell itself, but I'll not rate the product based on this finding.
reviews.review_header: Sweeter than ONE, no straws included.

reviews.review_text: This product was very disappointing. The packaging was nice and made the product look worthy of the price. However it tasted awful. I will never buy it again.

To be honest, I wasn't crazy about the taste. Smelled nice like coconut but only palatable when chilled. In fairness, I found out after.... it had a "Best buy date" of 2 weeks before I bought it. Maybe within the Best Buy date is much better? I like that it's not made from concentrate. I tried mixing half and half with Cranberry juice and it was WAY WAY better! I got the potassium I wanted from the vitacoco and the Cranberry tartness was mellowed by the coconut.

Its def an acquired taste. I got addicted to this stuff and I need to have at least one cocnut water every day. I feel more energetic and my skin softer. Coconut water has so many many benefits.. I def recommend for you all to read Coconut Water for Health and Healing by Bruce Fife. You will find out there is to this great water!!! Hope you buy this product and enjoy the benefits!!!

Rehydrate with an amazingly healthy drink. The benefits of coconut are incredible and this is such an easy way to obtain them :o)
Nastiest thing ever...this taste worst than the Goya one which in my opinion tastes like vanilla essence...please people quit remixing coconut water... Sincerely person from a tropical island
