reviews.review_text: I have used Zico and ONE for years and the two taste pretty much the same. Enter: Vita coco. I switched only for price reasons and found that Vita Coco taste more like the fresh coconut juice you get when you crack open a green one. So it has a more coconuty taste, but ironicly i'm not a huge fan of the taste. I prefer ONE or Zico because it carries a milder flavor. If price is not a consideration, I'd go for Zico or One.

I like the cap, but must be costing more money to produce. I compared this with O.N.E which I also bought. Vista is sweeter taste. I will not buy through Amazon, although cheaper than local supermarket. I found compatible coconut water at Costco and much much cheaper. So I will be buying from Costco now on.

I was skeptical when I was first told of coconut water by a friend, I couldn't imagine it was a hydrating as she made it out to be. I've tried all of the functional beverages with added electrolytes etc. and found them all to be sub par- I figured coco water was a gimmick. I stand corrected. Suffering thru a horrible flu last Christmas I was dehydrated beyond belief. I dranks tons of water and just couldn't quench my thirst. While in my local Wholefoods I came across Vita Coco. One little pack and I swear to you I felt like I had drank a liter of water out of an aquafer. I promise you, you instantly feel hydrated and fresh. I drink regularly and use it as a pick me up when tired. My family, friends and boyfriend are all fans now and I was pleasantly surprised to see it on subscrition at Amazon. I get 2 cases a month. I promise- you won't be disappointed!

I've had the real thing several times, but this Vita stuff is good too. Vita is the only brand that I have tried so far. Of the single ones that I drank from two cases (gave some away), they all were good and they all tasted the same - no yucky ones in my batch. I will be trying the other brands also. I kind of crave this stuff. Maybe I got a potassium deficiency. Happy chugging.
Best brand available today! 100% coconut water! Nothing added!
I love this coconut water!
Taste slightly sweet! Like the real coconut as I tried several times. I like it!
rinse & repeat

did you know that coconut water was used in place of blood plasma in Pacific war zones during WWII? ONE brand is actually better and tastes like TOASTED coconut, but Vitacoco still gets 5 stars. My kids would float themselves away on this stuff if I let them.
reviews.review_header: Warning: kids will drink untl they pop

reviews.review_text: Coconut water is supposed to be the best liquid to rehydrate your body after a strenuous workout because it contains an optimum balance of water and electrolytes. It is a natural remedy that tastes and works far better than the glorified sugar water that is gatorade, powerade, and vitamin water. In terms of brands, I prefer vita coco's taste because it tastes just like it came out of a fresh coconut.
I love the taste of this coconut water! I drink two a day and since then have had less frequent IBS attacks. It makes me feel better and has boosted my energy and immune system. Highly recommend!
reviews.review_header: A Great Way to Boost Your Health!

reviews.review_text: NOT PURE COCONUT WATER, EXTRA INGREDIENTSEXTRA BURNED MY THROAT AND CAUSED MY ESOPHAGUS TO ITCH AND SWELL. Despite false claims on the front of this package , this product is not actually pure coconut water. It contains added sugars and ascorbic acid to mask a poor quality product. I would recommend just buying your own young cook fresh coconuts which are much cheapeor for convenience buy Zico's not from concentrate products. But avoid their from concentrate products as they taste like burnt plastic.
reviews.review_header: Not actually pure coconut water, cause an allergic reaction as well.

reviews.review_text: I have recently fallen in love with coconut water. The funny thing is that coconut water is not new to me. I actually used to drink it a lot growing up. But after moving out of my parents' place, i just never bothered to buy it for myself until it became a huge product in the American markets. So i of course snagged this when it was available as a hot deal. It arrived quickly and now i keep it in my office drawer. Though i can't say i taste a difference between this and coco libre, the individual cartons make it very convenient.

I like this coconut water. The taste is just a bit stronger than the other brands while still being 100% coconut water. However, I hate how it doesn't come with a straw unlike the other tetra-pack drinks. And on the picture they show a straw in a coconut. I bought 2 packs of 12, one of them (out of 24) tasted weird. It had a petroleum smell/taste to it. I drank a few sips and a few more since it was so expensive, but ended up throwing it out. Anyone else with this issue? I kinda don't want to reorder it if it gets contaminated with that kind of stuff.
reviews.review_header: Very yummy and refreshing. No straw (unlike O.N.E.). 1/24 had weird taste

reviews.review_text: I just ordered this from amazon a few days ago and it's amazing! I've always heard from friends who have lived in the Carribeans about the many nutritious benefits that Coconut water has for you. I tried it warm and then put it in the refrigerator to cool and trust me, it's better when it's cold. It tastes SOOOOOOOOO refreshing going down, I can't believe that it took me until now to try this. I am now addicted and have to watch it because it is pretty costly. I will definitely be setting aside $ just to buy this in bulk, or at least try to anyway :.)
reviews.review_header: Coo Coo for Vita Coco Coconut Water Now!

reviews.review_text: A yoga instructor recommended coconut water to me as a drink that would help to replenish my energy after a difficult class. I found a large container of it at my health food store and tried it. I found that it really works but I didn't want a large container because I wanted to be able to bring it to the gym for after a workout. Leave it to Amazon to provide a link to Vita Coco products and packs of 12 in a small, drinkable size. So far, my favorite is the Pure Coconut Water. It's not loaded with chemicals or high in sugar and has a light, pleasant taste.

it is coconut water, pretty much what you would expect. barely sweet... which is understandable as its pure. anyway, someone mentioned something about good for weightloss i believe... not true. this thing, although better in that respect than say... soda, is still loaded with carbs. 15g of carbs per serving. this drink isnt sweet enough to justify that many carbs (carbs drive insulin secretion and thus fat storage in our bodies). not to knock the drink so much, but not a good alternative to water, and not good for dieters, if this is your focus.
reviews.review_header: good coconut water, but i would stick with water to hydrate... NOT GOOD FOR WEIGHT LOSS

reviews.review_text: Um, is it just my bad luck? Every single time I've tried it, there was always something wrong with it. Not to mention the taste, it's very chemical-ly and had a bad minty aftertaste. I prefer O.N.E. better, never got a bad batch from them.

As far as coconut waters go, this is poor. I could hardly even stomach it. I imagine that if you don't have a lot of experience with coconut water, you may think this is pretty good. But this isn't how they're supposed to taste. Go try Taste Nirvana's real coconut water made from Thai coconuts, and you'll understand what I'm talking about. I am really worried about what is in Vita Coco's water that makes it taste so off compared to natural waters.

A few months ago after a long period of stress & excessive coffee drinking I began to give myself an stomach ulcer. Since I have other health issues I need somthing natural to help my stomach lining heal. After researching, I found that coconut water was highly recommended by people all over the web. I decided to try all three top products. Zico, O.N.E, & VitaCoco. I really hated drinking Zico (it left a nasty taste), I liked the O.N.E. much better (still had a bit of after taste) but the VitaCoco was really great once it was cold.

I was introduced to this coconut water by a friend while camping. My body immediately and rapidly ingested and enjoyed, and I could tell my body needed it. I felt hydrated. Since then I have been drinking nearly every single day, and I have lost a ton of weight. I truly believe it's largely due to this delicious drink, as it makes me so hydrated and fool of potassium and other nutrients that I am not hungry for large meals. Not apple sauce or yogurt satisfy me for most meals, with an occasional large meal. It has truly changed my life. This, combined with other life changed coconut water helped facilitate, have helped me lose more than 60 lbs. I now and 6'3" 218 lbs and happier than I have ever been with my body, and the way I feel each day. Can't say enough about how much I love coconut water. If the regular flavor isn't up your alley, try to work it into your life with a flavor. It's a great thing, I promise you that. Cheers everybody!

Our family did a little taste test of three brands (we hope to do more in the future, lol). Vita Coco, (from Brazil), Taste Nirvana (from Thailand) and Zico (from Thailand). Vita Coco was the only one with a strong tart taste that none of us liked, we all rated it third of the three (though my 2 year old was still quite happy to drink it all). It's not terrible, but I won't be buying it again now that I see what the difference is. It was striking how easy it was to tell which was which by taste alone.
reviews.review_header: Not our favorite. Has a tart taste.

reviews.review_text: My husband and I LOVE this stuff. We love how quickly it absorbs into the body. It just feels so right, doesn't sit or have a weird after taste like most sport drinks. Our body loves this stuff just as much as we do...without all that fructose, sucrose, and whatchamacallit preservative additive stuff in so many products today. I love the plain coconut water as it has less calories and gives me the boost I need. Just check out the ingredient list...coconut water...that's it!!! Gee I sound like a commercial :-/. Anyway, the fact that it's low in calories and offers the potassium and electrolites we need just seals the deal for us. Oh the other thing I noticed when comparing products is vitacoco uses ACTUAL fruit puree unlike the other brand that uses fruit essence...what is fruit "essence" anyway??? And if you've never had coconut water, it doesn't taste like cococut meat. It's more earthy and subtle. And if you're squimish on taste and picky, I recommend my husband's favorite flavor, Pineapple. That one is coconut water with pineapple and coconut meat puree...it tastes like a refreshing PinaColda :-). He absolutely LOVES it...I do too, but it has a little more calories (110 cal) and a little fat (2.5g), whereas the plain coconut water has only 60cal and 0 fat, yes, zero :-). BTW, my husband is an avid runner who logs around 45+ miles a week and is always looking for a good drink to rehydrate and recoop after a long run. Since this stuff isn't cheap, around $1.50 a shot, he saves it for his longest runs and drinks nestle quick chocolate skim milk for his shorter runs...but the coconut water is by far his favorite treat. Besure to chill it before drinking...not very refreshing warm :-p. For the reviewer who didn't like it, feel free to send your case to us, we'll drink it :-).
reviews.review_header: Energizing and Refreshing...Awesome for Post Workouts or quick energy boost

reviews.review_text: Growing up in a tropical country of south east asia, i know the taste of fresh coconut. Not sure if its the packaging makes the difference but this particular brand an packaging has the taste of fresh coconut water. Now, if only i can find a good tasting young coconut meat. I'll be in heaven, or in my hometown...
Vita Coco is my favorite coconut water, it has the best flavor in my opinion! I've tried other brands, including Naked, and this one tastes the best.
reviews.review_header: My favorite brand of coconut water!

reviews.review_text: I LOVE fresh coconut water, ever since I was a kid and would visit my grandparents in Florida. They lived near a golf course and I used to scavange for newly fallen fruit. Then I would selfishly drink all the juice when we would stuggle to open a fresh coconut. A lot of work, but well worth it... then. I was SO excited when I found Vita Coco at my local health food store. I drank my first container and was immediately in love. No added sugar, no added flavor, just the way I like it... like it came out of the coconut. Now, with the click of a button I buy Vita Coco online == two cases a month == and I drink one a day. (I could easily drink more, but I don't want to find myself in an intervention for addiction. :~) Thank you Vita Coco for the BEST, most delicious fresh coconut juice, easy to store, easy to open, easy to drink. Thanks to Amazon.com for delivering it right to my door, regularly every month. YUM, I'm going to the fridge to get one right now!
reviews.review_header: Ambrosia - the BEST fresh coconut juice!

reviews.review_text: Consumerlab did a report recently on coconut waters and this brand does not have the amounts of minerals listed. So, if that's not a problem for you and you just want coconut water, this is an ok product. But, if you're looking for rehydration and a product that has what it says it has in it, you'll want to look elsewhere. = Susanna K. Hutcheson
reviews.review_header: Tastes ok but ingredients not what they say

reviews.review_text: We ordered these for our kids but we are pretty disappointed... We have purchased the actual coconuts in the past but they are not easy to come by... So we thought that these might be convenient to keep in the fridge... However... What's in these boxes DOES NOT TASTE LIKE COCONUT AT ALL!! Pricey and not tasty... Definitely Not worth the $ we spent :0(
reviews.review_header: If you expect coconut flavor keep looking

reviews.review_text: Coconut water might be an acquired taste. My first sip I wondered why people like this stuff at all. Now I drink one a day and enjoy the heck out of it. They taste great and make you feel good too!

If anything is Pasteurized or Homogenized the Enzymes and the needed Nutrients that are Truly Beneficial to YOUR body are DEAD!!! So Why bother!!! Your Body needs RAW - Organic - available at Whole Foods - Google it...there is a raw brand available. God Bless & Be Well!
Deceptive marketing. NOT pure if there's added sugar at any percentage, regardless of whether it's "natural fruit" or some other kind.
reviews.review_header: Pure coconut water + added sugar is more accurate

reviews.review_text: Fine product if you like the blandness of this coconut beverage. I won't buy more not because it's a bad product, but because it doesn't appeal to me, no sweetness, just coconut water. I do like it for cooking though, rice works well with this:)
reviews.review_header: Better for cooking than drinking in my opinion

reviews.review_text: We first thought this was the bee's knees when we first found it at Costco. Since then, we bought and compared about 10 different brands and now this one tastes HORRIBLE! The brand that comes THE CLOSEST to tasting like naturally picked coconut water is this one: Taste Nirvana Real Coconut Water, 16.2-Ounce (Pack of 12) Go to the grocery store, buy a VitaCACA and buy a Taste Nirvana and taste them side by side. Then, come back here and do the monthly delivery thing. It's the cheapest way to buy Taste Nirvana.

I won't say its "THE" replacement for the original coconut water..I still fresh miss coconut water but its an average substitute...I hope it does have the goodness it claims (electrolytes, potassium, magnesium etc) which makes it a really refreshing drink....only trick it serve chilled always and yo its a great drink to get rid of hangover instantly lol...Enjoy. I gave it 3 stars just because of its price...Amazon should work with the supplier to make it 75-80 cents per small pack instead of over $1 because I use it everyday. Enjoy.
Tastes very good
Iʻm not sure Iʻve ever had a bad coconut water, but this brand is certainly a good one. Very refreshing and serves as an excellent electrolyte replacement after exercising.
Different but I enjoy the tastes.

This is a great drink after running, walking or exercising. It not only is thirst quenching, but puts electrolytes back into your body. It gives me more energy and tastes fresh. A friend introduced me to coconut water a few months ago and I have been drinking it ever since. I prefer this brand over the others. I think it is best ice cold!
Love these, water with a slight hint of coconut. My doctor actually recommend these over Gatorade when I was sick.
reviews.review_header: Love these, water with a slight hint of coconut

reviews.review_text: I've tried all of the flavors, including the natural unflavored variety. None of them taste great; there's a tangyness, likely from a higher acid content. I believe the packaging may also have something to do with it--there's a faint cardboardy flavor in there as well. I much prefer C2O which tastes more pH neutral. After reading some of the reviews for this product, I'll have to check out the other brands that people have mentioned as being superior. If I hadn't been given a case of this for free from a friend, I would definitely not be drinking it.

I'm a huge fan of Vita coco and here's why: - It tastes so good. A huge fan of the taste, especially the original flavor and the pineapple one. - All the health benefits. Tons of electrolytes and nutrients, low calories - Helps you lose weight! Def helped me shed a few pounds without condemning myself to a boring only-drink-water to lose weight deal - All natural, unlike other sports drinks like Gatorade. - Also really good for dealing with hangovers! I've tried Zico too and while it's not bad, it does have a bunch of extra stuff in it, especially since Coke took control of it. The quality has dropped in my opinion. My entire family and I drink tons of Vita Coco everyday and whole-heartedly recommend it to everyone out there! Get in the Coco craze.
reviews.review_header: Vita coco is the best out there!

reviews.review_text: I ordered this either for my wife and I or as a gift if you look at the rating we gave it that will tell you if we liked it or not, if it is special we will add a little comment same if it is bad. But telling me how many word I need to use is STUPID !!

I've tried many of the different makes of coco water, from the other popular choices, Zico, ONE, Naked, and CocoLibre and none seem to have as good of a flavour as this one. Most seem to have an off taste that doesn't seem to be what natural coconut water should taste like. This coconut water, however, was one that I liked and is pure coconut water. Very good drink and definitely worth it to get when you can get it on sale.
reviews.review_header: Best tasting Coco-water that I've had

reviews.review_text: I personally dont like coconut water/drinks but since my mom likes it i bought this for her and she loved it alot.

I received this 12 pack in what looked like fine condition (they are 11.1 oz, not 11.2 oz, but no big deal). Vita Coco has changed their formula to include vitamin C, possibly to prevent the problem I had: a product that smelled and tasted like rotting fish. About half of the products contained clear liquid, and about half when you opened them contained a urine-colored product, with the white cardboard around the mouthpiece having fringed into a brownish color. Vita Coco assured me this was a normal color variation. I drank quite a few of them, and the tasted varied greatly. Some were almost as sweet as glucose syrup and I had to cut them with water. Some tasted what I would call normal. And then I came across one of the brown mouthpieced ones with urine-colored product which smelled and tasted like rotten fish. I called Vita Coco again and again was told that I should be happy that there is a color and taste variation because it indicates a natural product. I was then interrupted and asked if I had a point I was trying to make. I told the customer service agent at Vita Coco I was telling her the product tasted like rotting fish. And she responded by telling me that she liked fish. She asked me if I call a lot of companies to complain about products. I will give myself a lot of credit and say that I remained calm in spite of her continued nasty comments. She kept telling me I needed to contact Amazon to file my complaint, and I was aghast that a company that sells beverages couldn't care less that they were selling a rotten beverage. She said 99% of the time they're not. So she is trying to make me feel better by saying only 1 out of 100 of their products is rotten? She told me she had nothing more to say and had given me all my options (having given me the Amazon.com phone number). At this point, I was annoyed, and maybe this wasn't the best thing to say, but I asked if she would be contacting the FDA about this. She told me that the FDA doesn't handle natural products. She said what would they do--tell us to use different coconuts? I finally said, I just want to know that you will pass this message along, and will you contact me to update me. Normally I wouldn't care. Normally if she hadn't talked to me like she had, I would have been happy for a refund or anything, none of which was offered. I don't need to know what the company will do. But she kept sarcastically saying she was going to pass my message along, and I told her based on her attitude I didn't believe she was going to do anything. She asked for my e-mail and said if I don't hear from them in 6-8 weeks, that she *really* hopes I call back. I have worked in customer service, and I have had to put up with abuse from customers, so I never treat representatives like that. And I was nothing but polite to this person who was abusive to me. If a rotten product wasn't enough to turn me off, the rotten attitude at the company's New York office was. I don't trust this company, and they ruined their name in my eyes forever.
reviews.review_header: Received rotten product and customer service

reviews.review_text: clearly Vita Coco is NOT 100% coconut water. in contrast, Naked Coconut has no added supplements. i suspect vitamin C is used as a preservative since when i compared the expiration dates on the supermarket i noticed that Vita Coco expires April 2013, whereas Naked Coconut expires November 2012. you can taste some distant sourness due to vitamin C, which takes a way from the real flavor of coconut water. i'm actually okay drinking this, but if Naked Coconut Water wasn't so expensive I would rather have that over Vita.
reviews.review_header: Real coconut water has 0% vitamin C. Vita has 230% vitamin C.

reviews.review_text: These used to be great but the inconsistent taste and a few rotten ones make this a TERRIBLE buy / risk. Look for coco water that's not heat treated as well, for a much healthier and natural organic product. TERRIBLE customer service from vita water as well, IGNORANT company. For an unbeatable taste in coconut water, but the pre cut baby coconuts in your local market. I understand most people don't want to crack into a coconut all the time, but if you're at home and want to enjoy the best possible tasting coconut water, give this a try. The taste is night and day. :) *Amazon is amazing as always
reviews.review_header: These used to be great... Go with a diffetent brand.

reviews.review_text: I love this coconut water and so do my children! Ordering it here on Amazon I get it at less than half what I can find in stores locally...and it's brought to my door! Can't beat that. This brand has a nice flavor and is very refreshing! It always ships well and I have no complaints at all.

I buy this product from Costco. I bought some yesterday and noticed a packaging change. When I got it home and was putting it in the cabinet, I noticed the containers from my previous purchase said "100% pure coconut water" and the new containers said only "pure coconut water". I turned the products over to compare ingredients. Sure enough, the "100% pure" shows the only ingredient being Natural Coconut Water while the other has the ingredients of coconut water, less the 1% natural fruit sugar, vitamin C. This was very disappointing to me. Why mess with a good thing? Before posting this review I decided to taste test the two. The new container tasted slightly watered down and left an almost bitter aftertaste. This used to be a good product but I won't be purchasing anymore.

This stuff has amazing ability to refresh and recharge. The electrolytes nourish and energize your body. It is fabulous in smoothies or blended with some frozen fruit. We use it for the young athletes as well as the more sedentary family members because it is GOOD for you. Its quite versatile has a mild flavor of its own...goes great as a base with anything and you can feel the difference it makes in a few minutes. This is money well spent.

The label that says Pure Coconut water is deceptive because it has added sugar Ingredients: coconut water, less than 1 % natural fruit sugar, vitamin C So it has about 1 tsp of sugar added because naturally occurring sugar in 8 ounces of pure coconut water is 5.92 grams and this has 11 grams, Since I drank the whole 16 ounces that's 22 grams of sugar. If you are trying to control your sugar not a good idea to drink fruit juice unless specified by your physician.
reviews.review_header: If you are trying to control your sugar not a good idea to drink fruit juice unless specified by your ...

reviews.review_text: I lived in south India for several years, where you get fresh coconut at every corner of the street on road side sellers in bicycle where they cut it fresh from coconut trees. The taste of the coconut water varies based on the soil and water from where it grow. I tried the so-called fresh young coconuts at various farmers market here but they all had some peculiar taste, which I never liked and never tasted like what you get in India, may be because they were imported from Thailand or a nearby island several weeks ago and may be they were grown with specific chemical to last long. The real coconut will not last more than two to three weeks. All the canned ones in farmers marker were also altered and never real coconut water. I tried one from Whole Foods, where it tasted real but not great. I bought this 12 pack from Costco for only 11.xx and it tasted much real and exactly like what I get in India. I saw this founders video in youtube where he mentioned he started this from Brazil, because they drink this next to water there, so may be this is imported from Brazil. Only one mystery is how the taste of all 12 packs I consumed were all sweet, which is not the case if you drink 12 real young coconuts in a row. Atleast couple of them will be tasteless. But for sure these never taste like added sugar and they taste real young coconut water. These are very good natural hydrates, so go get it at Costco.
reviews.review_header: This is real coconut water... Cheaper at costco

reviews.review_text: It's pretty amazing they can pack so many nutrients and electrolytes into a little package, but the taste just left me unsatisfied. You want it to taste like water, or like milk, but instead it ends up being something in between that is impossible to describe. It's not sweet enough to really be thirst quenching and it has just enough of an after taste to really leave you not wanting more. Unless I'm pounding one after a long workout or run I really can't see myself drinking these for any reason.

The manufacturer lied stating the product is 100% coconut juice. They put cheapo citric acid in there. I drank it and I broke out in a rash. Citric acid is NOT lemon juice. It is a chemical. Either way they should state on the front label "Only PART coconut juice, other junk in there!". A citric acid rash takes days to go away. My skin hurts. Ow. I would rate them lower but that option is not available.
It's ok. But there are better tasting coconut water options out there.
I have tried many different coconut water brands and this one is the best. It tastes just as getting the water straight from a coconut (as the packaging suggests), not too sweet, just natural.

Do not be fooled by "pure" coconut water. This has added vitamin c but much worse added fructose. If you have issues with fructose this stuff will give you stomach cramps. Target's store brand has more purity.
reviews.review_header: This has added vitamin c but much worse added fructose

reviews.review_text: Here is the letter I sent to the company upon opening my most recent package of Vita Coco: To Whom it May Concern: I am a long time fan of your product (since 2004) and have been purchasing the 11 oz original coconut water by the case load since 2011 (1 case per month). I have always appreciated the low environmental impact of your paper and foil packaging. I was greatly disheartened when my most recent shipment arrived, and I saw that the packaging now includes a plastic mouthpiece on each container. Plastic production is the number one exploiter of fossil fuels and one of the biggest contributors to environmental pollution, carbon poisoning of the atmosphere, and ultimately plastic waste that does not break down and sits in a landfill forever. I hope you will reconsider this short-sighted change to your product, think of our planet and return to a more environmentally conscious approach. In the meantime, I am seeking out an alternate product that does not include plastic in its packaging.
reviews.review_header: Disappointing change in packaging. Will be cancelling subscription.

reviews.review_text: I like this when I'm out after I've been drinking to rehydrate, but you do realize there are cheaper options? If you buy salt substitute, potassium chloride, like NuSalt, you can sprinkle that in your water at home and it has just as much or more potassium for 1% the cost. Two glasses of that (or VitaCocos) and you can prevent most hangovers.
reviews.review_header: Good when you are drunk, cheaper options

reviews.review_text: For the past few months, I have been drinking O.N.E. Coconut Water, which I love. Vita Coco was on sale at the grocery store, so I picked up a few to try. While I have never had coconut water straight from the coconut, I would be surprised if it tasted like this. This has a rather strong sourish taste and aftertaste. O.N.E. is just refreshing and good, and has a much more natural taste, in my opinion. I doubt I ever would have developed my coconut water habit had Vita Coco been my first experience.
reviews.review_header: I like coconut water -- but not this.

reviews.review_text: Bought 12 cases Vita Coco(11.1oz each for $16.97) about a month ago and they had an expiry date of only two months ahead. The Vita Coco is much much closer to tasting like REAL coconut water even with added Vitamin C. You can find good deals on Amazon but checkout other sites like Soap dot com for better pricing.
reviews.review_header: Tastes like REAL coconut water!!!(with added Vitamin C)

reviews.review_text: My experience about this product since I was born from a Tropical city (Brazil) and my family have a big "coconut addiction " that mean a lot for me and I hope for you too , since we are here buying... so recently I decided to buy a variety of those brands , so I order Zico pack , O.N.E natural experience pack , one Vitacoco pack , and -----Orthodox Coconut Palm Juice---- too , and believe me I follow my instinct , because before I buy it I check and tasted all of them before, and i choose Orthodox Coconut Juice ....and for my surprise is not water , is Juice from the real coconut palm ,and then I was ready to the flavor test with my Son and my Brother , believe it or not my Son grow drinking coconut water , I whant to be very honest with all you ... I try with 4 diferent brands in manhattan , the place were I use to live in ... So now is the turn for my Son with only 6 years of age. so I gave him Zico .....then O.N.E....then Vitacoco ...and at last --------Orthodox Coconut Palm Juice , without comments and nothing my Son choose the same brand that I choose too ...(ORTHODOX COCONUT PALM JUICE) because is the most AMAZING thing I have ever taste in my whole life .So consider that a kid with only 6 years old .... Believe it or not....... Choose the best one ...This is so far my best experience.. I can assure you that I am not being paid by the good people at Orthodox Coconut Palm Brand , but if I were, their profits would increase 1000%. Have you ever met a foreigner who didn't like the stuff? It's fantastic! Who wouldn't buy this? It's not like bitter melon or dorian fruit where the downside is so obvious people have to try to talk you into it. The stuff sells itself.

I earlier had ordered the "Zico Coconut Water" which was more expensive than this one. I must say that when I tasted Vita Coco, it tasted the same as Zico. Plus its 4 $ cheaper than Zico. Anyone who wants to drink coconut water must try this product. You will never get the taste of "fresh" coconut water but its very close! Will be ordering again.

HAD to say that . . . yes, using their own tag line is corny, but it's true. Had a fresh coconut in Hawaii that the guy just stuck a straw in . . . the most delicious thing I'd ever tasted! This is the closest thing I've come to that in a package. Absolutely delicious! I could live on this stuff!!
reviews.review_header: Like Sticking a Straw in a Coconut!

reviews.review_text: I am not a fan of plastic or wax cartons nor the seal on these . However the product taste's very good . I believe strongly that one should eat a lot of variety and natural foods . This is a wonderful treat and product of the Phillipines .

I usually buy fresh coconuts from grocery stores, open with a chop knife, drink the water and eat the pulp. This time, I decided to go with something easier to open and less messy. After carefully read most of the reviews of all three top brands, I decided to give Vita a try. Maybe I am picky, but the drink doesn't have the nice scent of coconuts, and has a sweet taste which is definitely not coconut. I guess I shouldn't expect too much as it, afterall, is made by mass production. It is a OK drink, if you don't mind whether it is coconut and want something not crazily sweet. But I probably will go back to the fresh coconuts.
reviews.review_header: I love coconut water, but this is not it.

reviews.review_text: Good way for hydration and good price

I just read about the coconut water and decided to buy it for it's affect on aging skin. Turning 38 was not a very good day for me. I looked around and could only find this brand at my local grocery store, so I bought a few flavors and decided to give it a go. Ironically, I bought them on days when I was rushing around and didn't have time to eat. I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes with my son a few years ago and noticed I can have some pretty bad crashes if I don't eat at pretty short intervals. Anyway, I had gone a few hours without eating and drank one of the packs I bought thinking nothing of it. It was about two hours after drinking the beverage that I noticed I had not eaten anything in about four or five hours. I was not hungry and my blood sugar did not take the plunge it usually takes. I was amazed. The very next day, I brought along some coconut water because I had a meeting and knew I was not going to be eating for awhile. The same thing happened. It helped me get through the meeting without crashing. Now, I cannot get through the day without having my coconut water. My favorite is the pineapple. My two year old also loves it. He says, "Uhmm, good!" I would rate this a 10 if I could just for what it does for my blood sugar.
Item accurately described, arrived quickly. I would recommend this to family and friends.
reviews.review_header: I would recommend this to family and friends

reviews.review_text: Greetings fellow amazonians im stuck out here near la this week with my carnival and for the most part its been business as usual, but last night I was starstruck madonna came to the carnival (yes the real madonna not some drag queen from the sunset strip) with her entourage. Quite honestly her companions fit into the carnival atmosphere like no other group I've seen. As she makes her way through the crowd to my basketball hoop and asked if she could take a shot. I said it was two bucks a shot so she pulls out three bottles of vitacoco and hands them to me. I look at her and asked what are these. She says "these are the most refreshing, greatest product that has ever been made and I am working hard to change this to the new national currency." I said whatever and let her and her freakshow take their three shots. When they where done she had hit one of her shots so I gave her a prize (it was one of those chinese finger traps) and off she went. Well I was getting a little thirsty so I opened up one of the "cans" and tasted this "future currency". God! This stuff was awful and to make it worse its like a natural laxative that runs through you in like 20 minutes. I was in the bathroom the rest of the night. This morning I decided to take the last two cans and trade them with the dog-faced boy for a pack of cigarettes. I think I made out on that deal.

Vita-Coco ?? pure JUNK! No need to add sugar to cocowater unless you use old tasteless coconuts. And why so expensive?? Avoid at all costs! Will leave a bad taste in your mouth and hole in your wallet. ♥

If you like Coconut Water, I highly recommend Vita Coco. It has a great taste combined with a healthy dose of vitamin C. The price is way better on Amazon than at the local stores (at least in my area). The 11.1 ounce containers make it perfect for after a workout or packed in a lunch!
Healthy and good source of potassium.

I first bought this last month for my wife after delivery. I have bought 10 cases so far in a month! I drank most of them though! I grew up drinking tender coconut water in India to quench your thirst or when sick. The natural flavor of Vitacoco is very close to the real tender-coconut water. My wife loves this too and she is very choosy when it comes to taste. I drink one when I go home in the evening and I feel rejuvenated drinking this. All natural, no sugars added!I used the coupon coconut4 to get 2 cases for $25 shipped! worth every penny. UPDATE: 2015/04/08 I have bought hundreds of Vita Coco and Zico over the last 8 years. But I recently found out that the Natural water has added sugar, VItamin C. I don't understand. I would like my coconut water to be natural? I still have a case left from my last big purchase of over 12 cases.. Not coming back Vita Coco.. You too are drawn by the profits and shortcuts to it :-(
reviews.review_header: Closest to the real deal! NOT ANYMORE!

reviews.review_text: - taste good, not too sweet - 11oz instead of 16oz (it seems 16oz is regular size found in supermarket) - price is ok, beczuse price of 33.8oz found in supermarket (Walmart) is same price as online (0.11~/oz)

I am a huge fan of natural coconut water but cracking open a coconut shell is not exactly convenient. After trying many brands of coconut water, I can say that VitaCoco is probably one of if the best boxed version of real coconut water. The refreshing taste really does remind me of times I have actually cracked open a coconut on the beeaches in Mexico or even in Belize. And because of its high potency of electrolytes...it is the ultimate hangover cure. One of these before you go to bed after an over beveraged night and you will wake up well rested and refreshed.
It is sweet and delicious. it doesnt come with the coconut meat but it is pretty good regardless. Delivery time is punctual and awesome
reviews.review_header: Good drink but doesnt come with coconut "meat"

reviews.review_text: Bland taste and not actually 100% pure coconut water.

I like the idea of coconut water, and tried this one first. I found it had an unpleasant, canned taste that I really didn't like. Not sure what could cause that, and maybe the flavored ones are OK, but it put me off. I tried the O.N.E. brand and it tasted fresh and clean, so I am sticking with that from now on. UPDATE: I had the chance to try the Vita Coco with passion fruit - either it didn't have the same problem, or the fruit juice masked the canned taste. Anyway, it was fine and I would drink that again, it seems to be only the plain water that was bad. For that, I'm still going to stick with O.N.E.
reviews.review_header: odd, canned taste - O.N.E. was better

reviews.review_text: I'm a big fan of coconut water, but I swear this stuff has pineapple juice in it. I've tried it many times and the stuff I tried is NOT the pineapple juice/coconut water blend which vita coco also makes. But if you want your coconut water to taste like pineapple juice, buy this stuff.
reviews.review_header: But if you want your coconut water to taste like pineapple juice

reviews.review_text: Don't expect coconut water with this brand. Taste like expired coconut water. My experience with this product is similar to most of the comments with one star reviews. Should have read the reviews before purchase. Amazon only refund 50% of what I paid for. Amazon did offer free shipping with repurchase but No Thanks!!!
Not as good if you compare it with the coconut water you obtain when you open up a coconut yourself.
reviews.review_header: Not as good if you compare it with the coconut water you ...

reviews.review_text: Delicious, great price.

Too many good stars clouded my judgment based on experience. I'm an Asian and drink enough fresh coconut water to say this water is not pure and fresh as advertised. Even after several days in the refrigerator, the plastic like taste is still evidence. Real coconut water is very hard to keep it fresh as it turn sour very quickly. I guess they have to do something with the real thing to keep it non-perishable.

I am not from Brazil, but a place called Kerala, India (the very name of the place comes from coconut tree because we have coconut trees all over the place: […] Coconut is an ingredient in everything we cook (from breakfast to lunch to dinner). Vita Coco is by far the closest to fresh tender coconut juice I have tasted. Not 5 stars because still not close to the fresh taste. When you drink fresh coconut water, it has a carbonated feeling (like soda) that it gets naturally which adds to the taste.
reviews.review_header: Very close to fresh coconut water

reviews.review_text: I ordered 2 cases if Vita Coco Coconut Water, they both had a bad taste. They also had a funny after taste. I checked the expiration date but it was fine, May 2015.

I have drunk lot of time coconut water in my childhood because my neighbor was selling young coconut. I read review about VITA and I ordered it, but when I tried it was taste like jaggery water and so color. Usually young coconut water is white but not clear. I think vita is not using original coconut water. Though, it says on it box that pure coconut water. I would suggest buy young coconut box from asian market.

As good as drinking it right from the coconut...the experience comes close to almost real with a straw ;) But really nourishing and packed with natures electrolytes. Very helpful, hydrating and energizing after a strenuous workout!
reviews.review_header: As good as drinking it right from the coconut

reviews.review_text: As an South Indian, I love drinking coconut water esp. on road trip when your body temperature is high. Vita Coco is certainly much better than Zico Pure Coconut Water. I ordered both and I drank Zico yesterday and I couldn't get any taste initially. Slowly I felt like drinking a coconut water later eventhough the real coconut water taste is kind of missing. The taste was just okay. When I was expecting a similar taste on Vita coco, I wasn't disappointed as yesterday. This one certainly had much better taste and felt like drinking coconut water. I don't care about anything else but just the taste!!! Four stars is for not getting the exact fresh 100% coconut water. I am sure there could be some product out in the market, which I need to try.
reviews.review_header: Much better than Zico Pure Coconut Water!!!

reviews.review_text: There is not a consistency in taste over the period of time. Taste differs and not sure whats the reason. All bought from amazon and were fresh batch of products.
reviews.review_header: There is no consistency in taste!!!

reviews.review_text: I tried the unflavored coconut water and was really disappointed. I've sipped coconut water from a coconut. It tastes like coconut. This tastes like diluted syrup made from packets of sugar substitute that have been sitting in the pantry for about five years. It left a sticky feeling in my throat and a stale, artificial and sickly-sweet taste in my mouth.

I haven't read through all of the reviews, so I'm wondering if we are the only ones with this problem. When we first ordered the Vita Coco, my son loved it. However, our most recent case (actually 2 cases) did NOT taste the same as the previous ones. It was 'off' enough that I canceled our subscription.
Love coconut water for our son, instead of using juice. Great taste and keeps him regular!

This Vitacoco is killer rehydration with poquito sugar. I don't care for the flavored versions, but if you love coconut, you'll love this product. After a long day or just some good exercise, a cold one 'll do you right! Order a couple a cases on autoship and save $$!

The taste is natural and good. At the same time, I have tasted few other brands where it is also somewhat sweeter and better. Having tasted so many coconuts directly myself, the selection of coconuts could be a bit better. Still value for money compared for other brands.
reviews.review_header: Natural but I have had better taste elsewere

reviews.review_text: I love this coconut water.
It's got a delicious fresh taste and Vita Coco is always a good brand. My favorite coconut water!
reviews.review_header: ... delicious fresh taste and Vita Coco is always a good brand. My favorite coconut water

reviews.review_text: Several of the containers leaked resulting in a moldy sticky mess. Not sure if the heat played a part, but Amazon would not offer a refund, indicative of Amazon's declining service. Much better to pay a little more at a retail store than to deal with a box covered in a sticky moldy mess. The entire box ended up in the bin, I was not going to try to wash off the containers. Buyer beware when buying grocery items from Amazon
Tastes better than the warehouse store organic stuff, it's also super high in potassium to help with my blood pressure.

I wanted to like it- ran to Whole Foods to try it~ tried both popular brands- has a salty,rather putrid taste. UGH!! Surely this is nor "real" cocoanut water. I drink "REAL" cocoanut water/milk since i live in Florida. And- i understand this won't taste as good however- AAGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! AWFUL!!
Great stuff
decent coconut water. taste is bit off compared to zico

I've tried all the coconut water products available today, as well as coconut water right from a coconut, and this one is my favorite for taste as well as packaging. the container in comes in and the process it goes through to get packaged preserves the nutrients far better than any other method. Even as it sits on the shelf, it doesn't loose nutritional value as quickly as a can does. I love love love this product. Real people, real company work from home with out team [...]
This last shipment did not last good. It had a very old taste. As a person who has been enjoying fresh coconut water from a very early age. This was not the taste of a young fresh coconut.
reviews.review_header: This applies only to my last shipment.

reviews.review_text: Ah, this drink is so refreshing. Sometimes I come in from a hot day and I find myself craving it so bad. It tastes just like drinking water out of a coconut, in my opinion. Without all the hard work!
This product is the worst product as far as coconut water goes. Will never buy it again. I am amazed how good natural product was turned into such a horrible drink.
reviews.review_header: the vita coco with tropical fruit, does not taste at all like coconut water. It taste horrible.

reviews.review_text: MY CAT LOVES THEM
Check prices carefully. I found this at a warehouse store for less than ten dollars. Product is wonderful.
reviews.review_header: Wonderful product but a bit overpriced

reviews.review_text: I drink this every day as its a great source of potassium and hydration! The one thing though is just that odd coconut water taste..not sure if its this product specifically or just in general...it kinda of taste like cereal milk when you get to the bottom of the bowl.
reviews.review_header: Great for a hangover, weird taste

reviews.review_text: It's so close to being such a good thing. It's just loaded with sugar, you can even feel the crash. Come on.
reviews.review_header: Passes itself as a health drink, loaded with sugar

reviews.review_text: Very good taste, has added sugar in it.
Love this coconut water. Bought another brand that comes in cans and can't stand the taste of the can in the water. Like this packaging better...it doesn't effect the taste of the product.
i was very happy with the product as i haven't expected that eatables could be get as fresh as in market. I now prefer to continue purchase it from amazon rather then going out for it.
reviews.review_header: i was very happy with the product as i haven't expected that eatables ...

reviews.review_text: Great Taste, way better than the O.N.E brand. Tried others as well and this is my favorite.

I have tried different brands of coconut water, including O.N.E., and this one is by far better tasting. You'd think all coconut water would taste the same but they don't. It's also the best option for hydration. I would never buy any other sports drink.

I purchased one of these drinks at my local grocery store, because I heard coconut water can help with canker sores, and it totally got rid of my canker sore within two days! I'm not much of a coconut person, but the taste isn't too bad.
of all the coconut water this is my favorite. I am very the Caribbean and know good from not so good coconut water and this is some of the best.

I drink it all the time and granted I never drank straight out of a coconut, but I know ppl who have. I gave them a bottle to try and they thought it was excellent. I'd recommend getting this one instead of the others that are out there.
Eew. Very disappointing. I would sooner buy a young coconut and drill a hole in it. That would actually taste like coconut, not a corn flour tortilla. Don't get it.

This is not only a great way to hydrate, it's also an extremely refreshing drink. I have been enjoying it for the last few months via a local health food store and am so glad to find it here. Taste is excellent. Again, REFRESHING is the word I'd use. Tasty, yet plain. A lot different than other "electrolyte" beverages such as Gatorade. I have made this a regular part of my diet and it's really helped me to stay hydrated this (HOT!!) summer. You will love it!
My wife loves vita coco. The package came intact. Winning.
Not bad, but in my opinion, Pure (brand) coconut water is better and tastes more like the real thing. Definitely better than The brand ONE.
Good to the very last drop
Very good!

Coconut Water is a great source of electrolytes--- perfect for after working out in the yard or any type of exertion--- it has a wonderful natural sweet taste and I appreciate this brand because it does not add anything to the coconut water as other brands do

I have been drinking Vita coco for a while now.....buying from different stores and once here from Amazon. The consistency is all over the place is what I have found. I much rather prefer the Thailand based coconut water products out there...much better tasting than Brazilian
reviews.review_header: some batches are better than others. Not consistent. Thailand coconut water is the best....not Brazilian

reviews.review_text: At first I did not like the taste just because I was thinking it was "milkier coconut" water. Drink one every other day to hydrate my body of nutrients. Love the container. Keep some in my car and at work. I take these on day trips instead of water.

I used to buy these at t\he school cafeteria, but it became too expensive too quickly. Amazon has these for a lot cheaper and they're still the same. While they will never compare to drinking coconut water straight out of a fresh coconut in India, they are the best you can get here. I tried the Goya cans for a little bit, but of the 4 cans I bought, 2 had gone bad and reeked a lot. The other two were passable. On the other hand, I have gone through 4 dozen packs of these and never had a problem with any of them! :)

I use the coconut water with a few strawberries and my Protein powder every morning....Tastes better than using skim milk and the VitaCoco doesn't upset my stomach the way the milk sometimes does. Even alone, it has a light refreshing taste. Just wish it was available online in the 17 oz. size....
This is the closest taste, texture and quality to drinking it right from the coconut. We drink this daily.

I have been trying out coconut waters and so far this is the best. No salty taste like ZICO and i found myself feeling really full afterwards...so probably helps in diet, too. High potassium is great for blood pressure management and the taste is pleasant.

This is the best your going to get except picking a coconut from the tree yourself, punching a hole in it and stabbing in a straw. Great way to stay hydrated without all the toxins you get in soft drinks. I've tried other brands but this one is pure clean coconut water.

Coconut water is my favorite drink and I have to say Vite Coco is the closest to fresh coconut I have tried. Unlike sugary and artificial flavored sports drinks, coconut water is a great and healthy post workout beverage. My only complaint is that it is so hard to find in stores.
Very refreshing, highly recommend!

Let me preface this by saying that I prefer Thai coconuts to South American ones. Having said that, this drink is pretty good, but it's just not as good as a fresh Thai coconut I get from Chinese grocery stores. I probably wouldn't get it again, but if you like Brazilian or Mexican coconuts, this might be a decent alternative.
reviews.review_header: not as good as fresh thai coconuts

reviews.review_text: This stuff is amazing. I can be out all day sweating my brains out and when I am done I down one of these guys and find out I can go on for hours! If I am feeling dehydrated or under the weather...again these guys bring you right back up to speed. Definitely magic juice.

Have you been told to eat your oatmeal to help lower your cholesterol levels? Like milk on yours? While I find the Coco Coconut water alone is great for thirst quenching. I thrive on it mixed with a can of coconut milk. Mixing the two takes the extreme richness and thickness out of straight coco milk, gives it a creamy texture that rivals the old fashioned milkman delievery milk and is yummy on my cereal, oatmeal, smoothies, or just guzzled down.(Can only drink a little cause it's so filling.) So drink up and enjoy! PS went to doctor today, I'm in middle 50's and told my bad cholestrol level is amazingly low. I drink a little of my mix every other day. Use coconut oil daily, & eat butter & have a steak occasionally. So glad I don't have to open a coconut every day to get my milk mustache. Drink up & enjoy - Kathy
reviews.review_header: A better way to eat your oatmeal.

reviews.review_text: This is a thirst quenching drink and it is natural with great health benefits. My mother's electrolytes were messed up due to her sickness and this product helped her leg cramps go away. Her system was low on potassium. Luckily I had some of this in my house, since I love it.

I lived in a country where coconuts are everywhere. When i got here in the USA, i tried so many brands of coconut water. Vita coco is not as good as the real thing but its the closest so far. It's refreshing and arrived on time.

I have been drinking zico 12 packs regularly and decided to give this a try since it was on sale. The taste is no where near coconut water, even though zico isn't perfect, it beats vitacoco's taste by miles. Now, i grew up in coconut country so i do know the true taste of coconut water. Zico feels alot like the real deal, but vitacoco is mostly sugary (how can it be so sweet, that means its artificial. WOW i wonder how people give vitacoco 4 or 5 stars, may be the boxes that i got were the only ones with horrible taste, but i highly doubt that. I haven't tried O.N.E so don't know about that. Zico does it for me!
reviews.review_header: Horible taste, nothing like a coconut

reviews.review_text: Although haven't got best price. The test is very refreshing

I am new to coconut water, so I have been trying many different brands to determine which I like best. I am very disappointed in this product. It does not taste clean, clear, and natural. I wasted money trying this product. Now I know that it is not a product for me in the future. There are so many others that taste fresh and delicious.

Definitely an acquired taste...I reach for it mostly for the nutritional value, not for the taste. I'm a big gatorade and protein mix drinker and was looking at this as a change of pace. Probably won't buy more unless it's on sale again - and if I continue to buy into the health benefits.
Great taste. Great for hydrating. I mix this with gatorade and water for my workout. Help prevent muscle cramping.
This is so good if you drink it cold. I love this and my whole family enjoys it. Very quenching and delicious
reviews.review_header: This is so good if you drink it cold

reviews.review_text: Awsome!

I've tried different coconut water beverages and this is my favorite brand by far. It doesn't have a chemical or off taste like some other brands. It tastes pure and clean..."just like sticking a straw in a coconut".
naturally sweet. one of the betters coconut waters I've tasted

I have been having coconut water since childhood and I must say this is the closest that comes to the natural coconut water. After having tried couple of other brands, I can safely say this is really the best; its so refreshing, specially on a hot day or after a workout.
reviews.review_header: I can safely say this is really the best; its so refreshing

reviews.review_text: great drink and easy to carry for outdoor.

Cannot get my hubby to drink enough water, but this is the ticket. He loves coconut water, and this taste just like the stuff straight out of the coconut! Cool, delicious, and really refreshing...and infinitely more portable than in the big, brown shell...thumbs up!
this tastes awesome!

Coconut milk is a great product for cooking - you can make sauces for cooking and add to smoothies instead of diary... Author of Green Smoothie Recipes & other Healthy Smoothie Recipes: Discover over 50 Easy Smoothie Recipes - breakfast smoothies, green smoothies, healthy ... treat smoothies and fruit smoothie recipes

I'm an Amazon Subscribe & Save Vita Coco buyer but will be switching brands. While fortunately for me the last shipment still states 100% pure, the Vita Coco website has changed that designation and now lists fruit sugar as one of the ingredients. Notice too that the picture on Amazon has also changed - it no longer has a container with "100% pure" listed on it. I was fortunate in that my last shipment was the 100% pure, but it looks like that won't be the case going forward. What a shame. Vita Coco may be slightly less expensive than some of the other brands, but if it's not 100% coconut water then it's a moot point. If I wanted sugar water, I'd buy soda.
It tastes really light. Not like the real one I drunk in Thailand. Maybe it's a different kinds of coconuts.

All I can say is, Vita Coco tastes closer to coconut water compared to One and Zico. My father owns a small coconut plantation and I grew up tasting coconut juice. I tried buying different kinds of brands and it all tasted like crap. Vita Coco however captured the real essence of coco water. This product is highly recommended for busy people who don't want to get dehydrated. On the other hand, if you are bored with ordinary water, this is a perfect alternative. My friends at work also say that Vita Coco is consistent when it comes to taste. Each batch you get is guaranteed fresh and tastes like it came straight out of the coconut. I am going to try other Vita Coco flavors on my next purchase such as the one with pineapple and acai and pomegranate. To sum it, Vita Coco definitely beats out its close contenders.
reviews.review_header: Coco water that tastes more authentic than other brands

reviews.review_text: Just a quick note - we are big coconut water people. This is a great product. Only rated it low due to price. They have this same package at Costco for 17 bucks. That's a pretty significant difference. I'm also a HUGE Amazon person, so I rarely shop around, but I just happened to grab some more at Costco yesterday and saw this today... Even with subscribe and save it's 19 - which isn't so bad for the convenience. Go subscribe and save if you have Amazon Prime.
reviews.review_header: Great prodcut, not such a great price

reviews.review_text: I have drank Vita Coco many times before as well as so many other coconut water drinks. Vita Coco is simply the best tasting, energy packed, splendid coconut water I have ever ever tasted. Don't be fooled by the poor reviews. They are probably from competitors unprofessionally trying to defame Vita Coco! After drinking hundreds+++ of Vita Coco, it is simply GREAT in all respects! You have to try it and you won't want any other!!
Leaks where the spout and the tetra pak join. I always see a few on the supermarket shelves that are leaky. I've had 3 leak (purchased from three different locations).
reviews.review_header: Leaks where the spout and the tetra pak join.

reviews.review_text: This is one of my favorite brands of pure coconut water, it tastes great served ice cold with a straw in a glass, it also tastes delicious blended with smoothies. I can really say the taste is refreshing and I feel revitalized after drinking it. Vita Coco is a good source of potassium and works well to stop my dehydration and chapped lips. My only criticism is that they don't make small cans. For recipe ideas to use in conjunction with Vita Coco I highly recommend Superfruit Smoothies: 50 Healthy Smoothie Recipes for Weight Loss, Energy & Optimum Health .
Vita coconut water is really excellent. It is fresh and tasty and I feeel better than Zico

It's good to have some of these around to boost blood sugars. Unlike most reviewers, I have not used these for running but for "keeping one in my purse." I like how gentle it is on the tummy and how it gives me potassium, which I have to be careful to get enough of. I'd recommend the pineapple flavor too for something slightly more sustaining than a boost, since it has more calories and vitamin C as well (though I'd prefer they added no sugar to the juices; this plain flavor adds no sugar).

I love coconut water and have had to take a machete to lop off the top to get to it. This is good. It is almost as good as the O.N.E. Coconut Water, 11-Ounce Aseptic Containers (Pack of 12) also sold on Amazon. It has a very natural taste as if it has never been in a container. Read the product features above and you can see not only is this product all natural, but good for you. It will quench your thirst, hydrate you and help promote smoother, more hydrated skin. I would drink it again, but for coconut water, I prefer the other brand but this comes in a very close second!
Love it! Great prices. Highly recommend. Whole family drinks and enjoys

I frequently visit Yucatan, Mexico and one of the activities I really enjoy is to visit the coconut vendor and drink fresh coconut water from the fruit in his cooler. Vita Coco is the closest thing I've found to the fresh product, has a refreshing flavor, and I'm sure is quite healthy for the body.
reviews.review_header: Very Much Like the Fresh Juice.

reviews.review_text: Love, love, love this refreshing elixir of the Cosmic Coconut! I have offered a chilled Vita Coco to my guests, to my landscaper, my mechanic, my music partners, and they smacked their lips in pure delight after taking a sip and then downing it wholeheartedly, especially after learning how awesomely it replaces the electrolytes mo' bettah' than a banana! I am a regular customer of Vita Coco and really appreciate the ease of having it shipped automatically to my home!

I bought this for my husband as a I have heard that Coconut Water is good for flushing out the kidneys. I wanted a quality product that wasn't in a tin can and this is exactly what I got. My husband loves the taste and is very happy that I found this company.

This is purely Chemical tastes like Coconut water.I had a worst experience drinking this. The pack we bought recently tastes exactly like a chemical which we smell in chemistry lab. Now I realized that, why the packed foods make our life shorten. Do not drink these.
reviews.review_header: Do not Drink. This is a Chemical NOT Coconut water.

reviews.review_text: Great flavor and natural hydration. I drink it after working out, spending time in the sauna, or just when I need an electrolyte boost. Great flavor - subtle yet thirst-quenching. Great price on Amazon, especially on auto-delivery.
Some batches taste super good... and others not so good. They should do some quality control checks to make sure all cartons are of the same quality.

I never write reviews but I was highly disappointed in the flavor of this coconut water. I grew up drinking fresh and canned coconut water. I thought for sure with all the high reviews, my family and I would love this product. This was a bit bitter and was hard for me to put down. If you've never had this brand, I suggest buying 1 from the market before committing to a case.
I bought it for $13 and change. great deal. Had it set to repurchase and noticed the price was $20 now ... not sure if that's a ploy or the first price was mistake but ... seems shady.
reviews.review_header: great deal. Had it set to repurchase and noticed ...

reviews.review_text: This stuff used to be sourced in Brazil and it was delicious. Now the juice comes from Asia and is sugary, sweeter, thicker, and unpleasant. Economics-driven outsourcing I guess. Avoid it!
reviews.review_header: Vita Coco has changed for the worse

reviews.review_text: I get this at my local Costco. I work out a lot and water is good for you, yes, but I find the vitacoco water to be better: more refreshing, more minerals/electrolytes, essentially the water of life. I still drink water but drink this as well. The only young coconuts I have had are young Thai ones. They are sweeter than this, this is Brazilian and a little less sweet. No problem to me but just so you know. I will be buying this again :)

Vita Coco Coconut Water tastes really bad. I purchased it after reading reviews on line, which shows more than half of all reviews positive. The taste bares a strong resemblance to that chemical liquid you must consume in preparation for a colonoscopy. It's not sweet, (despite the 15 gram load of sugar in it) and it's not bitter, just foul tasting.
Use it on popcorn and on other edibles. Top of the line nutrient.

This is part of a recurring order for me and my family. We obviously love the product. The review is more to make sure folks realize how awesome Amazon really is. I had my package stolen ( yes there are people who will steal anything) today afternoon. I informed the cops. For those with multiple allergies and/or sensitivities coconut water can be an excellent replacement for high fructose corn syrup, aspartame, and food coloring loaded electrolyte drinks. Electrolytes can be a life saver if I get a migraine or sick from an allergy attack. When I discovered that coconut water can work in this way I determined to go buy a case at Costco. My nearest Costco carries this brand. Reading the label it says "100% coconut water," but the ingredients says "coconut water, citric acid." That does NOT add up to 100% coconut water. What's the big deal? For most reading this probably nothing. But if you have mold allergies, are one of the rapidly growing number of people with a corn allergy, or you wish to avoid GMO's, citric acid can be a concern. A great bulk of citric acid is manufactured by growing a mold in a medium of GMO corn. It can be difficult to find out the source of a company's citric acid. If your allergy/sensitivity to corn or mold is severe, you may have a reaction to this brand. I gave this two stars for mislabeling and to be fair, I did not try this product for reasons stated above.
reviews.review_header: NOT 100 % cocnut water. Alergy allert for mold and corn

One reviewer described his case of Vita Coco Coconut Water as bad tasting sweet and sour water. Based on the reactions of those who sampled from our case, the description is apt. I understand from recent reviews that coconut water is an acquired taste. Fair enough. For those who love coconut water this sounds like a fantastic deal. Our family and friends, however, can't down one of these, let alone think about two. Descriptions range from 'gross' to 'not my cup of tea' to 'its bad'. We can't give the stuff away. So don't repeat our mistake and assume that you're going to like this stuff if you like the taste of coconut. (Our batch tasted nothing like it.)

Salutations from Kissimmee, FL. Population, 59,682. In September of 2004 I began growing and harvesting award-winning coconuts for our local 4H county fair. I take pride in all the usual aspects of coconut-growing: size, firmness, texture, taste, acidity (ph balance), half-life, color contrast, hair length, you name it. But what's a coconut without a good coconut tree? With Kissimmee's prestigious 17.32 square miles of flat, dry, barren land, it's difficult to keep those babies adequately hydrated. Even more difficult is doing this naturally. So when I learned about Vita Coco Pure Coconut Water ("Naturally Hydrating"), I immediately, like so many other well-meaning customers, believed I would increase my fertility, output and produce quality by tenfold, at least. I filled my water tank with about 5,000 of these little guys and began pumping it through my complex sprinkler system to water my plantation. The first thing I noticed was that it clogged up all my underground pipes. Repair cost me in the upper-mid thousands. That's a lot of green. Next, the chalky, white liquid attracted palmetto bugs and mosquitos the size of my right thumbnail. Gross. I'm still applying Gold Bond as the healing process continues. But perhaps the most disturbing aspect of this whole ordeal was when I found out I had been feeding my dear coconut trees the dead fruit of their fallen brothers and sisters. That's right. Coconut water is made FROM coconuts, not FOR them. This is modern-day cannibalism at it's finest, and it's my duty to stand here today and end this madness. I probably wouldn't even be writing this if watering my coconut trees with coconut water had WORKED, but it didn't. All my trees are dead. I'm still giving this item three stars because I had about 4,995 mini-juice boxes leftover after mourning the loss of my dear trees so I decided to drink them out of spite and to join in the suffering of my lost, beloved, livelihood. Surprisingly refreshing, and fruity. I know that's not how this product is intended to be used, but if you're as disappointed as I am and have some extra lying around after investing your entire life savings in something you thought would benefit your crops, try drinking it. It's actually not bad.

Coconut water should be never packed in tetra packs. All over the world there has been great concern about doing this. There is a very subtle element that gets lost when it is removed from its original shell. The water in these tetra packs doesn't even come close to the water in the original shell. I am not just talking about taste, but the after effects. You feel so alive drinking the natural coconut water in those tender coconut shells. I would be very interested to know what Vita Coco does before it packs it into these tetra packs...why have they hidden that part.. Consumer...caution... support coconut water the way nature has preferred it be taken...very soon we will even forgot that coconut water comes from coconut trees. Nature has provided the best protection for it (to preserve taste, and that very subtle thing in it that gets lost when you open it and put it in tetra packs). PLEASE DO NOT PURCHASE THESE TETRA PACKS....Don't support these companies please... Let us drink coconut water right from the shell the way nature wanted us to... It is like milk from cows...you pack it in those plastic bins and keep it for 4 weeks...all pasterized etc...and the taste is gone...real milk never lasts beyond 2 days (and once you taste milk fresh and boiled...you will never touch the milk in those plastic cans...)

Vita Coco has been a long time favorite product that I keep consistently buying it for multiple cases, to the point that my spouse started yelling me to stop ordering it. But hey I cannot since its quality has been very consistent and tastes just like the real coconut. However, I would like to point out that the sugar level is a little bit high so pay attention to how many pouches you drink. When I shop on Amazon I rely heavily on other people’s honest reviews to help me make the right choice on what to buy and what not to buy. So, in turn, I always make sure to leave my HONEST opinions on products that I review. It is my motto that I try to give as much detail as I can right after I experience the product. If you have any questions for me on something I failed to mention, please ask and I will respond quickly. Please be assured the product has earned the rating I have given. ** Please click YES below if this review was helpful! Have a nice day!

reviews.review_text: I've had this brand of coconut water in the 16.9oz and 1 liter sizes, so I assumed this would be of the same quality. Nope. Neither my husband or I could drink it. Like other reviewers stated (which I wish I would've read before I added it to my subscribe and save!), this is sourced from Brazil. It just doesn't taste as good, and it's not clear. Ours wasn't super yellow, but it wasn't what we have come to love. From now on, I'll make sure the coconut water we buy is from Malaysia, Indonesia, or the Philippines-in my experience, those taste much better!

I been trying all 3 the last 2 weeks and personal preference Vita and Zico tasted nearly identical and O.N.E tasted closer to natural coconut. Here are the comparisons in the Listings of the nutritional information for each which is critical if you are watching your sodium, carbs, sugar and caloric intake. Also included what juice from a 100% coconut nutritional information is for comparison purposes. ----------PER 11.1 ounces------------ ZICO----- O.N.E.-----Vita ----- 100% Pure Coconut water 60 -------- 60 -------- 60 -------- 62 Calories 180mg*---- 60mg ----- 45mg ---- 344.6 Sodium 16g*------ 14g ------ 14g ------- 12 Carbohydrates 610mg---- 660mg------ 620mg------ 820.6 Potassium 15g*------ 11g ------- 15g ------- 8 Sugars 10%------ 25mg------- 4%------ 82 Magnesium 0 ---------- 0 --------- 100% --- 7.9 mg Vitamin C 0 ---------- 0 --------- 0 --------- 2.7 Protein Zico has the most sodium and sugar content. Vita 16.9 ounce bottles show 11g of sugar but the 11.1 ounce bottles show 15g. My 2 favorites are O.N.E. and Vita, Zico also is very good I just do not like the high sodium count. O.N.E. has a less sugar taste but more sodium but Vita has less sodium content but also tastes great both are EXCELLENT! Hope this helps out anyone who favors statistics and great taste Vita has a great taste and lower sodium. * Highest count
reviews.review_header: 100% pure coconut water vs Zico vs O.N.E. vs Vita

reviews.review_text: When I drink VitaCoco, it's almost always flavored (pineapple or mango). I used to think I just couldn't stand the taste of coconut water without another fruity infused in it, but after trying other plain coconut waters such as[[ASIN:B002Z04ZNQ Amy & Brian Natural Coconut Juice Pulp Free, 17.5- Ounce Tins (Pack of 12)], I realized that there is nothing wrong with plain coconut water, just mainstream coconut waters such as this one. Not to mention, I think the fruit flavors of VitaCoco just help cover the bad taste. This actually wasn't so bad before I started trying the better coconut waters, so if you're happy with this - stay away from the better ones. You won't want to come back to this! This isn't god-awful, but it's definitely nowhere close to being the best coconut water on the market. Try Amy & Brian's or Taste Nirvana if you want the best, and trust me - REAL coconut waters don't need added fruit flavors; they are simply delicious on their own.

I've tried a few and this is my favorite coconut water on the market. I use this to replenish electrolytes instead of Gatorade (or whatever other brand) after long runs in the heat and humidity. I love the small size too, none of the containers go bad because I didn't finish it!

I fell in love with drinking 'a coconut' on a cruise this summer to the Caribbean. Down there, they just chop off the top of a fresh coconut with a machete, put in a straw, and you have the most refreshing, natural, very gently sweet, drink you could ever want from mother nature. Returning home, I've been trying each brand of coconut water, and it took a couple months to find THIS ONE! Others have added sugar (which ruins the taste to me), but this band really tastes just like what I remembered from the beach of St Thomas, that gently subtle sweet coconut taste... Greg Shay

reviews.review_text: Great product at a great price. Have used the coconut water plain and in smoothies and other drinks. I wasn't sure if I like the taste of it plain at first, but now I really enjoy it. The flavored varieties are also good. I've ordered the variety pack to try different flavors.

I have being buying Vita Coco coconut water for sometime now and consumed probably 2 packs of 12 each by now. However, in one of the recent shipments, I observed one pack was gone bad and turned into complete white colour with bad odur. Since, then we are opening each pack to see if the coconut water has not turned bad instead of directly drinking with the straw. But too our surprise, one of the pack on opening today, we noticed decomposed white flower petals floating inside along with bad smelling coconut water. We were completely shocked and have decided not to buy this product anymore. Amazon.com you should stop selling such products on your site. I hope FDA takes some action as this could be harmful to kids and lead to food poisoning. I wish I could have upload some image with this review of the decomposed flower petals.
reviews.review_header: Decomposed Petal Leaves inside Vita Coco - Do not buy it could be harmful

reviews.review_text: I have nothing to say bad about coconut water. The ingredients do not list any preservatives so that is good. However, I have major issue with the packaging that most of my colleagues (Naturopathic Doctors or MD's) seem to ignore. This product and 99% of the products in these kinds of packaging are lined with very thin aluminum paper like material. As a consumer we must take a stand against all products that are contaminated with aluminum and any other inorganic metals. Kids' juices are sold in aluminum lined cartoons. All sodas are sold in aluminum cans. Aluminum is very toxic and leaches out to the liquids very easily. No wonder we have massive degeneration of health now seen at the teenage level. Unless we stop buying these products the manufacturers will keep on pushing them to the consumer. Do your own investigation on hazards of heavy metals and then decide whether to buy any product that comes in aluminum or aluminum lined cartoons. Again, to make one thing clear, my objection is not on this particular supplier but ALL who market their products in aluminum contaminated packaging.
reviews.review_header: A good product only is as good as the package it comes in
